original: mi rtag gzhan nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag gzhan nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Impermanence and otherness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir rtag pa nyid dam gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag pa nyid dam gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du yin na /
translated: Because if it were permanent or both,

original: 'di gnyi ga yang rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang rung ba ma yin no //
translated: neither would be tenable.

original: des na mi rtag pa nyid gzhan yin na /
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa nyid gzhan yin na /
translated: Therefore, if impermanence is other,

original: chos can 'dzin pa ci ltar yin /
analyzed: chos can 'dzin pa ci ltar yin /
translated: how could it be the apprehender of the subject?

original: re zhig chos can rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig chos can rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: First, it is said that it is not tenable to apprehend the subject as permanent:

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were so, it is said.

original: de lta yin dang rjes su dpag pa las rtag pa nyid mi 'grub po zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rjes su dpag pa las rtag pa nyid mi 'grub po zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If that were the case, permanence would not be established by inference:

original: tshad gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By another valid cognition, it is said.

original: ci ltar mi rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not apprehended as impermanent?

original: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By direct perception, it is said.

original: mngon sum gyis rtag pa nyid du rtogs na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtag pa nyid du rtogs na /
translated: If permanence is realized by direct perception,

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi rjes su dpag pas sel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi rjes su dpag pas sel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: impermanence would not be eliminated by inference.

original: mngon sum gzhan gyis bsal bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gzhan gyis bsal bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The fact that it is not eliminated by another direct perception is stated:

original: mngon sum tshad ma gzhan thams cad kyi ni rtsa ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum tshad ma gzhan thams cad kyi ni rtsa ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and it is the root of all other valid cognitions.

original: rgyal po'i bu dag ni sdom dang chos mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu dag ni sdom dang chos mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The sons of the king are like the vows.

original: sdom ni rang gi bu rnams nyid kyis gsod par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sdom ni rang gi bu rnams nyid kyis gsod par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: The vows are like the sons of the king, for they kill themselves.

original: rgyal bo'i bu pha slu bar byed pa yin no ci ltar rgyal po'i bu pha gsod par 'jug pa de bzhin du mngon sum gyis skyed pa'i tshad ma gzhan dag ni mngon sum sel bar byed ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyal bo'i bu pha slu bar byed pa yin no ci ltar rgyal po'i bu pha gsod par 'jug pa de bzhin du mngon sum gyis skyed pa'i tshad ma gzhan dag ni mngon sum sel bar byed ba ma yin no //
translated: Just as the sons of the king kill their father, so too the other valid cognitions produced by direct perception do not eliminate direct perception.

original: des na gal te rtag pa nyid mngon sum gyis mthong ba yin na /
analyzed: des na gal te rtag pa nyid mngon sum gyis mthong ba yin na /
translated: Therefore, if permanence is seen by direct perception,

original: de'i tshe mngon sum gyis bskyed pa mi rtag pa nyid kyi rjes su dpag pas bsal bar ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon sum gyis bskyed pa mi rtag pa nyid kyi rjes su dpag pas bsal bar ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: then how could impermanence, which is produced by direct perception, be eliminated by inference?

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa ni 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa ni 'dod pa yin /
translated: It is accepted that impermanence is inferred,

original: de yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and that would not exist.

original: mngon sum skyed par byed pa nyid yin par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum skyed par byed pa nyid yin par brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement that it produces direct perception🔽means that it is the cause of the arising of direct perception.

original: tshad ma thams cad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma thams cad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “All valid cognitions” means all valid cognitions of direct perception and inference.

original: mngon sum ma khrang pho ma bstan pa'i rtag pa ni rjes su dpag pa mi rtag par dpog par gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum ma khrang pho ma bstan pa'i rtag pa ni rjes su dpag pa mi rtag par dpog par gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the case that the inference of impermanence contradicts the direct perception of permanence.

original: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du yang chos can 'dzin par mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du yang chos can 'dzin par mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: It is not tenable that the subject is apprehended as having the nature of both.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this objection is “Or else . . .”

original: des ni mngon sum gyis so //🔽'on ci ltar rtag pa nyid dam mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs zhe na /
analyzed: des ni mngon sum gyis so // 'on ci ltar rtag pa nyid dam mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs zhe na /
translated: “By that” means by direct perception.🔽“How is it understood as permanent or impermanent?”

original: rtag pa nyid dam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid dam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Permanent or . . .”

original: lan ni mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'o //🔽rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin brjod pa ni /
analyzed: lan ni mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'o // rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin brjod pa ni /
translated: The response is “Impermanent.”

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the nature of permanence and impermanence is “Because . . .”

original: des cir 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur snyam na /
translated: What follows from that?

original: dngos po zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba'o//
translated: “Things . . .”

original: @127b de la zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gi nang nas rtag par 'dzin pa ni dngos po dus khyab par bzung nas 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: @127b de la zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gi nang nas rtag par 'dzin pa ni dngos po dus khyab par bzung nas 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: “In that case” means that from among the permanent and impermanent, the apprehension of permanence is a transformation that occurs when one apprehends that a thing pervades time.

original: gal te khyab pa de ma bzung na de'i tshe mi rtag par rig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te khyab pa de ma bzung na de'i tshe mi rtag par rig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not apprehend that it pervades, then it would be recognized as impermanent.

original: 'chad pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ If” indicates the explanation.

original: dogs pa ni de nyid ces bya ba ste dus gzhan khyab pa nyid do //
analyzed: dogs pa ni de nyid ces bya ba ste dus gzhan khyab pa nyid do //
translated: “ Fearing” that is, fearing that it would not pervade other times.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni ma rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni ma rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Impermanence would not be understood” means that impermanence would not be understood.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba 'dri ba na mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba 'dri ba na mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The proponent of tenets asks, “Impermanence?”

original: pha rol gyi lan ni de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ste chos can nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi lan ni de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ste chos can nyid kyi'o //
translated: The opponent’s response is “That itself,” that is, the subject.

original: grub ba'i mtha' smra ba rnam par rtag par byed pa ni de zhes bya ba ste mi rtag pa de nyid chos can gyi rang bzhin rtogs pa nyid kyi che yin nam /🔽'on te phyis yin /
analyzed: grub ba'i mtha' smra ba rnam par rtag par byed pa ni de zhes bya ba ste mi rtag pa de nyid chos can gyi rang bzhin rtogs pa nyid kyi che yin nam /🔽'on te phyis yin /
translated: The proponent of tenets analyzes, “That” means that impermanence is either the nature of the subject that is realized or it is something that occurs later.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang po khas len par dogs pa la ni de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang po khas len par dogs pa la ni de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the qualm that one might accept the first conception is “at that time.”

original: dmigs par bya ba nyid du yod do zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba nyid du yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it exists as the object of perception,

original: lan ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the response is “why?”

original: gal te chos can rtogs pa'i dus nyid na mi rtag pa nyid ba ltar rung bar yod pa yin no /
analyzed: gal te chos can rtogs pa'i dus nyid na mi rtag pa nyid ba ltar rung bar yod pa yin no /
translated: If the subject is already existent at the time of understanding the subject, just as impermanence is,

original: de'i tshe chos can mngon sum yin par bzhin du /🔽mi rtag pa nyid kyang ci ste mngon sum gyis ma rtogs /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos can mngon sum yin par bzhin du / mi rtag pa nyid kyang ci ste mngon sum gyis ma rtogs /
translated: then just as the subject is perceived,🔽why is impermanence not perceived by perception?

original: mngon sum gyis ma rtogs kyang /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ma rtogs kyang /
translated: Even if impermanence is not perceived by perception,

original: chos can gyi khyad par du gyur pa'i chos gzhan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chos can gyi khyad par du gyur pa'i chos gzhan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: it is still a property of the subject.

original: ma rtogs na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ma rtogs na zhes gsungs te /
translated: The response to that is “if it is not perceived.”

original: mi rtag pa nyid de ci ltar chos can de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid de ci ltar chos can de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba yin /
translated: How could that impermanence be the nature of that subject?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de'i bdag nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de'i bdag nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is that?🔽“Its nature” is the response.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni 'brel pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni 'brel pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of that itself is “the connection.”

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos gzhan chos can dang 'brel ba ni /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos gzhan chos can dang 'brel ba ni /
translated: If the property of the subject, impermanence, is related to the subject,

original: de rtogs pa'i dus na yod pa yin na de'i tshe gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa nyid de de ltar chos can dang 'brel pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i dus na yod pa yin na de'i tshe gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa nyid de de ltar chos can dang 'brel pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and at the time of the understanding of that, it exists, then at that time, without a doubt, impermanence would be understood as related to the subject.🔽Why?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of that.

original: de ltar ni chos can dang 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni chos can dang 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, it would be related to the subject.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa khas len pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni phyis zhes bya ba ste chos can mngon sum du byas ba'i dus phyis so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa khas len pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni phyis zhes bya ba ste chos can mngon sum du byas ba'i dus phyis so //
translated: The anticipation of a second objection is “Later” means at the time of the perception of the subject.

original: lan ni dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “The object.”

original: gang zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: “ That” means impermanence.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba'i chos can gyi rang bzhin mngon sum du gyur pa'i dus na'o //🔽mi rtag nyid de ci ltar yod //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba'i chos can gyi rang bzhin mngon sum du gyur pa'i dus na'o // mi rtag nyid de ci ltar yod //
translated: “ At that time” means at the time of the perception of the nature of the subject.🔽How could impermanence exist?

original: ces bya ba ste med pa kho na'o ci ltar med snyam na /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste med pa kho na'o ci ltar med snyam na /
translated: It does not exist at all. How is it that it does not exist?

original: brjod pa gzhan du med pa'i yul gyi rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro //🔽yang na gzhan du med pas rtogs @128a * //
analyzed: brjod pa gzhan du med pa'i yul gyi rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro // yang na gzhan du med pas rtogs @128a * //
translated: The realization of the object that does not exist elsewhere would not exist.

original: par 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: par 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or, “because it does not exist elsewhere, there is realization.”

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba med pa nyid du ni /🔽gtan tshigs med pa nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba med pa nyid du ni / gtan tshigs med pa nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: “Elsewhere” means “in nonexistence.”🔽There is realization because there is no reason for it.

original: med pa'i tha snyad nyid du rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad nyid du rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is reasonable that it is a convention of nonexistence.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: “Apprehending” is explained below.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni sngar mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos dang 'bral ba'i chos can tsam rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni sngar mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos dang 'bral ba'i chos can tsam rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: “If” means that if the previous realization of the mere subject that is devoid of the property of impermanence is mistaken,

original: des na mi rtag pa nyid ma dmigs kyang ma dmigs pa las med par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa nyid ma dmigs kyang ma dmigs pa las med par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon med do zhe na /
translated: then, although impermanence is not apprehended, there is no fault in the definition of nonexistence from nonapprehension.

original: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “If.”

original: chos can 'dzin par khas len pa na /
analyzed: chos can 'dzin par khas len pa na /
translated: When apprehending the subject,

original: gal te sgra la sogs pa'i chos can thams cad la 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te sgra la sogs pa'i chos can thams cad la 'jug pa yin na /
translated: if it engages all subjects such as sound,

original: de'i tshe chos can la tshad ma med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe chos can la tshad ma med do //
translated: At that time, there is no valid cognition in regard to the subject.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad mar ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad mar ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how can inference be a valid cognition?

original: ci ste mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think that it cannot be,

original: chos can dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos can dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is said, “The subject and . . .”

original: de ltar na grub pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar na grub pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: If you think that this is not established,

original: mngon sum dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is said, “Direct perception and . . .”

original: 'o na ci ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tshad ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tshad ma yin snyam na /
translated: If you think, “How can direct perception and inference be valid cognitions?”

original: chos can mi rtag pa nyid dang / ldan pa rtogs pa na /
analyzed: chos can mi rtag pa nyid dang / ldan pa rtogs pa na /
translated: then it is said, “When the subject is understood to possess impermanence . . .”

original: de dag de ltar srid pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de dag de ltar srid pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement “it is possible that they exist in that way”

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: means “when . . .”

original: gang gi tshe 'byung ba dang 'byung ba'i rang bzhin mngon sum gyis ma bzung ste mi rtag pa nyid bzung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'byung ba dang 'byung ba'i rang bzhin mngon sum gyis ma bzung ste mi rtag pa nyid bzung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when the elements and the nature of the elements are not apprehended by direct perception, impermanence is apprehended.

original: de'i tshe byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i tshe byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i zhes 'brel to //
translated: At that time, it is connected with “the occurrence of the elements and the occurrence of the nature of the elements.”

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: gtan tshigs chos can dang 'brel pa mngon sum gyis grub pa yod na de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs chos can dang 'brel pa mngon sum gyis grub pa yod na de /
translated: When the relation of the reason to the subject is established by direct perception, then it is possible that the elements and the nature of the elements exist in that way.

original: phyogs kyi chos nyid grub na'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nyid grub na'o //
translated: when the property of the position has been established.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: gang gi tshe 'di mi rtag pa nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di mi rtag pa nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa de'i tshe /
translated: when impermanence is established by direct perception,

original: mtha' gnyis la rjes su dpag par bya nus pa yin te /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis la rjes su dpag par bya nus pa yin te /
translated: then the two extremes can be inferred.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the past and future are hidden.

original: srog chags 'di ni sngon gtong ba byas pa yin te bde bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog chags 'di ni sngon gtong ba byas pa yin te bde bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This living being has previously given gifts, because he is happy.

original: 'di ni bde bar 'gyur te gtod ba po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni bde bar 'gyur te gtod ba po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He will be happy, because he is a giver.

original: 'dis ni bstan bcos goms par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bstan bcos goms par byas pa yin te /
translated: He has studied the treatises, because he is learned.

original: mkhas pa'i phyir ro zhes de ltar mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyogs la ni rjes su dpag pa'i 'bras bu dang bcas bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i phyir ro zhes de ltar mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyogs la ni rjes su dpag pa'i 'bras bu dang bcas bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: In this way, the inference of impermanence has a result.

original: bstan pa'i phyogs la ni mngon sum gyis bstan pa bzung ba na /
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyogs la ni mngon sum gyis bstan pa bzung ba na /
translated: But when the position of the teaching is grasped by direct perception,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag kyang bzung ba'i phyir rjes su dpag ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag kyang bzung ba'i phyir rjes su dpag ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the inference is pointless, because the past and future states are also grasped.

original: rtag pa nyid @128b du smra bas kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag la rjes su dpag pa 'dod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid @128b du smra bas kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag la rjes su dpag pa 'dod pa yang yin te /
translated: Also, the proponents of permanence assert that the past and future are inferred.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i shugs las gzhan gyis kyang mi rtag pa nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i shugs las gzhan gyis kyang mi rtag pa nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, by the power of inference, others also should accept impermanence.

original: 'di yan chad kyis ni nyes pa gnyis bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yan chad kyis ni nyes pa gnyis bstan pa yin te /
translated: Up to this point, two errors have been demonstrated.

original: gal te dngos po rnams rtag pa dang chos thams cad kyang mi 'dzin par 'dod na de'i tshe sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams rtag pa dang chos thams cad kyang mi 'dzin par 'dod na de'i tshe sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: If one asserts that things are permanent and that all phenomena are not apprehended, then at that time the inference “sound is impermanent because it is produced” would not exist,

original: gzhi la grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi la grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be established in the basis.

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis rjes su dpag par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis rjes su dpag par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the two extremes of the past and future would not be inferred,

original: mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because they would be established by direct perception.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni byung ba dang 'byung ba dag rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni byung ba dang 'byung ba dag rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i dus na'o //
translated: At that time means at the time of establishing the past and future by inference.

original: cig shos ni rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: cig shos ni rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: The other is to be inferred.

original: rtag pa nyid kyi phyogs la ni rjes su dpag pa don med pa kho na'o zhes brjod ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyi phyogs la ni rjes su dpag pa don med pa kho na'o zhes brjod ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the case of the position of permanence, inference is meaningless.

original: 'on te mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ni bzung du zin kyang 'khrul pa yod de /
analyzed: 'on te mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ni bzung du zin kyang 'khrul pa yod de /
translated: But if there is error in the case of impermanence and so on, even though the properties are apprehended,

original: des na chos de dag ni rjes su dpag pas nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na chos de dag ni rjes su dpag pas nges pa yin no //
translated: then those properties are ascertained by inference.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa don med par cir 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa don med par cir 'gyur snyam na /
translated: So what is the point of inference?

original: 'khrul pa yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is error,

original: thams cad 'jig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad 'jig ces bya ba ni /
translated: then everything is destroyed.

original: chos rnams thams cad ma bzung na /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ma bzung na /
translated: If all properties are not apprehended,

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos can du 'dzin par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos can du 'dzin par mi 'gyur la /
translated: then there is no apprehension of the subject in any way.

original: chos can gyi mngon sum bzhin du mngon sum thams cad tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: chos can gyi mngon sum bzhin du mngon sum thams cad tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: If all perception is not a valid cognition, like the perception of the subject,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: then there is no inference.

original: des na rnam par rig pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rnam par rig pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there is only mere consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad 'jig pa'i nyams par 'gyur ba des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad 'jig pa'i nyams par 'gyur ba des na'o //
translated: because of that, everything would be destroyed and lost.

original: 'on te rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag ni mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag ni mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin no //
translated: But if permanence and impermanence are not established by perception,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te chos kyang mngon sum gyis grub na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te chos kyang mngon sum gyis grub na /
translated: then, if the property is established by perception,

original: de'i tshe chos kyi yul can gyi rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe chos kyi yul can gyi rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: at that time, the inference having that property would not occur.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: All properties.

original: chos thams cad ma bzung na chos can yang ma bzung bar 'gyur ro zhes lan btab pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma bzung na chos can yang ma bzung bar 'gyur ro zhes lan btab pa ni /
translated: If all properties are not apprehended, then the property-possessor is not apprehended.

original: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is the reply.

original: gal te sgra nyid la sogs pas chos can du bzung yang /
analyzed: gal te sgra nyid la sogs pas chos can du bzung yang /
translated: If sound, etc. is apprehended as the property-possessor,

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par ni bzung ba ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par ni bzung ba ma yin no snyam na /
translated: but impermanence, etc. is not apprehended,

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then,

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa don med pa kho na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa don med pa kho na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: therefore, inference is meaningless. That is the idea.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni @129a * //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni @129a * //
translated: There,

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: with regard to impermanence, etc.

original: 'khrul ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The so-called illusory phenomena are impermanence, etc.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid spangs nas sgra nyid la sogs par 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid spangs nas sgra nyid la sogs par 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one would apprehend sound, etc. after having abandoned permanence and impermanence.

original: tho yor po nyid la sogs pa med par yang rod rod bo tsam blta bar nus kyi /
analyzed: tho yor po nyid la sogs pa med par yang rod rod bo tsam blta bar nus kyi /
translated: One can see mere roughness, etc. without a scarecrow, etc.

original: rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dang bral ba'i don ni ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dang bral ba'i don ni ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: But it is not the case that one can see an object devoid of permanence, etc.

original: mi dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply to that is “A man, etc.”

original: de'i chos can gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i chos can gyi'o //
translated: The property of that is the property of the subject.

original: de yin te zhes bya ba ni khyab pa dang cig shos nyid do //
analyzed: de yin te zhes bya ba ni khyab pa dang cig shos nyid do //
translated: “ That is” is the pervasion and the other.

original: gal te de zhes bya ba khyab pa dang cig shos so //
analyzed: gal te de zhes bya ba khyab pa dang cig shos so //
translated: “ If that” is the pervasion and the other.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: “ That” is the nature of the subject.

original: yul khyab la gzhan du 'dzin pa bzhin du yul khyab pa yang gzhan du 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'god pa ni /
analyzed: yul khyab la gzhan du 'dzin pa bzhin du yul khyab pa yang gzhan du 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'god pa ni /
translated: The objection is stated: “Just as one apprehends the other, the place of the pervasion, so too one would apprehend the other, the place of the pervasion.”

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ If” is the objection.

original: ka ba la sogs pa yan lag can gyi rdzas ni ring po nyid yin yang /
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa yan lag can gyi rdzas ni ring po nyid yin yang /
translated: Even though the substance of the whole, such as a pillar, is long,

original: yan lag 'ga' zhig bsgribs pa'i dus na /🔽ring po nyid du mi 'dzin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: yan lag 'ga' zhig bsgribs pa'i dus na / ring po nyid du mi 'dzin pa de bzhin du /
translated: when some of its parts are obscured,🔽it is not apprehended as long.

original: dus khyab pa'i don la yang khyab pa nyid du 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dus khyab pa'i don la yang khyab pa nyid du 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In the same way, even though the object that pervades time is pervasive, it is not apprehended as pervasive.

original: lan ni ring po mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa la yin no //
analyzed: lan ni ring po mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa la yin no //
translated: The response is: It is apprehended as long by direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shing la sogs pa bsgribs pa der ro //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa bsgribs pa der ro //
translated: Because the obscured tree and so on

original: de ni yan lag can no //
analyzed: de ni yan lag can no //
translated: is the whole.

original: 'o na de gang yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na de gang yin snyam na /
translated: What is that?

original: gzhan gyi lugs kyis de ni yan lag can yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs kyis de ni yan lag can yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: In the system of others, it is said to be the whole.

original: ring po nyid ces bya ba'o//
analyzed: ring po nyid ces bya ba'o//
translated: It is called long.

original: yan lag can ring po yin gyi yan lag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yan lag can ring po yin gyi yan lag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the whole is long, not the parts.

original: yan lag can gyi ring po de yang rjes su dpag par rtogs par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi ring po de yang rjes su dpag par rtogs par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: That whole that is long is to be understood through inference,

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not to be understood through direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba nyid gzhan gyi lugs la gnas nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba nyid gzhan gyi lugs la gnas nas brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of the opponent’s position, which is based on the premise that the existence of a long thing is to be understood through inference, is as follows:

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “It is like this.”

original: gang gi phyir yan lag gcig g-yos par gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yan lag gcig g-yos par gyur na /
translated: Because when one part moves,

original: thams cad kyang g-yo bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir dngos po de ni ring po gcig yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang g-yo bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir dngos po de ni ring po gcig yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: all move, therefore it is understood that that thing is a long one.

original: gal te dngos po gcig yin par ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po gcig yin par ma gyur na ni /
translated: If it were not a single thing,

original: gcig g-yos bas thams cad g-yo bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig g-yos bas thams cad g-yo bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then when one part moves, all would not move.

original: des na gcig pa nyid 'di ni rjes su dpag pa las rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gcig pa nyid 'di ni rjes su dpag pa las rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this oneness is understood through inference.

original: de ltar rjes su dpag pa gnyis bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag pa gnyis bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught two inferences,

original: gnyis pa brjod ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa brjod ba ni /
translated: the second statement is

original: yan lag gcig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag gcig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “one part.”

original: de ltar gzhan gyi lugs kyis rjes su dpag pa brjod nas zlog par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi lugs kyis rjes su dpag pa brjod nas zlog par byed pa ni /
translated: Having thus stated the opponent’s position through inference, the refutation is

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “That is not an inference.”

original: rjes su dpag @129b bas gnyis po gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag @129b bas gnyis po gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: The two, which are inferred, are not inference itself,

original: g-yo ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa gzhan du yang 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa gzhan du yang 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because movement, etc. are also tenable in another way.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir yan lag can dang bral ba phan tshun 'brel pa'i yan lag kho na dpog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽yul khyab ba'i dpe sun phyung nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yan lag can dang bral ba phan tshun 'brel pa'i yan lag kho na dpog pa yin pa'i phyir ro // yul khyab ba'i dpe sun phyung nas /
translated: Because the members themselves, which are devoid of an integral whole, are inferred as mutually related.🔽Having refuted the example of the pervasion of the object,

original: don dus khyab pa nyid sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: don dus khyab pa nyid sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: he refutes the pervasion of the object in time.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ste dus khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ste dus khyab pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the pervasion of time.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The object of inference is not the object of perception,

original: 'on kyang mngon sum gyi yul nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum gyi yul nyid do //
translated: but rather the object of perception itself.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: He states that:

original: mngon sum ma zhugs na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ma zhugs na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “When perception does not engage”

original: tshad ma gzhan ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: The other means of knowledge is inference.

original: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the pervasion.

original: de'i phyir zhes mthong ba dang ma mthong ba gcig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes mthong ba dang ma mthong ba gcig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means because the seen and unseen are not the same.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dus khyab pa'am ma khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dus khyab pa'am ma khyab pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the time that is pervaded or not pervaded.

original: de la ni de ltar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la ni de ltar gnas pa'o //
translated: “In that way” refers to the way it is situated.

original: gal te don 'di dus khyab pa'i rang bzhin du mngon sum gyi yul ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te don 'di dus khyab pa'i rang bzhin du mngon sum gyi yul ma yin na /
translated: If this object, whose nature is pervaded by time, is not the object of perception,

original: de'i tshe khyab pa nyid de dag de'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe khyab pa nyid de dag de'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: then at that time, the pervasion itself is not its nature.

original: khyab pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma khyab pa'i rang bzhin du yul du byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyab pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma khyab pa'i rang bzhin du yul du byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The nature of pervasion is not the nature of non-pervasion, and it is taken as the object.

original: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “By perception” is said.

original: dper na sngon po'i rang bzhin du ni ser po la sogs pa mngon sum gyis yul du byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du khyab pa yang ma khyab par yul du byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na sngon po'i rang bzhin du ni ser po la sogs pa mngon sum gyis yul du byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du khyab pa yang ma khyab par yul du byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, just as yellow, etc. are not taken as objects by perception in the nature of blue, in the same way, pervasion is not taken as an object in the nature of non-pervasion. This is the meaning.

original: de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni ma khyab pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni ma khyab pa nyid du'o //
translated: “Just like that” means just as non-pervasion.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan khyab pa nyid du bzung ba yin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan khyab pa nyid du bzung ba yin na'o //
translated: “Otherwise” means if it is taken as pervasion at another time.

original: byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: “Arising” is said.

original: de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not so.

original: thams cad kyis bya ba'i don byed par thal ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyis bya ba'i don byed par thal ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It does not follow that all things would perform their function at all times.

original: lan ni de zhes bya ba ste dus kyi cha rnams ma bzung na'o //
analyzed: lan ni de zhes bya ba ste dus kyi cha rnams ma bzung na'o //
translated: The answer is: “If the time divisions are not grasped.”

original: dus de tsam zhes bya ba ni da lta ba'i dus dang 'brel pa nyid du'o //🔽de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dus de tsam zhes bya ba ni da lta ba'i dus dang 'brel pa nyid du'o // de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ That much time” means in relation to the present time.

original: dus de tsam dang 'brel bar bzung ba na'o //
analyzed: dus de tsam dang 'brel bar bzung ba na'o //
translated: “ If that were so” means if the time divisions are grasped in relation to that much time.

original: glog la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la glog ni da lta ba'i dus dang 'brel ba tsam du bzung bas skad cig ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: glog la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la glog ni da lta ba'i dus dang 'brel ba tsam du bzung bas skad cig ma nyid yin no //
translated: “ Like lightning, etc.” means that lightning is momentary because it is grasped only in relation to the present time.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: “ If” is a hypothetical question.

original: gzhan dag gis ltar na 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir mi 'jig go zhes lan 'debs ba ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ltar na 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir mi 'jig go zhes lan 'debs ba ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer of others is: “It does not perish because there is no cause of destruction.” “ In that case” is a hypothetical question.

original: 'jig pa'i srid bar dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i srid bar dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The hypothetical question about the possibility of destruction is:

original: gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ How could it be destroyed?”

original: 'di las yang 'jig pa'i rgyu 'di 'dra ba ni don la yang yod do zhes lan 'debs ba ni /
analyzed: 'di las yang 'jig pa'i rgyu 'di 'dra ba ni don la yang yod do zhes lan 'debs ba ni /
translated: In response to this, it is said that in reality, there is a cause of destruction that is similar to this.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In this case, “this” refers to

original: bum ba la sogs pa @130a * //
analyzed: bum ba la sogs pa @130a * //
translated: pots and so on.

original: la'o // rigs mthun ba dus phyis 'byung ba bum pa'i skad cig dang mi mthun pa bya bas non pa'o //
analyzed: la'o // rigs mthun ba dus phyis 'byung ba bum pa'i skad cig dang mi mthun pa bya bas non pa'o //
translated: A later moment that is of a similar type to the pot is not compatible with the moment of the pot, because it is obstructed by the action.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni non pas byas ba'i 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni non pas byas ba'i 'jig pa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the destruction that is caused by the obstruction.

original: dus phyis ma dmigs pa ma grub par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: dus phyis ma dmigs pa ma grub par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Anticipating the qualm that the later nonapprehension is not established, he says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If you think . . .

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: . . . it is not the case.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the case?

original: de nyid ces bya ba ste sngar bzung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ste sngar bzung ba nyid do //
translated: “ Because it is that itself,” that is, it is the same as what was apprehended earlier.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni sngar gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni sngar gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said: “The earlier . . .

original: ci ltar sngar gyi dus ma bzung snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar sngar gyi dus ma bzung snyam na /
translated: How is it that the earlier one is not apprehended?

original: re zhig gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i gzugs ni mngon sum la mi grub pa med do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i gzugs ni mngon sum la mi grub pa med do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: “ First, apart from form and so on, form is not established as perceptible.”🔽“ For a moment” means

original: yud tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yud tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called “moment.”🔽

original: ci ltar mngon sum gyis ma grub snyam na nyi ma dang por zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar mngon sum gyis ma grub snyam na nyi ma dang por zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it not established by perception? “On the first day” and so on.

original: thun dang po nyid la sogs pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thun dang po nyid la sogs pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not realized in the first period and so on.

original: thun gnyis par mngon sum gyis nyin mo la sogs pa rtogs pa med do zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: thun gnyis par mngon sum gyis nyin mo la sogs pa rtogs pa med do zhes 'brel te /
translated: In the second period, it is not realized by perception that there is a day and so on.

original: 'di la gtan tshigs brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la gtan tshigs brjod pa ni /
translated: The reason for this is stated:

original: de'i tshe zhes bya bas de nyi ma dang po la sogs pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya bas de nyi ma dang po la sogs pa'i dus na'o //
translated: “At that time” means on the first day and so on.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis dem grub na dran pas 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis dem grub na dran pas 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa ni /
translated: If it is established by perception, it would be established by memory.

original: nyi ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyi ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The sun” and so on.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de lta ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de lta ma yin pa'o //
translated: “No” means it is not like that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dran pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Memory” and so on.

original: ci ltar zhe na dran pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na dran pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is that? “Memory” and so on.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: This is stated:

original: dran pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Memory” and so on.

original: 'o na mngon sum gyis de 'dzin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum gyis de 'dzin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: Well then, it will be apprehended by perception.

original: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “By perception” and so on.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin mod dus bsags pa'i rang bzhin nyid du ni 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin mod dus bsags pa'i rang bzhin nyid du ni 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: It is not the nature of a single one, but it is the nature of a collection of moments.🔽The response to this is:

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If it is a collection,🔽it is not apprehended by the sense faculties.”🔽The response to this is:

original: lan ni bsags pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni bsags pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.”

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.

original: nyi ma du ma 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gang yin pa des nyi ma bsags pa'i rang bzhin zla ba zhes bya ba'i dus 'dzin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽lan ni mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //🔽mngon sum du ma zhugs so zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma du ma 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gang yin pa des nyi ma bsags pa'i rang bzhin zla ba zhes bya ba'i dus 'dzin no zhes bya ba'i don to // lan ni mngon sum zhes bya ba'o // mngon sum du ma zhugs so zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.

original: dran pas mngon sum du ma rtogs so zhes bya ba yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /🔽dran pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pas mngon sum du ma rtogs so zhes bya ba yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni / dran pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.🔽The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.

original: gang gi phyir dran pa las byung ba yin pa des na /🔽bsags pa'i rang bzhin de ni kun rdzob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dran pa las byung ba yin pa des na / bsags pa'i rang bzhin de ni kun rdzob pa yin gyi /
translated: The sense faculties do not engage with a collection.

original: don dam ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The sense faculties do not engage

original: de lta yin dang ci zhig 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang ci zhig 'grub snyam na /
translated: What is accomplished by this?

original: dus ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Time is the pervader.

original: de khyab ste dus des khyab pa sgra la sogs pa'i don rnams ni kun rdzob ba yin no //
analyzed: de khyab ste dus des khyab pa sgra la sogs pa'i don rnams ni kun rdzob ba yin no //
translated: The objects such as sound, etc., are pervaded by that time, and are conventional.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni @130b don rnams kyi rtag pa kun rdzob pa yin pas na'o //🔽chos rnams chos can gyi rang bzhin yin pa la nyes pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te mi rtag pa nyid ni /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni @130b don rnams kyi rtag pa kun rdzob pa yin pas na'o // chos rnams chos can gyi rang bzhin yin pa la nyes pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te mi rtag pa nyid ni /
translated: Therefore, the objects are permanent in a conventional sense.

original: rang bzhin nyid yin na de'i tshe kun rdzob tu tha dad par ci ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid yin na de'i tshe kun rdzob tu tha dad par ci ltar 'gyur te /
translated: The objection to the thesis that the properties are the nature of the subject is anticipated: If impermanence is the nature of sound, then how can they be different in a conventional sense?

original: don dam pa'i tha mi dad ba ni brtags pa'i tha dad par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i tha mi dad ba ni brtags pa'i tha dad par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, the ultimate nondifference of the two is inconsistent with their difference in a conventional sense.

original: 'gyur yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos por ni mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni nyer len zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos por ni mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni nyer len zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if they are different, it is not tenable that they are the established object and the means of establishing it. This is the response.

original: rnam par rtog pa la gnas ba'i byas pa dang mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la gnas ba'i byas pa dang mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: The nature of the produced and the impermanent is based on conceptual thought.

original: sgrub par byed pa ma yin zhing bsgrub par bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ma yin zhing bsgrub par bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: They are neither the established nor the proof.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: nyer len med par ste /
analyzed: nyer len med par ste /
translated: Because they are without appropriation.

original: don dam pa'i tha dad pa ni nye bar len pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i tha dad pa ni nye bar len pa dang bral bas so //
translated: Ultimate difference is without appropriation.

original: gal te tha dad pa'i nye bar len pa dang bral yang de la gnas pa'i rang bzhin dag ni bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas rtsod bar byed pa nyid kyis smras ba ni /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa'i nye bar len pa dang bral yang de la gnas pa'i rang bzhin dag ni bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas rtsod bar byed pa nyid kyis smras ba ni /
translated: If, although they are without appropriation, the natures that abide in it are the natures of the established and the proof, then the opponent says this in order to dispute, anticipating the qualm:

original: 'brel ba yod ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: 'brel ba yod ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o//
translated: “There is no connection.”

original: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po ni 'brel pa yod bas khyab pa yin na /
analyzed: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po ni 'brel pa yod bas khyab pa yin na /
translated: The state of being the object understood and the means of understanding is pervaded by the existence of a connection.

original: brtags pa'i rang bzhin dag la ni 'brel ba yod pa ma yin te des na de dag ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa'i rang bzhin dag la ni 'brel ba yod pa ma yin te des na de dag ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: But imputed natures do not have a connection. Therefore they are not the state of being the established and the proof.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni 'brel pa yod pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni 'brel pa yod pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is called “the existence of a connection.”

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: “Here it is said” refers to the philosophical position.

original: ma byas pa dang rtag pa gcig las log pa'i du ma ni byas pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gcig gis te /
analyzed: ma byas pa dang rtag pa gcig las log pa'i du ma ni byas pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gcig gis te /
translated: The many that are the opposite of the one that is unproduced and permanent are the one that has the nature of being produced and the one that has the nature of being impermanent.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: This is the understanding through a universal characteristic.

original: 'dis ni spyi'i chos gnyis ba ni khyab pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni spyi'i chos gnyis ba ni khyab pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement, “The second universal characteristic is pervasion.”

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gcig gis yul du byed pas na'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gcig gis yul du byed pas na'o //
translated: “Therefore” means because of the object that is made into one through its nature.

original: gal te gcig nyid rtogs pa kho nas bstan pa yin gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid ga las snyam na /
analyzed: gal te gcig nyid rtogs pa kho nas bstan pa yin gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid ga las snyam na /
translated: If it is said that the understanding is only through the realization of oneness and not through direct perception, then how is this so?

original: dngos po kun gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by “of all things.”

original: gang las log snyam na rigs mthun dang cig shos rigs mi mthun las so //
analyzed: gang las log snyam na rigs mthun dang cig shos rigs mi mthun las so //
translated: If it is asked from what is it the opposite, it is the opposite of the homogeneous and the heterogeneous.

original: des na rdzas 'gro zhes bya ba byas pa nyid dam ba lang nyid rjes su song ba ni /
analyzed: des na rdzas 'gro zhes bya ba byas pa nyid dam ba lang nyid rjes su song ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the so-called “universal” is a mere postulation, and the so-called “inherence” is a mere postulation.

original: rtog pa tsam las gzung bar bya bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa tsam las gzung bar bya bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The so-called “inherence” is a mere postulation.

original: gal te mngon sum rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas ba lang nyid la sogs pa ni spyi ston par byed kyi /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas ba lang nyid la sogs pa ni spyi ston par byed kyi /
translated: If you think that perception with conceptual discrimination perceives the universal, etc.,

original: rnam par rtog ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: and not mere conceptual discrimination,🔽then,

original: des nye bar bstan na ni /
analyzed: des nye bar bstan na ni /
translated: if it is indicated by that,

original: @131a * // dngos po med par 'gyur pa yin no zhes dogs par byed pa ni /🔽rnam rtog bcas pa mngon sum na //
analyzed: @131a * // dngos po med par 'gyur pa yin no zhes dogs par byed pa ni / rnam rtog bcas pa mngon sum na //
translated: it would be a non-entity.🔽Perception with conceptual discrimination

original: zhes bya ba ste rjes su 'gro ba 'dzin ba'i zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste rjes su 'gro ba 'dzin ba'i zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: perceives the universal, etc.,🔽but not mere conceptual discrimination.

original: rjes su 'gro ba mngon sum yin na /🔽snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa'i bsal ba rnams sam /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba mngon sum yin na / snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa'i bsal ba rnams sam /
translated: If the universal is perceived,🔽is it perceived in the individual that is past or future,

original: lhan cig tu gyur pa rnams la yin /
analyzed: lhan cig tu gyur pa rnams la yin /
translated: or is it perceived in the individual that is present?

original: de re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the former,

original: gang gi phyir ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi gsal ba snga ma dang phyi ma la gnas pa nyid la ni mngon sum gyi byed pa 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi gsal ba snga ma dang phyi ma la gnas pa nyid la ni mngon sum gyi byed pa 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the function of direct perception does not engage in the case of a universal such as cowness that remains the same in the prior and subsequent instances.

original: gnyis pa yang ma yin te gang gi phyir lhan cig 'byung ba la yang rjes su 'gro ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa yang ma yin te gang gi phyir lhan cig 'byung ba la yang rjes su 'gro ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the second, because even in the case of co-occurrence, the pervasion is not directly evident.

original: lhan cig par gyur pa dag la yang rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin ni 'ga' yang shes pa med do //
analyzed: lhan cig par gyur pa dag la yang rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin ni 'ga' yang shes pa med do //
translated: And even in the case of co-occurrence, there is no cognition of any nature that pervades.

original: rnam par rtog pa la yang nog dang lkog shal la sogs pa tha na snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la yang nog dang lkog shal la sogs pa tha na snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And in the case of conceptual cognition, the hump, dewlap, and so on appear separately.

original: gal te gsal ba la rjes su zhugs pa'i spyi yod na ni de'i tshe gsal ba gcig dang po mthong ba na yang dmigs par gyur pa de lta na yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba la rjes su zhugs pa'i spyi yod na ni de'i tshe gsal ba gcig dang po mthong ba na yang dmigs par gyur pa de lta na yang ma yin no //
translated: If a universal that pervades the instances exists, then when the first instance is seen, it would be observed, but that is not the case.

original: 'di ltar rtogs pa po gang gis dang po gsal ba'i rang bzhin gcig nyid mthong ba'i rtogs pa po de ni gsal ba de la rjes su 'gro bar te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs pa po gang gis dang po gsal ba'i rang bzhin gcig nyid mthong ba'i rtogs pa po de ni gsal ba de la rjes su 'gro bar te /
translated: Thus, the one who first sees the one nature of manifestation does not see the manifestation that is subsequent to that, i.e., the universal.

original: spyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid du snang ba min no //
analyzed: spyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid du snang ba min no //
translated: He does not see the universal as subsequent to the manifestation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsal ba thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the manifestation of all manifestations.

original: thal ba 'di spong ba'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /🔽thag ring nyid la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thal ba 'di spong ba'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni / thag ring nyid la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection to the response that rejects this reductio is:🔽“The universal is not seen without the manifestation of the particular.”

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba thams cad do //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba thams cad do //
translated: “Manifestation” refers to all manifestations.

original: lan ni gsal ba zhes bya pa'o //🔽gsal ba cha ba byar gyur pa bzung ba med par ni /
analyzed: lan ni gsal ba zhes bya pa'o // gsal ba cha ba byar gyur pa bzung ba med par ni /
translated: The response is:🔽“The universal is not seen without the manifestation of the particular.”

original: gsal ba la khyab par byed pa'i spyi 'dzin pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsal ba la khyab par byed pa'i spyi 'dzin pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The universal that is the pervader of the manifestation cannot be apprehended without the apprehension of the manifestation.

original: khyab bya ma bzung bar na don dam par na khyab byed kyang 'dzin bam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyab bya ma bzung bar na don dam par na khyab byed kyang 'dzin bam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that without the apprehension of the pervaded, the apprehension of the pervader is not ultimately possible.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: “Previously” refers to the objection.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: “Thus” means in general.

original: des na snga na med pa'i gsal ba mthong pa na rjes su 'gro ba dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na snga na med pa'i gsal ba mthong pa na rjes su 'gro ba dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, when one sees a manifestation that did not exist previously, one does not perceive the universal as a concomitant.

original: de dngos zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i dngos po bzung bas bskyed pa'i'o //
analyzed: de dngos zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i dngos po bzung bas bskyed pa'i'o //
translated: “That entity” means that which is produced by the apprehension of the previous entity.

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba snga ma'o //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba snga ma'o //
translated: “Manifestation” means the previous manifestation.

original: don gzhan zhes bya ba ni gsal ba snga ma las gzhan pa'i spyi'o //
analyzed: don gzhan zhes bya ba ni gsal ba snga ma las gzhan pa'i spyi'o //
translated: “Another object” means the universal that is different from the previous manifestation.

original: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba snga ma nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba snga ma nyid la'o //
translated: “In that” means in the previous manifestation.

original: snga na med pa'i don mthong ba zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa'i don gyi mthong ba gang yin pa de'i rgyu ni 'du @131b pa yin no //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i don mthong ba zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa'i don gyi mthong ba gang yin pa de'i rgyu ni 'du @131b pa yin no //
translated: “The cause of the perception of the object that did not exist previously” means that the cause of the perception of the object that did not exist previously is the collection.

original: sngar gyi don mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar gyi don mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The perception of the previous object” means

original: sngar gyi don la yod pa'i mthong ba gang yin pa de ni ste /
analyzed: sngar gyi don la yod pa'i mthong ba gang yin pa de ni ste /
translated: that which is the perception of the object that existed previously.

original: de ni mig la sogs pa kho na'i stobs las skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni mig la sogs pa kho na'i stobs las skye ba yin gyi /
translated: That arises from the power of the eye, etc. alone.

original: 'du byed pa'i stobs las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed pa'i stobs las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not due to the power of the formative forces.

original: de bzhin du phyi ma'i mthong ba yang de'i stobs nyid las yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi ma'i mthong ba yang de'i stobs nyid las yin no //
translated: In the same way, the memory of what was seen in the past is due to the power of the formative forces.

original: 'du byed ni ma mthong ba'i don dran pa'i rgyu yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'du byed ni ma mthong ba'i don dran pa'i rgyu yang ma yin gyi /
translated: The formative forces are not the cause of the memory of an unseen object.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba'i don nyid dran pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba'i don nyid dran pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: However, they are the cause of the memory of the object that was seen.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Cognition is twofold:

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: with conceptual differentiation and without conceptual differentiation.

original: de la 'du byed rnam bar rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yang mthong ba'i don la yin gyi /
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnam bar rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yang mthong ba'i don la yin gyi /
translated: The formative forces are the cause of that cognition which is with conceptual differentiation in regard to the object that was seen,

original: ma mthong ba'i don gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i don gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in regard to another object that was not seen.

original: rnam par rtog pa med par ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med par ni /
translated: However, in regard to that cognition which is without conceptual differentiation,

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la yang rgyur 'gyur mi srid de /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la yang rgyur 'gyur mi srid de /
translated: it is not possible that the formative forces are the cause of that in regard to what was seen or what was not seen.

original: de ni mig la sogs pa kho na'i stobs las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽skabs la sbyor bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: de ni mig la sogs pa kho na'i stobs las 'byung ba'i phyir ro // skabs la sbyor bar byed pa ni /
translated: Because that arises through the power of the eye faculty etc.

original: spyi yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‘also’ is used in the sense of a general application.

original: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang po mthong ba na'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang po mthong ba na'o //
translated: “Not seeing” refers to the first moment of the perception.

original: dran par yang zhes bya ba ni gsal pa gnyis pa mthong ba na'o //🔽spyi ni dran pa dang mthong ba log nas dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dran par yang zhes bya ba ni gsal pa gnyis pa mthong ba na'o // spyi ni dran pa dang mthong ba log nas dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: “Remembering” refers to the second moment of the perception.

original: snga phyi'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga phyi'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The universal is not perceived after the cessation of the memory and the perception” is stated in terms of the prior and subsequent moments.

original: sngar gyi don la ni dran pa /
analyzed: sngar gyi don la ni dran pa /
translated: “The memory is of the prior object,

original: phyis kyi don la ni mthong ba'o //🔽gnyi ga mthong ba la yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyis kyi don la ni mthong ba'o // gnyi ga mthong ba la yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the perception is of the subsequent object.”

original: snga phyi'i gsal ba'i dran pa dang mthong bar ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: snga phyi'i gsal ba'i dran pa dang mthong bar ma zad pa'o //
translated: “Even in the case of the perception of both” means not only in the case of the memory and the perception of the prior and subsequent moments.

original: deng ni zhes bya ba ni mthong ba la'o //🔽gal te mthong ba la spyi snang ba yod do zhes rjes su dpag pa las grub pa ma yin nam zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: deng ni zhes bya ba ni mthong ba la'o // gal te mthong ba la spyi snang ba yod do zhes rjes su dpag pa las grub pa ma yin nam zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: “Now” refers to the perception.🔽“The universal is not perceived in the perception” is stated in terms of the present.🔽“The universal is not perceived in the perception” is stated in terms of the present.

original: mtshungs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //🔽grub pa'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i zhes bya ba'o // grub pa'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: “The universal is not perceived in the perception” is stated in terms of the present.🔽“The universal is not perceived in the perception” is stated in terms of the present.🔽“The universal is not perceived in the perception” is stated in terms of the present.🔽“The universal is not perceived in the perception” is stated in terms of the present.🔽“The universal is not perceived in the perception” is stated in terms of the present.🔽“The universal is not perceived in the perception” is stated in terms of the present.🔽“The universal is not perceived in the perception” is stated in terms of the present.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa snang bar nges pa ni /
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa snang bar nges pa ni /
translated: “The universal is not perceived in the perception” is stated in terms of the present.

original: rjes su dpag pas bsgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas bsgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: “The universal is not perceived in the perception” is stated in terms of the present.

original: 'on kyang rtsig ba snang ngo zhes bya ba'i nges pa ni mngon sum kho na las 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtsig ba snang ngo zhes bya ba'i nges pa ni mngon sum kho na las 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: But the certainty that the wall appears is only from direct perception.

original: 'di skad ces ci ltar skad cig ma nyid snang ba yin yang rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba de bzhin du spyir snang ba yin yang rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di skad ces ci ltar skad cig ma nyid snang ba yin yang rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba de bzhin du spyir snang ba yin yang rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: It is not to be said that just as momentariness is perceived but is to be proven by inference, so too is generality perceived but is to be proven by inference.

original: skad cig bar snang ba ni mngon sum kho nas grub pa yin te /
analyzed: skad cig bar snang ba ni mngon sum kho nas grub pa yin te /
translated: Because momentariness is perceived, it is established by direct perception alone.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gyis dpen bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gyis dpen bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is apprehended by the nature of the prior and subsequent.

original: de bzhin du spyi ni gzung ba ma yin te des na /
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi ni gzung ba ma yin te des na /
translated: In the same way, generality is not apprehended.

original: ci ltar ma rmongs pas skad cig ma nyid 'dzin la /
analyzed: ci ltar ma rmongs pas skad cig ma nyid 'dzin la /
translated: So how is it that the undeluded apprehend momentariness?

original: tha snyad tsam ni rmongs pa la @132a * //
analyzed: tha snyad tsam ni rmongs pa la @132a * //
translated: The mere convention is established for the deluded.

original: sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du ni spyi ni ma rmongs pa sus kyang rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du ni spyi ni ma rmongs pa sus kyang rtogs pa med do //
translated: In the same way, no one, even the undeluded, realizes generality.

original: des na rmongs pa la sgrub par yang ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na rmongs pa la sgrub par yang ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: So how could it be established for the deluded?

original: 'bad pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni dus phyis kyis mi slu ba'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni dus phyis kyis mi slu ba'o //
translated: “Another effort” means a later time.

original: snang bzhin ba'i dus nyid na ni zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang snang ba las phyis kyi dus su yin pa'o //
analyzed: snang bzhin ba'i dus nyid na ni zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang snang ba las phyis kyi dus su yin pa'o //
translated: “At the time of appearance” means that it is not later than the time of appearance.

original: spyi ni sngar snang ba ma yin pas de ci ltar rjes su dpag pas de yod par sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: spyi ni sngar snang ba ma yin pas de ci ltar rjes su dpag pas de yod par sgrub pa'am /
translated: Since the universal does not appear earlier, how can it be established as existent by inference?

original: 'bad ba gzhan byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bad ba gzhan byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Or how can another effort be made?

original: ci ltar sngar shing snang bar grub pa la dus phyis brjod pa na rjes su dpag pas de snang bar sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: ci ltar sngar shing snang bar grub pa la dus phyis brjod pa na rjes su dpag pas de snang bar sgrub pa'am /
translated: Just as, when a tree is already established as appearing earlier, it is established as appearing later by inference,

original: 'bad pa gzhan byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bad pa gzhan byed pa bzhin no //
translated: or another effort is made.

original: 'on te rtsig pa la sogs pa bzhin du spyi yang snang ba kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te rtsig pa la sogs pa bzhin du spyi yang snang ba kho na'o snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the universal also appears just like a wall, etc.,

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Since it is devoid of the nature of manifestation” is said.

original: 'di ga las snyam na /
analyzed: 'di ga las snyam na /
translated: From where?

original: spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The universal” is said.

original: mdog ces bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdog ces bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: “Color” means doubt.

original: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “Well then.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mdog dbyibs las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mdog dbyibs las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “From color and shape.”

original: dogs pa ni khyab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni khyab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Doubt is called pervasion.

original: khyab pa nyid spyi de'i rang gi ngo po yin gyi /
analyzed: khyab pa nyid spyi de'i rang gi ngo po yin gyi /
translated: Pervasion itself is the nature of that universal.

original: mdog dbyibs kyi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mdog dbyibs kyi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of color and shape.

original: des na mdog dbyibs las phyi rol tu gyur pa med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na mdog dbyibs las phyi rol tu gyur pa med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is external to color and shape.

original: lan ni 'o na gsal ba la brten pa'i mdog dbyibs kyis mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i spyi gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: lan ni 'o na gsal ba la brten pa'i mdog dbyibs kyis mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i spyi gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The reply is: Well then, what is the universal that is not similar to color and shape, which are based on manifestation?

original: mi mtshungs pa nyid de mi 'dra ba nyid do //
