analyzed: mi mtshungs pa nyid de mi 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: That is dissimilar, that is unlike.

original: mi mtshungs pa na yang ba lang nyid kyi spyi de khra po la sogs pa bzhin du rta la sogs pa la yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa na yang ba lang nyid kyi spyi de khra po la sogs pa bzhin du rta la sogs pa la yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it is dissimilar, that universal of cowness would exist in horses and so on, just as it does in a cow and so on.

original: 'brel pa la sogs pa yang spangs yin to //
analyzed: 'brel pa la sogs pa yang spangs yin to //
translated: It would also be related and so on.

original: 'on te mdog dbyibs dang ldan pa des na ha cang thal bas ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mdog dbyibs dang ldan pa des na ha cang thal bas ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that it is not due to the absurdity of overextension, since it possesses color and shape,

original: khyab pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyab pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then pervasion is said.

original: grangs can gyi lugs dogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: grangs can gyi lugs dogs par byed pa ni /
translated: The Sāṃkhya system is doubted:

original: mdog dbyibs nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: mdog dbyibs nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: Color and shape themselves.

original: de las tha dad pa'i spyi ni med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i spyi ni med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There is no universal apart from that.

original: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “If” and so on.

original: dus gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //🔽gal te dang po gsal ba mdog dbyibs kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir /
analyzed: dus gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o // gal te dang po gsal ba mdog dbyibs kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir /
translated: “ At another time” is the doubt.

original: khyab pa nyid du ma rtogs pa de lta na yang dus phyis gsal ba gnyis pa la ni rtogs pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: khyab pa nyid du ma rtogs pa de lta na yang dus phyis gsal ba gnyis pa la ni rtogs pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If at first the universal is not realized to be all-pervading because of the nature of the color and shape of the individual, then later, at the time of the second individual, it is realized.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “No” and so on.

original: gang gis res 'ga' rang gi rnam bar shes pa skyed par byed pa /
analyzed: gang gis res 'ga' rang gi rnam bar shes pa skyed par byed pa /
translated: By what is the universal sometimes productive of its own consciousness?

original: khyad par bsgrub tu med pa'i spyi ni gsal ba yod ba dang med ba na khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par bsgrub tu med pa'i spyi ni gsal ba yod ba dang med ba na khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: A universal that cannot be established as a particular does not have a particular that exists or does not exist.

original: 'di ga las snyam na sngon gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ga las snyam na sngon gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From what is this known? “ Previously” and so on.

original: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba ni gsal ba yod pa'i dus bzhin @132b du'o //
analyzed: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba ni gsal ba yod pa'i dus bzhin @132b du'o //
translated: “ Just as before” means just as at the time when the individual exists.

original: gal te sngon gyi gong bu ma zhig pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi gong bu ma zhig pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If the previous mass does not disintegrate,

original: de ci ltar na zhig kyang zhes brjod do snyam na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na zhig kyang zhes brjod do snyam na /
translated: But if one thinks, How can it be said that it is destroyed?

original: sngon gyi zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi zhes bya pa'o //
translated: The word formerly is added.

original: 'on kyang zhig pa nyid de mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhig pa nyid de mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is precisely the destruction that is understood by direct perception.

original: des na sngar gyi gsal ba zhig kyang de kho na ltar rtogs pa'i phyir na gsal ba yod ba dang med pa dag la spyi khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sngar gyi gsal ba zhig kyang de kho na ltar rtogs pa'i phyir na gsal ba yod ba dang med pa dag la spyi khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the previous manifestation is understood to be destroyed in just that way, there is no difference between the existence and nonexistence of the manifestation.

original: des na dang po kho nar khyab pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: des na dang po kho nar khyab pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore, it is said, Either it is understood to be pervasion from the very beginning,

original: yang na ni nam yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig tu nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na ni nam yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig tu nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or it is never so. This is the definite conclusion.

original: sngon gyi khyad par zhig ba na yang spyi 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon gyi khyad par zhig ba na yang spyi 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: When the previous distinction is destroyed, the universal is also destroyed,

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang 'dir 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang 'dir 'dod pa yin no //
translated: because it has the same nature. This is also accepted here.

original: 'di nyid kyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Anticipating this very response, he says, If the universal is destroyed, etc.

original: der zhes bya ba ste yul gzhan na gnas pa'i gong bu de la spyi dmigs pa'i phyir gsal ba zhig pa'i yul du yang ci ltar zhig te ma zhig pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ste yul gzhan na gnas pa'i gong bu de la spyi dmigs pa'i phyir gsal ba zhig pa'i yul du yang ci ltar zhig te ma zhig pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: “There” means in the object that is situated elsewhere, because the universal is perceived.  How could the manifest be destroyed in the object?  It is not destroyed, but is just as it is.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The response to that is “If . . .” and so on.

original: snga mar zhes sngar dmigs pa'i gsal ba dang 'brel ba'i yul du'o //
analyzed: snga mar zhes sngar dmigs pa'i gsal ba dang 'brel ba'i yul du'o //
translated: “In the former” means in the object that is related to the manifest that was previously perceived.

original: de'am ni grangs can gyis so //
analyzed: de'am ni grangs can gyis so //
translated: “That” refers to the Sāṃkhya.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa po gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa po gzhan gyis so //
translated: “Another” refers to another cognizer.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: gal te sngar gyi yul du gsal ba zhig pa na spyi ma zhig na de'i tshe thams cad kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sngar gyi yul du gsal ba zhig pa na spyi ma zhig na de'i tshe thams cad kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the manifest is destroyed in the former object and the universal is not destroyed, then at that time it would be seen by everyone.

original: khyab pa nyid du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa nyid de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa nyid de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: The response to the objection that this is not necessarily so is “If . . .” and so on.

original: dmigs pa kho na zhes bya ba ni mngon par gsal ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa kho na zhes bya ba ni mngon par gsal ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: “Just the object” refers to the manifest state.

original: don 'di yin te sngar gyi yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te sngar gyi yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The meaning is as follows: The former object is of two kinds.

original: dang po ni gong bu'i khyad par can dang / gong bu zhig pa na gong bu med pa can no //
analyzed: dang po ni gong bu'i khyad par can dang / gong bu zhig pa na gong bu med pa can no //
translated: The first is that which is characterized by a mass and that which is not a mass when the mass is destroyed.

original: de la gong bu dang ldan pa'i yul du gong bu dmigs pa na spyi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la gong bu dang ldan pa'i yul du gong bu dmigs pa na spyi dmigs pa yin la /
translated: When the object that possesses a mass is observed as having a mass, the universal is observed.

original: gong bu zhig ba na ni yul de ma khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: gong bu zhig ba na ni yul de ma khyab pa yin te /
translated: When the mass is destroyed, the object is not pervaded by it.

original: gong bu'i rang bzhin mi gsal ba'i ngo bor gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gong bu'i rang bzhin mi gsal ba'i ngo bor gnas pa yin no //
translated: The nature of the mass remains in a state of unclear essence.

original: des na sngar gyi yul du mngon bar gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa la de'i yul khyab par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: des na sngar gyi yul du mngon bar gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa la de'i yul khyab par brjod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the object that was previously clearly manifest by nature is said to pervade its object.

original: mi gsal bas der gnas pa ni yul de ma khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gsal bas der gnas pa ni yul de ma khyab pa yin no //
translated: That which remains there unclearly does not pervade that object.

original: dus khyab pa ni mi gsal ba dang gsal ba'i gnas skabs na gtso bo'i rang bzhin du yod pa tsam gyis yin par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dus khyab pa ni mi gsal ba dang gsal ba'i gnas skabs na gtso bo'i rang bzhin du yod pa tsam gyis yin par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Pervasion in time is merely the existence of the nature of the principal in the states of unclear and clear.

original: yul khyab ba tsam nyid ces bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: yul khyab ba tsam nyid ces bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The mere pervasion of the object is an illustration.

original: mi gsal @133a * //
analyzed: mi gsal @133a * //
translated: Unclear

original: ba'i gnas skabs na ni yul khyab pa yang ma rtogs pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: ba'i gnas skabs na ni yul khyab pa yang ma rtogs pa yin no zhes so //
translated: and when it is in the state of being produced, it does not even realize the extension of the object.

original: grub pa'i mtha' pa mi gsal ba nyid mi srid par bsams nas 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' pa mi gsal ba nyid mi srid par bsams nas 'dri ba ni /
translated: The one who is not clear about the tenets asks:

original: bskal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bskal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “kalpa” means “if.”

original: gzhan gyi lan ni mi snang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lan ni mi snang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent’s answer is “anupalabdhi,” “nonapprehension.”

original: 'di yang mi 'thad do zhes ston pa ni ci ltar zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang mi 'thad do zhes ston pa ni ci ltar zhes bya pa'o //
translated: This is also not tenable. To show this, he says, “How?”

original: snang ba zhes bya ba ni mdog dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba ni mdog dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: “Upalabdhi” means “apprehension.”

original: dogs pa bsu ba ni yul gzhan du zhes bya ba ste gsal ba 'das pa'i yul du'o //
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba ni yul gzhan du zhes bya ba ste gsal ba 'das pa'i yul du'o //
translated: Anticipating an objection, he says, “In another place,” that is, in the place where the manifest has passed.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because they are not different,🔽this distinction is not tenable.

original: rnam par dbye ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni snang pa'i zhes bya ba'o //🔽de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni khyab pa nyid zhig pa na'o //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni snang pa'i zhes bya ba'o // de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni khyab pa nyid zhig pa na'o //
translated: To show this, he says, “The manifestation.”🔽“If that is so” means if the pervasion is destroyed.

original: de ltar gyur na zhes bya ba ni spyi med par gyur na'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na zhes bya ba ni spyi med par gyur na'o //
translated: “In that case” means if the universal does not exist.

original: gal te gong bu las gzhan bdag la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi spyi ni rjes su 'gro ba blo la snang ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gong bu las gzhan bdag la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi spyi ni rjes su 'gro ba blo la snang ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If you think that a universal, which is of the nature of a self, etc., that is different from the individual is not the appearance in the mind of the universal,

original: des na ci ltar de med snyam na /
analyzed: des na ci ltar de med snyam na /
translated: then how can it be nonexistent?

original: gsal ba las zhes bya ba'o //🔽mtshungs pa'i rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas spyi grub par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: gsal ba las zhes bya ba'o // mtshungs pa'i rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas spyi grub par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The reply is: “From the individual.”

original: 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection that it is not tenable that the universal is different from the individual is anticipated and answered:🔽“Well then, the universal would not be different from the individual.”

original: lan ni kha dog dang zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni kha dog dang zhes bya pa'o //
translated: The reply is: “Color, etc.”

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ni mtshungs so zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ni mtshungs so zhes bya bar ro //
translated: “In that way” means “in that these are similar.”

original: yul 'khor gyi rung sa pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i rigs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: yul 'khor gyi rung sa pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i rigs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: “The king’s special domain” is a particular of the royal class.

original: der ni mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa don gcig byed ba nyid kyis byas pa yin no //
analyzed: der ni mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa don gcig byed ba nyid kyis byas pa yin no //
translated: There, the cognition of a similar aspect is produced by the individual.

original: don song zin ba nyid lhag brjod pa'i don du zlos par byed pa ni /
analyzed: don song zin ba nyid lhag brjod pa'i don du zlos par byed pa ni /
translated: The repetition of the word “universal” is for the purpose of restating the point already made:

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Moreover, the universal is not different from the individual.”

original: mu stegs pa gang dag 'di skad ces mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan spyi yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ni mi rigs pa smra ba yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs pa gang dag 'di skad ces mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan spyi yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ni mi rigs pa smra ba yin no //
translated: The tīrthikas who say, “The cause of the cognition that has a similar aspect is a universal,” are speaking nonsense.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir spyi ni rtogs ba ni /🔽don gcig pas byas pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyi ni rtogs ba ni / don gcig pas byas pa'am /
translated: Because a universal is either🔽produced by a single object

original: yang na rgyu gcig gis bskyed par bya bas byas pa yin no bzlog ba brjod pa ni /
analyzed: yang na rgyu gcig gis bskyed par bya bas byas pa yin no bzlog ba brjod pa ni /
translated: or produced by a single cause.

original: spyi'i zhes bya ba'o //🔽bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i spyi ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi'i zhes bya ba'o // bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i spyi ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The negation “not” is added.

original: rten dmangs rigs la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dmangs rigs la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The universal of Brahmin, etc., does not exist because it is shared in common with the basis, the low castes, etc.

original: rtog pa la sogs pa'i rnam gzhag gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i rigs yod par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: rtog pa la sogs pa'i rnam gzhag gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i rigs yod par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The response to the fear that the presentation of thought, etc., is untenable is

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: as follows.

original: lan ni rigs yod par zhes bya ba ste rigs yod kyang sdig dang bsod nams kyi rnam par gzhan pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan ni rigs yod par zhes bya ba ste rigs yod kyang sdig dang bsod nams kyi rnam par gzhan pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say, “Even if the universal exists,” the response is, “Even if the universal exists, there would be no difference in the karmic maturation of sin and merit.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rigs ni gsad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ni gsad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason is “because of the family.”

original: rnam gzhag 'di ni tshad mas grub pa @133b yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rnam gzhag 'di ni tshad mas grub pa @133b yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: This presentation is not established by valid cognition.

original: sdig pa dang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa dang zhes bya'o //
translated: The reason is “because of sin.”

original: lung zhes bya ba nas phyi rol zhe na zhes bya ba'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: lung zhes bya ba nas phyi rol zhe na zhes bya ba'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The debate is from “scripture” up to “external.”

original: nye bar bstan pa'am zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa'am zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The tenet is “the teaching.”

original: nye bar bstan pa ni 'di la ni bram ze zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i brda'o //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa ni 'di la ni bram ze zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i brda'o //
translated: The teaching is the convention “this is a Brahmin.”

original: mtshungs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa nyid ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa nyid ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is there the same apprehension?

original: mtshungs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason is “the same.”

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags gang yin pa dang / nye bar bstan pa gang yin pa ste de dag nyid las so //🔽des par bzung ba'i rnam par gcad par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags gang yin pa dang / nye bar bstan pa gang yin pa ste de dag nyid las so // des par bzung ba'i rnam par gcad par brjod pa ni /
translated: It is from those two, the beginningless latent impressions and the teaching.🔽The exclusion of what is apprehended is stated by “other than that.”

original: de las gzhan ba'i zhes bya ba ste bag chags dang nye bar bstan pa las gzhan no //
analyzed: de las gzhan ba'i zhes bya ba ste bag chags dang nye bar bstan pa las gzhan no //
translated: It is other than the latent impressions and the teaching.

original: rnam ba gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang spyi med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam ba gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang spyi med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the absence of a universal by means of another method,

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis brjod na ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis brjod na ni /
translated: he says, “If the two alternatives are stated . . .🔽”

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Moreover, . . . ” and so on.

original: spyi rtogs pas gsal ba las tha dad pa'i spyi las te rnam pa gang yin pa de rig gam zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog bar gcig go //
analyzed: spyi rtogs pas gsal ba las tha dad pa'i spyi las te rnam pa gang yin pa de rig gam zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog bar gcig go //
translated: “If the cognition of the universal is from the particular, is it in the form of the particular or not? ” This is the first alternative.

original: 'on te gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan yin te /
translated: “Or is it different?

original: rtogs pa tsam yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yin te /
translated: ” “It is mere cognition. ” This is the second alternative.

original: de ltar 'di gdon mi za bar shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di gdon mi za bar shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, this must be understood without a doubt.

original: gzhan du ni ste shes par ma gyur na long ba'i spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ste shes par ma gyur na long ba'i spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: “Otherwise, . . . ” If it is not understood, it would be like the activity of a blind man,

original: gzhal bya nges par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par rtog pa dang po sel ba ni /
analyzed: gzhal bya nges par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro // rnam par rtog pa dang po sel ba ni /
translated: because the object of knowledge would not be ascertained.

original: khyad par las ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par las ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first alternative is eliminated by “from the particular. ”

original: khyad par gyi bdag nyid rig pa nyid mi gsal ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bdag nyid rig pa nyid mi gsal ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the cognition of the nature of the particular is the establishment of the form of the unclear blue, and so on.

original: gnyis bsal ba ni de las gzhan du bya'o ste rtogs pa tsam du rig pas khas len na gzhal bya spyi'i yod pa nyid don dam pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtogs pas spyar ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis bsal ba ni de las gzhan du bya'o ste rtogs pa tsam du rig pas khas len na gzhal bya spyi'i yod pa nyid don dam pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtogs pas spyar ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The second alternative is to be rejected, because if one accepts that the mere understanding is the object, then the mere existence of the object in general is not the ultimate, but rather the mere application of the understanding.

original: 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is “if” and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gsal ba las tha dad pa'i rnam pa dang 'brel ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gsal ba las tha dad pa'i rnam pa dang 'brel ba nyid du'o //
translated: “Thus” means in connection with an aspect that is different from the manifestation.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa las so //
translated: “From that” means from the understanding that has a similar aspect.

original: 'dis ni tshig le 'ur byas pa gnyis kyi phyed snga ma dag bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshig le 'ur byas pa gnyis kyi phyed snga ma dag bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the first half of the second verse.

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the second half is “But if” and so on.

original: don gyi khyad par ni spyi'o //
analyzed: don gyi khyad par ni spyi'o //
translated: The difference in meaning is the general.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa las so //
translated: “From that” means from the understanding.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te rnam pa gzhan gyi rtogs pa las /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te rnam pa gzhan gyi rtogs pa las /
translated: “Otherwise” means if the other is established from the understanding of another aspect.

original: gzhan 'grub na de'i ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan 'grub na de'i ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: There would be the absurd consequence that it would be infinite.

original: bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa las snam bu 'grub par 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar spyi tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa bsal nas /
analyzed: bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa las snam bu 'grub par 'gyur ro // de ltar spyi tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa bsal nas /
translated: A pot would be produced from the concept of a cloth.

original: gnyi ga'i @134a * //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i @134a * //
translated: Thus, having refuted the generality as either different or non-different,🔽the author now refutes it as having the nature of both.

original: rang bzhin can bsal ba'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin can bsal ba'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to do this, he anticipates an objection:

original: de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin no //
translated: “If it is not like that,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is it that

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: they are mutually exclusive?”

original: ci lta 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta 'gal zhe na /
translated: How are they mutually exclusive?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Because” is the reason.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gyi spyi gzhan 'dod pa gang yin ba de gal te gsal ba'i rang bzhin tha dad las /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gyi spyi gzhan 'dod pa gang yin ba de gal te gsal ba'i rang bzhin tha dad las /
translated: The generality that is accepted as having the nature of pervasion, if it is non-different from the different natures of the particulars,

original: tha mi dad de gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe ci ltar tha dad 'gyur te /🔽gsal ba las gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad de gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe ci ltar tha dad 'gyur te / gsal ba las gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then how could it be different, since it would not be different from the particulars?🔽The objection is anticipated:

original: dogs pa bsu ba ni tha dad snang nas te snang ba na tha dad pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba ni tha dad snang nas te snang ba na tha dad pa nyid yin na /
translated: “If it appears as different, then it is different.”🔽The response is:

original: lan ni yang 'di zhes bya ba ste tha dad pa 'di'o //
analyzed: lan ni yang 'di zhes bya ba ste tha dad pa 'di'o //
translated: “This is not so.”

original: tshul 'gas zhes bya ba ni rjes su zhugs pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: tshul 'gas zhes bya ba ni rjes su zhugs pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: “In some way” means by the nature of the subsequent.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni gsal ba las tha dad pa rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni gsal ba las tha dad pa rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “That itself” means that the subsequent nature is not different from the manifest.

original: de lta yin dang rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin de gzhan ma yin pa nyid rgyang bsrings par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin de gzhan ma yin pa nyid rgyang bsrings par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If that were so, then the subsequent nature would be removed from being non-different.

original: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said by “that.”

original: 'di snyam du rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gsal ba las tha mi dad pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gsal ba las tha mi dad pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: One might think, “The subsequent nature is not non-different from the manifest.

original: 'on kyang rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gzhan gyis tha mi dad par 'dod do zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gzhan gyis tha mi dad par 'dod do zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: However, it is asserted that the subsequent nature is not different from another.”

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //🔽gal te de ltar na de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin de ni tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med pa nyid min par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o // gal te de ltar na de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin de ni tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med pa nyid min par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is said by “another.”🔽If that were so, then at that time the subsequent nature would not be different and not non-different.

original: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis bra mi dad pa yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis bra mi dad pa yin na de'i tshe /
translated: But if the subsequent nature itself is not different, then at that time,

original: de nyid kyis tha dad med na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis tha dad med na /
translated: If it were not different from that,

original: de yang ni zhes bya ba tha mi dad pa de yang rnam pa stong 'gyur zhes bya ba rtag tu tha dad med pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽tha mi dad pa de las bton pa ste logs su bkol bas ni /
analyzed: de yang ni zhes bya ba tha mi dad pa de yang rnam pa stong 'gyur zhes bya ba rtag tu tha dad med pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // tha mi dad pa de las bton pa ste logs su bkol bas ni /
translated: then that, i.e., that which is not different, would always be just as it is, i.e., it would always be not different.🔽But it is not so, i.e., it is not the case that the universal is not different from the particulars.🔽And when it is extracted, i.e., separated, from that, i.e., from what is not different, then it is not the universal, i.e., it is not the universal that is not different.

original: spyi der te tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ba kho na'o ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: spyi der te tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ba kho na'o ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir tha mi dad par gyur na tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin zad bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha mi dad par gyur na tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin zad bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if it were not different, then the universal would be exhausted in the particulars.

original: yang na de nyid kyi tha dad med na /
analyzed: yang na de nyid kyi tha dad med na /
translated: Or else, if it were not different from that,

original: spyi de yang rnam pa stong du 'gyur te /🔽tha dad ba dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin gyis mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi de yang rnam pa stong du 'gyur te / tha dad ba dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin gyis mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the universal would be just as it is, i.e., it would be just as the particulars are.🔽Because the nature of the universal would be infinite, i.e., it would have the nature of being both different and not different.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mtha' yas ba'i rang bzhin yin pa las ni ston pas te bsgribs pas na der te spyir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mtha' yas ba'i rang bzhin yin pa las ni ston pas te bsgribs pas na der te spyir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not so, i.e., it is not the case that the universal is infinite.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa du mar brtags pas zad par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa du mar brtags pas zad par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is exhausted by being investigated in many ways.

original: gzhan yang gal te gsal ba rnams las tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gsal ba rnams las tha dad pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if it is different from the manifest,

original: de'i tshe bltar rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bltar rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be visible.

original: gsal bas dben pa'i rang bzhin du bltar @134b rung bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bas dben pa'i rang bzhin du bltar @134b rung bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that it is visible as a nature that is devoid of manifest.

original: tha mi dad na ni ltar mi rung bar 'gyur te gsal ba nyid ba ltar rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad na ni ltar mi rung bar 'gyur te gsal ba nyid ba ltar rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not different, it would be invisible, because the manifest itself is visible.

original: de nyid de'i tshe yod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid de'i tshe yod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Because it exists at that time.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: tha dad tha dad min pa'i tshig gnyis dang / mthong ba mthong ba min pa gnyis rim ba ci lta ba bzhin 'brel to //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad min pa'i tshig gnyis dang / mthong ba mthong ba min pa gnyis rim ba ci lta ba bzhin 'brel to //
translated: The two phrases “different” and “not different” and the two phrases “visible” and “invisible” are connected in the same order.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod ci skyon snyam na /
translated: If you think, “So what? What is the problem?,”

original: mthong dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, “If it is visible. . . . ”

original: mthong du rung ba dang mi rung ba dag ni mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong du rung ba dang mi rung ba dag ni mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to be both visible and invisible by nature, it is not tenable for it to be of the same nature.

original: ci ltar ya mtshan che snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar ya mtshan che snyam na /
translated: How is it so amazing?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like this.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba phan tshun spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can rtags su gyur pa las dngos po yod dang med par ni rigs pas 'grub pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba phan tshun spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can rtags su gyur pa las dngos po yod dang med par ni rigs pas 'grub pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since it is established by reasoning that existence and nonexistence are the evidence of mutual exclusion of seeing and not seeing,

original: spyi'i dngos po ni gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi'i dngos po ni gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: a general entity would be a unity.

original: de ltar khas blangs pa na yang srog chags shi pa yang ma shi ba'i bdag nyid dang gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar khas blangs pa na yang srog chags shi pa yang ma shi ba'i bdag nyid dang gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Even if you accept that, then a living being that has died would be the same as that which has not died.

original: des ni spyi ni bltar rung ba dang mi rung bar 'dod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des ni spyi ni bltar rung ba dang mi rung bar 'dod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should not assert that a universal is visible or invisible.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par khas len na ni rigs pa'i stobs kyis bltar rung ba dang mi rung bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par khas len na ni rigs pa'i stobs kyis bltar rung ba dang mi rung bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that it is different or not different, then it would be visible or invisible by the power of reasoning.

original: bstar rung ba nyid ni bltar mi rung ba med pa yin la bltar mi rung yang bltar med pa yin te /
analyzed: bstar rung ba nyid ni bltar mi rung ba med pa yin la bltar mi rung yang bltar med pa yin te /
translated: The suitable to be seen is not the unsuitable to be seen, and the unsuitable to be seen is not the suitable to be seen.

original: des na 'di dag ni gzhi gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di dag ni gzhi gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two are not the same basis.

original: des na spyi gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du smra ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na spyi gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du smra ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the universal is the nature of both.

original: de ltar don dam pa pa'i spyi rnam pa thams cad du bzlog nas /
analyzed: de ltar don dam pa pa'i spyi rnam pa thams cad du bzlog nas /
translated: Thus, having refuted the ultimate universal in every way,

original: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir brtags pa pa kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir brtags pa pa kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: he says that it is only imagined, because there is no contradiction.

original: de phyir zhes bya ba ste don dam pa'i spyi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de phyir zhes bya ba ste don dam pa'i spyi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because there is no ultimate universal.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni don dam pa pa'i tha dad ba med pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni don dam pa pa'i tha dad ba med pas na'o //
translated: Thus means because there is no ultimate difference.

original: de zhes bya ba ldog pa brtags pa'i tha dad pa med par ro //🔽'dis ni du ma gcig las log pa ni /🔽rang bzhin gcig gis rtogs pas /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ldog pa brtags pa'i tha dad pa med par ro // 'dis ni du ma gcig las log pa ni / rang bzhin gcig gis rtogs pas /
translated: That means the imagined difference of the negated.

original: yul du byed bar 'gyur bya ba'i mjug bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: yul du byed bar 'gyur bya ba'i mjug bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This concludes the statement that the many are the object of the cognition of the one, because they are turned away from the one.

original: gal te de ltar chos dang chos can dag tha dad na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar chos dang chos can dag tha dad na /
translated: If the property and the property-possessor are different in that way,🔽then the cognition of the one would not be the cognition of the many.

original: ci ltar de nyid dang gzhan nyid 'gog snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar de nyid dang gzhan nyid 'gog snyam na /
translated: How is identity and difference refuted?

original: don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the ultimate, etc.

original: rnam par bshad pa mdzad pa'i bzhed pas don 'di yin te /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa mdzad pa'i bzhed pas don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning according to the explanation:

original: kun rdzob pa rtogs pa'i blos bstan pa ni /🔽chos dang chos can gyi mtshan nyid kyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa rtogs pa'i blos bstan pa ni / chos dang chos can gyi mtshan nyid kyi /
translated: The teaching by a mind that understands the conventional🔽is the identity and difference of things that are characterized and have characteristics.

original: dngos po rnams la rnam par gnas pa'i de nyid dang gzhan nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pha pa'i rang bzhin du 'gog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la rnam par gnas pa'i de nyid dang gzhan nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pha pa'i rang bzhin du 'gog par 'gyur te /
translated: That is refuted as having an ultimate nature,

original: gang zhig rnam bar rtog pa can gyi @135a * //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam bar rtog pa can gyi @135a * //
translated: because that which is taught by a mind that has conceptualization🔽is not ultimate.

original: blos bstan pa de ni don dam pa pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du yin no //
analyzed: blos bstan pa de ni don dam pa pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the teaching.

original: ci ltar 'gog snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'gog snyam na /
translated: How is it refuted?

original: don dam par ni rnam par dpyad na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni rnam par dpyad na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the ultimate, when analyzed, etc.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad mas ni chos dang chos can dag tha dad bar mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad mas ni chos dang chos can dag tha dad bar mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a valid cognition of direct perception does not apprehend the characterized and the characteristic as different.

original: des na rtog pa'i blo la mos dang chos can tha dad par snang bas na de tsa ltar bsnyon par nus zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'di bsal ba yin no //🔽tha dad pa ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na rtog pa'i blo la mos dang chos can tha dad par snang bas na de tsa ltar bsnyon par nus zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'di bsal ba yin no // tha dad pa ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, this argument that “it can be refuted because of the appearance of the different subjects and predicates to the conceptual mind” is resolved.

original: kyang de don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyang de don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are different, but that is not ultimate.

original: dza yanta sa ni rnam pa gzhan du 'chad de /
analyzed: dza yanta sa ni rnam pa gzhan du 'chad de /
translated: Jayanta explains it in another way:

original: gal te kun rdzob tu tha dad bar khas len na de'i tshe chos la sogs pa tha dad pa dngos po thams cad la ma grub par ci ltar brjod /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob tu tha dad bar khas len na de'i tshe chos la sogs pa tha dad pa dngos po thams cad la ma grub par ci ltar brjod /
translated: If you accept that they are different conventionally, then how can you say that the difference of phenomena, etc., is not established for all things?

original: kun rdzob tu grub pa gang yin pa de yang don dam par grub pa kho na yin no snyam du dogs na don dam par rnam par dpyad na ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu grub pa gang yin pa de yang don dam par grub pa kho na yin no snyam du dogs na don dam par rnam par dpyad na ni /
translated: If you suspect that whatever is established conventionally is also established ultimately, then when analyzed ultimately,

original: rigs la sogs pa gsal ba dang de nyid de /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa gsal ba dang de nyid de /
translated: the class, etc., is not the manifestation,

original: de'i bdag nyid dper na ba lang khra bo yin no zhes bya ba dang / gzhan nyid de rigs la sogs pa gsal ba la tha dad pa /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dper na ba lang khra bo yin no zhes bya ba dang / gzhan nyid de rigs la sogs pa gsal ba la tha dad pa /
translated: because they are not the same, like a variegated cow, nor are they different, because the class, etc., is not different from the manifestation.

original: dper na 'di'i ba lang nyid ces bya ba de nyid rang gzhan nyid 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na 'di'i ba lang nyid ces bya ba de nyid rang gzhan nyid 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, the very same “cow-ness” is refuted as being the same as or different from the individual cows.

original: gtan tshigs gang gis 'gog snyam na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang gis 'gog snyam na /
translated: By what reason is it refuted?

original: mngon sum gyis de lta bur gyur pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis de lta bur gyur pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because direct perception does not establish it as such.

original: yul gang la gnas nas 'gog snyam na /
analyzed: yul gang la gnas nas 'gog snyam na /
translated: In what domain does the refutation occur?

original: kun rdzob pa'i dngos rnams la ste rtog pa'i bag chags las byung ba rnams la'o zhes so //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i dngos rnams la ste rtog pa'i bag chags las byung ba rnams la'o zhes so //
translated: In the case of things that are conventional, which arise from the latent propensities of conceptual thought.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with “conventional existence,”

original: dbye ba rtog pas grub pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni kun rdzob ba'i zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dbye ba rtog pas grub pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni kun rdzob ba'i zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: up to “the divisions are established by thought,” explains the conventional.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni rjes su zhugs pa dang ldog pa dag go //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni rjes su zhugs pa dang ldog pa dag go //
translated: “Concomitance” and “absence” are “presence” and “absence.”

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni spyi'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni spyi'o //
translated: “That” refers to the general.

original: ba lang ngo snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsgyur ba'i dngos po bdag la sogs pa mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin can gsal ba tsam gyi mthar thug par snang ba ni spyi yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba lang ngo snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsgyur ba'i dngos po bdag la sogs pa mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin can gsal ba tsam gyi mthar thug par snang ba ni spyi yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the thing that is transformed by the conception “cow” is the universal, which has the nature of the unclear manifestation of the self, etc., and is merely the final stage of the manifestation.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa ci ltar snyam na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa ci ltar snyam na /
translated: How is the understanding of the positive and negative concomitance?

original: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
translated: Thus, he says.

original: gsal ba las gzhan ma yin par zhes bya ba ni gsal ba gcig las gzhan ma yin par ro //
analyzed: gsal ba las gzhan ma yin par zhes bya ba ni gsal ba gcig las gzhan ma yin par ro //
translated: Not different from the manifestation means not different from one manifestation.

original: tha dad rnam par gnas zhes bya ba ni spyi dang gsal ba dag go //
analyzed: tha dad rnam par gnas zhes bya ba ni spyi dang gsal ba dag go //
translated: Dwelling in difference means the universal and the manifestation.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid med bas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid med bas so //
translated: Therefore means because of the absence of identity.

original: de ni don dam bar ni zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: de ni don dam bar ni zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni /
translated: He explains the ultimate in the statement, “That is not apprehended by perception in the ultimate.”

original: des na zhes bya ba ste rtog pas grub pa yin pa'i gtan @135b tshigs des na /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ste rtog pas grub pa yin pa'i gtan @135b tshigs des na /
translated: Therefore means because of the reason that it is established by conception.

original: tha dad pa ni don dam bar na mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni don dam bar na mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Difference is not apprehended by perception in the ultimate.

original: gal te rtog pas grub pa yin yang ci ste don dam pa nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtog pas grub pa yin yang ci ste don dam pa nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: If it is established by thought, why is it not ultimate?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of what?

original: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba'i rjes su dpag pa tha dad pa gang la 'jug pa de yang don dam pa nyid yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba'i rjes su dpag pa tha dad pa gang la 'jug pa de yang don dam pa nyid yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: That which is engaged in by inference preceded by perception is also ultimate.

original: des na rtog pas grub pa ni don dam pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na rtog pas grub pa ni don dam pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is intended that what is established by thought is not ultimate.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i tha dad pa'i sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir chos can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad 'di'i sgrub byed de rtags kyi rang bzhin phyogs kyi chos nyid la sogs pa ni kun rdzob tu gnas pa'i ngo bo ste
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i tha dad pa'i sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir chos can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad 'di'i sgrub byed de rtags kyi rang bzhin phyogs kyi chos nyid la sogs pa ni kun rdzob tu gnas pa'i ngo bo ste
translated: Because of that, since there is no proof of difference in the ultimate, the proof of this difference from the nature of the subject, the nature of the reason such as the property of the subject, etc.🔽is a conventional existent.

original: yod pa nyid dang ldan pa gang yin ba de'i dngos po ni nyid do //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang ldan pa gang yin ba de'i dngos po ni nyid do //
translated: The nature of that which possesses existence is that.🔽It exists conventionally.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning.

original: chos can gyi rang bzhin las de nyid gzhan nyid de /
analyzed: chos can gyi rang bzhin las de nyid gzhan nyid de /
translated: From the nature of the subject, it is different.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du na ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du na ni /
translated: If it were of a nature that is different or not different,

original: de nyid du ste don dam par na byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid du ste don dam par na byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then it would not exist ultimately, that is, in reality, as the proof of being produced, etc.

original: 'o na brtags pa'am don dam pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na brtags pa'am don dam pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the imagined, and what is the ultimate?

original: rtog ba tsam las chos can las tha dad par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: rtog ba tsam las chos can las tha dad par gyur pa yin la /
translated: The subject is different from the mere imagination.

original: don dam par ni gsal ba'i dngos po gnas ba yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni gsal ba'i dngos po gnas ba yin no //
translated: But in the ultimate, the entity of the manifestation exists.

original: byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos ni chos can sgra las tha dad pa brtags pa yin la /
analyzed: byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos ni chos can sgra las tha dad pa brtags pa yin la /
translated: The properties of being produced, etc. are imagined to be different from the subject, sound.

original: sgra'i gsal ba na mi ma brtags pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i gsal ba na mi ma brtags pa kho na yin no //
translated: But in the case of sound, the manifestation is not imagined.

original: 'dis ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na mngon sum du grub pa yin pa'i phyir don dam pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na mngon sum du grub pa yin pa'i phyir don dam pa yin gyi /
translated: This shows that the ultimate is only one’s own nature, because it is established by direct perception.

original: rigs la sogs pa'i chos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa'i chos ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the properties of sound, such as its class,

original: rtog pas grub pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pas grub pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: because they are established by thought.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni nyid yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni nyid yin pas na'o //
translated: “Therefore” means “because of that.”

original: de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid du brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid du brjod nas /
translated: Having thus stated that the specific property is established by direct perception,

original: rjes su dpag pas grub bar brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas grub bar brjod pa ni /
translated: he states that it is established by inference:

original: mngon sum sngon du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Direct perception precedes it.”

original: mngon sum gyis ni tshad ma la sogs par rigs mi mthun ba las ldog ba'i me dang du ba'i gsal ba dag 'brel bar grub la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni tshad ma la sogs par rigs mi mthun ba las ldog ba'i me dang du ba'i gsal ba dag 'brel bar grub la /
translated: By direct perception, one establishes the connection between the particular fire and smoke that are differentiated from heterogeneous classes.

original: dus gzhan du ri la sogs par du ba las gsal ba kho na sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: dus gzhan du ri la sogs par du ba las gsal ba kho na sgrub par byed do //
translated: Later, from smoke alone, one infers the particular fire on the mountain, etc.

original: don du gnyer pa rnams ni de nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don du gnyer pa rnams ni de nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who seek the object engage in that.

original: spyi sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a universal that is established,

original: de ni don bya ba don du gnyer pa rnams mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni don bya ba don du gnyer pa rnams mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who seek the object do not desire that.

original: rjes su dpag pa spyi'i yul can yin na ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa spyi'i yul can yin na ni /
translated: If inference has a universal for its object,

original: 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir tsha dam ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni de las zhes bya ba ste gsal ba'i rang bzhin de las @136a * //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir tsha dam ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni de las zhes bya ba ste gsal ba'i rang bzhin de las @136a * //
translated: it would not be a valid means of knowledge, because it would not engage its object.

original: gal te spyi'i gzhan rjes su dpag pas grub na de'i tshe khyad par te gsal ba rnams la ni 'jug bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te spyi'i gzhan rjes su dpag pas grub na de'i tshe khyad par te gsal ba rnams la ni 'jug bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is established by inference of a universal, then it will not apply to the particulars, the instances.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyad par rnams brjod pa med pas te /
analyzed: khyad par rnams brjod pa med pas te /
translated: Because the particulars are not expressed.

original: ma rtogs pas na'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pas na'o //
translated: Because they are not understood.

original: khyad par rnams ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa la rang gi rang bzhin gtod bar byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: khyad par rnams ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa la rang gi rang bzhin gtod bar byed pa ma yin la /
translated: The particulars do not reveal their own nature to the inferential cognition.

original: de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba nyid kyang ma rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba nyid kyang ma rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: And their own characteristics are not unperceived.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In this way,” etc.

original: khyad par snang ba med pa ni khyad par ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par snang ba med pa ni khyad par ma nges pa'o //
translated: The absence of the appearance of the particulars is the non-ascertainment of the particulars.

original: ci'i phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why does it not apply?

original: ma rtogs pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Because of non-understanding,” etc.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa las spyi rtogs bas na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa las spyi rtogs bas na /
translated: If the universal is understood from the inference,

original: khyad par ma rtogs pa 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: khyad par ma rtogs pa 'byung ba yin te /
translated: then the non-understanding of the particulars would occur,

original: khyad par dang bral ba'i spyi ni med do zhes bya ba lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par dang bral ba'i spyi ni med do zhes bya ba lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the system that there is no universal that is devoid of particulars.

original: des na 'jug pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni /🔽'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'jug pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni / 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the engagement of the universal.🔽The response to the objection is “But how can there be engagement with a particular?”

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang spyi dag 'brel pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang spyi dag 'brel pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: “ With that” means the relation of the particular and the universal.

original: lan ni khyad par la 'jug pa de nyid ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: lan ni khyad par la 'jug pa de nyid ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: The response is “How can there be engagement with a particular?”

original: su zhe na /
analyzed: su zhe na /
translated: Who?

original: khyad par rtogs pa med pa'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa med pa'i skyes bu'o //
translated: A person who does not understand the particular.

original: des na 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig go //
analyzed: des na 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig go //
translated: Therefore, this is a statement of the reason.

original: ri'i yul na yod pa'i me ni lkog tu gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: ri'i yul na yod pa'i me ni lkog tu gyur ba yin te /
translated: Fire in a mountainous region is hidden.

original: des na gang gi 'jug par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: des na gang gi 'jug par 'gyur ba /
translated: How can there be engagement with that?

original: rjes su dpag pas gsal ba'i khyad par nges par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gsal ba'i khyad par nges par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: How can there be ascertainment of a particular through inference?

original: des na ni khyad par mi rtogs pas na'o //🔽du ba la sogs pa'i rtogs pa las rtogs pa me la sogs pa'i spyi las rjes su dpag pa'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: des na ni khyad par mi rtogs pas na'o // du ba la sogs pa'i rtogs pa las rtogs pa me la sogs pa'i spyi las rjes su dpag pa'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Therefore, because the particular is not understood.🔽The understanding of fire, etc. , from the understanding of smoke, etc. , is the understanding of the particular, which is the object of inference.

original: gsal ba rtogs pa yin te zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba rtogs pa yin te zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That is, the understanding of fire, etc. , from the understanding of the universal of fire, etc.

original: de lta yin na ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: de lta yin na ci skyon snyam na /
translated: If that is so, what is the problem?

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response is “If that is so . . . ”

original: rjes su dpag pas gsal ba rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gsal ba rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If the manifestation is understood through inference,

original: du bas rjes su dpag pa'i me nyid kyi spyi rtags su gyur ba las rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de las gsal ba rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: du bas rjes su dpag pa'i me nyid kyi spyi rtags su gyur ba las rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de las gsal ba rtogs pa yin no //
translated: then the fire inferred from smoke is the universal of the sign, and the manifestation is understood from that.

original: de'i phyir na de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba gsal ba thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs par mi nus pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba gsal ba thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs par mi nus pas na /
translated: Therefore, at that time, it is not possible to understand the manifestation as a unique particular,

original: yang gsal ba'i spyi gzhan rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang gsal ba'i spyi gzhan rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: so another universal of the manifestation is understood.

original: des na de ltar spyi brgyud pa rtogs pa nyid thug pa med do //
analyzed: des na de ltar spyi brgyud pa rtogs pa nyid thug pa med do //
translated: Thus, the understanding of the universal through a series is endless.

original: dang po nyid ces bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags kyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa skyes pa'i dus nyid na'o //
analyzed: dang po nyid ces bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags kyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa skyes pa'i dus nyid na'o //
translated: At the very beginning means at the time of the arising of inference produced by the power of the sign such as smoke.

original: de ltar yin mod ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar yin mod ci skyon snyam na /
translated: If that is so, what is the problem?

original: gsal ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word manifestation is stated.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa spyi'i yul can yin na 'jug par byed pa nyid ma @136b yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa spyi'i yul can yin na 'jug par byed pa nyid ma @136b yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because inference, having a universal as its object, is not itself engaging.

original: blos bkod pa'i spyi'i phyogs la yang nyes pa 'di nyid yin no snyam par dogs pa ni /
analyzed: blos bkod pa'i spyi'i phyogs la yang nyes pa 'di nyid yin no snyam par dogs pa ni /
translated: This fault also applies to the universal that is posited by the mind.

original: gal te blo'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te blo'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is “In that case, the mind . . .”

original: lan ni de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is “In that case, it is just like that . . .”

original: rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i gsal ba mthong na rnam par rtog pa skye la /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i gsal ba mthong na rnam par rtog pa skye la /
translated: When one sees an instance that is the opposite of a dissimilar type, a conceptual thought arises.

original: rnam par rtog pa las kyang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa dang 'jug pa rnams ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las kyang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa dang 'jug pa rnams ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin no //
translated: And because the result that is characterized by engagement arises from conceptual thought, seeing, conceptual thought, and engagement are things that have the nature of cause and result.

original: gal te spyi blos bkod pa'i phyogs la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la phyi rol la 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te spyi blos bkod pa'i phyogs la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la phyi rol la 'jug pa yin na /
translated: If the thing that has the nature of cause and result in relation to the universal that is posited by the mind is engagement with external objects,

original: 'o na nges kyi yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na nges kyi yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then in that case, the response is “In that case, it is just like that . . .”

original: mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The response to that is “Because they are similar . . .”

original: dang po gsal ba dang spyi dag gis mthong ba bskyed la /
analyzed: dang po gsal ba dang spyi dag gis mthong ba bskyed la /
translated: First, the instance and the universal generate seeing.

original: des ni rnam par rtog pa rtog pas kyang 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des ni rnam par rtog pa rtog pas kyang 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, conceptual thought also engages through conceptualization.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “ This” refers to the reply.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni aa rur dang 'dra bar yin la lha dang 'dra ba ni spyi yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni aa rur dang 'dra bar yin la lha dang 'dra ba ni spyi yin no //
translated: The cause and effect are like the myrobalan fruit, and the universal is like the god.

original: rigs mi mthun pa las log pa'i gsal ba mthong ba na spyir snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa las 'jug pa grub pa na /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las log pa'i gsal ba mthong ba na spyir snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa las 'jug pa grub pa na /
translated: When one sees the manifestation that is the opposite of dissimilar types, the engagement from the appearance of the universal is established.

original: spyi ni ci yang byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyi ni ci yang byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the universal does not do anything at all.

original: 'di nyid 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid 'grel ba ni /
translated: This is explained:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ If” and so on.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi don dam pa ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi don dam pa ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Therefore” means because the ultimate universal does not exist.

original: ci ltar 'di nyid gzung bar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'di nyid gzung bar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is this apprehended?

original: spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ The universal” and so on.

original: gal te spyi dang dngos por gyur pa gsal ba rnams las tha dad pa rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul yin na de'i tshe gsal ba la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te spyi dang dngos por gyur pa gsal ba rnams las tha dad pa rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul yin na de'i tshe gsal ba la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the universal that is the object of inference is different from the entities that are the manifestations, then at that time it would not engage the manifestations.

original: gsal ba ni spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ni spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the particular is not the object of the word.

original: spyod yul du gyur pa ni spyi yin no //
analyzed: spyod yul du gyur pa ni spyi yin no //
translated: The object of the word is the universal.

original: de yang don bya ba byed par mi nus so //
analyzed: de yang don bya ba byed par mi nus so //
translated: And that cannot perform the function of the object.

original: gsal ba ma bstan pa'i phyir ldog pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba ma bstan pa'i phyir ldog pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The particular is not taught, so it is only excluded.

original: ldog pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ldog pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: There is no exclusion,

original: 'jig rten na don bya ba don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na don bya ba don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the world, the function of the object is sought.

original: 'dis ni 'dug par yang mi bya 'gro bar yang mi bya zhes bya ba'i tshul bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dug par yang mi bya 'gro bar yang mi bya zhes bya ba'i tshul bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the method of not staying and not going.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: This is stated:

original: spyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The universal is the object of the word.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba ma rtogs na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba ma rtogs na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if the particular were not understood,

original: 'on te du bas rtogs pa'i me nyid ni gsal ba rtogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te du bas rtogs pa'i me nyid ni gsal ba rtogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: if the fire that is understood by smoke were the particular that is understood,

original: des na der 'jug pa yin no snyam du dogs na gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na der 'jug pa yin no snyam du dogs na gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the particular would be engaged by that.

original: du ba ni rtags kyis rtogs pa'i me nyid kyis gsal ba rtogs par khas len na /
analyzed: du ba ni rtags kyis rtogs pa'i me nyid kyis gsal ba rtogs par khas len na /
translated: If it is accepted that the particular is understood by the fire that is understood by the sign smoke,🔽then the particular would be understood by the universal.

original: du ba de nyid las me'i gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur mod /🔽nges par bzung bas ni me nyid kyi @137a * //
analyzed: du ba de nyid las me'i gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur mod / nges par bzung bas ni me nyid kyi @137a * //
translated: The cognition of the manifestation of fire is from that smoke alone.

original: spyi las me rtogs pa zlog par byed do //
analyzed: spyi las me rtogs pa zlog par byed do //
translated: But the specification “from the universal of fire” excludes the cognition of fire from the universal of fire alone.

original: spyis zhes bya ba ni me nyid kyi spyis so //
analyzed: spyis zhes bya ba ni me nyid kyi spyis so //
translated: The universal of fire is the universal of fire alone.

original: gal te me'i spyi rtags ma yin pa las me'i gsal ba rtogs la du ba nyid ni rtags su gyur ba las me rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir khyad par yod do snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: gal te me'i spyi rtags ma yin pa las me'i gsal ba rtogs la du ba nyid ni rtags su gyur ba las me rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir khyad par yod do snyam du dogs na /
translated: If you think that there is a difference, because the manifestation of fire is cognized from a sign that is not the universal of fire, and fire is cognized from a sign that is the universal of fire,🔽then the response is “even from the universal.

original: spyis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and also by the general.🔽

original: me nyid kyi spyi las me'i gsal ba rtogs pa yang /
analyzed: me nyid kyi spyi las me'i gsal ba rtogs pa yang /
translated: The manifestation of fire is cognized from the universal of fire alone,

original: rtags su gyur pa kho na las yin te /
analyzed: rtags su gyur pa kho na las yin te /
translated: but only from a sign that is the universal of fire.

original: gang dang gang na me nyid yod pa de dang de na me'i gsal ba yod do dper na tshang bang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang na me nyid yod pa de dang de na me'i gsal ba yod do dper na tshang bang bzhin no //
translated: Wherever there is the universal of fire, there is the manifestation of fire, as in a kitchen.

original: 'di na yang me nyid yod do zhes me'i spyi rtags su gyur pa kho na las gsal ba rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di na yang me nyid yod do zhes me'i spyi rtags su gyur pa kho na las gsal ba rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Here, too, the manifestation of fire is cognized from the universal of fire alone, which is a sign of fire.

original: dngos su rtogs na ni /
analyzed: dngos su rtogs na ni /
translated: If it were directly cognized,

original: gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would be the manifestation of fire.

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni du bas rtogs pa'i me'i spyi las ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni du bas rtogs pa'i me'i spyi las ma yin no //
translated: The realization by perception is not from the universal of fire that is realized by smoke.

original: de'i phyir gal te me nyid rtags su gyur pas gsal ba rtogs par byed na de'i tshe de bas nyes pa ci byas /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te me nyid rtags su gyur pas gsal ba rtogs par byed na de'i tshe de bas nyes pa ci byas /
translated: Therefore, if fire itself, which is the reason, causes the realization of the particular, then what is the fault in that?

original: des na spyi ni 'gar yang khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na spyi ni 'gar yang khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the universal is not to be accepted anywhere.

original: gal te spyi'i dngos po mi 'dod na de'i tshe spyi'i chos gnyis khyab pa mi 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te spyi'i dngos po mi 'dod na de'i tshe spyi'i chos gnyis khyab pa mi 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not accept the entity of the universal, then you do not accept the pervasion of two universals.

original: gsal ba gcig gis ni gsal ba gzhan go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba gcig gis ni gsal ba gzhan go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: One particular does not cause the understanding of another particular,

original: khyab pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no relation of pervasion.🔽If you accept the meaning of the universal, then the two universals are the entity of reason and the possession of reason, because there is the relation of pervasion.

original: spyi'i don khas len na ni spyi gnyis rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos po yin te khyab pa'i 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i don khas len na ni spyi gnyis rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos po yin te khyab pa'i 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The anticipation of an objection is “What if . . . ?”

original: gsal ba gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni ri ya  sogs pa na yod pa'i me'i khyad par dang ngo //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni ri ya  sogs pa na yod pa'i me'i khyad par dang ngo //
translated: “Another particular” is the particular of fire that exists in the Himalayas, and so on.

original: rtags su 'gyur ba'i gsal ba ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtags su 'gyur ba'i gsal ba ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The clear light that is the sign is as follows.🔽

original: tshang bang na yod pa'i du ba'i gsal ba'o //
analyzed: tshang bang na yod pa'i du ba'i gsal ba'o //
translated: The manifestation that is the reason is the manifestation of smoke that exists in the kitchen.🔽The manifestation of fire does not exist there.

original: gsal ba dag la ni 'brel pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsal ba dag la ni 'brel pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no relation between the manifestations.

original: me nyid dang du ba nyid kyi spyi dag la ni 'brel ba yod de /
analyzed: me nyid dang du ba nyid kyi spyi dag la ni 'brel ba yod de /
translated: There is a relation between the universals of fire and smoke,

original: de gnyis ni khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those two are pervasive.

original: gal te me nyid kyi spyi rang gi gsal ba rnams kyi khyab par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te me nyid kyi spyi rang gi gsal ba rnams kyi khyab par byed pa yin na /
translated: If the universal of fire is the pervader of its own manifestations,

original: de'i tshe tshang bang du khyab par byed pa'i me nyid rtogs pa na ri la gnas pa'i me'i gsal ba yang khyab bar bya bar rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshang bang du khyab par byed pa'i me nyid rtogs pa na ri la gnas pa'i me'i gsal ba yang khyab bar bya bar rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: then when one realizes the fire that pervades the kitchen, one would also realize the manifestation of fire that exists on the mountain,

original: de lta ma yin na khyab par byed pa nyid du mi rtogs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na khyab par byed pa nyid du mi rtogs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: because if that were not so, one would not realize that it is the pervader,

original: rtogs na yang rjes su dpag pa don med bar 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs na yang rjes su dpag pa don med bar 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: and if one did realize that, then inference would be pointless.

original: spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the response:🔽The universal of fire is not the pervader of all manifestations of fire.

original: me nyid kyi spyi khyab pa nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: me nyid kyi spyi khyab pa nyid du khas len na /
translated: If one accepts that the universal of fire is the pervader,

original: spyi de gsal ba gzhan gyi ste ril gnas pa'i me'i khyad par gyi go byed du ci ltar 'dod de /
analyzed: spyi de gsal ba gzhan gyi ste ril gnas pa'i me'i khyad par gyi go byed du ci ltar 'dod de /
translated: How could that universal, which is manifest in another, i.e., in the particular of fire that exists in the totality, be accepted as the indicator of the particular?

original: mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: It is not!

original: ci'i @137b phyir zhe na /🔽de bzhin nyid du de tshang bang du khyab par bya ba la ltos te /
analyzed: ci'i @137b phyir zhe na / de bzhin nyid du de tshang bang du khyab par bya ba la ltos te /
translated: Why?

original: me'i spyi khyab par byed pa nyid du bzung na'o //🔽me nyid kyi spyi du ba rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: me'i spyi khyab par byed pa nyid du bzung na'o // me nyid kyi spyi du ba rtogs pa ni /
translated: Because, in the case of the universal fire, it is taken to be the pervader, in relation to the pervaded, fire.

original: me'i spyi go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: me'i spyi go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of the universal of fire in smoke is not the cognition of the universal of fire,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is without result.

original: gal te nyes ba 'di ni sangs rgyas pa la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te nyes ba 'di ni sangs rgyas pa la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t this fault the same for the Buddhist?

original: khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po bzung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po bzung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the valid cognition that proves the pervasion grasps the relation between the pervaded and the pervader.

original: de nyid du na zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid du na zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “in that case.”

original: gang gi ltar na nges ba'i shes pa yul dang bcas pa de dag la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi ltar na nges ba'i shes pa yul dang bcas pa de dag la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: For those who have a determinate cognition with an object, this fault would ensue,
