original: bdag cag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag cag la ni ma yin te /
translated: but not for us,🔽because we do not accept that the universal is the object of the cognition of the particular.

original: 'ol gyi rnam pas 'khrul pa'i zhen pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ol gyi rnam pas 'khrul pa'i zhen pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conception of error is engaged by the aspect of smoke.

original: 'o na tshang bar du khyab par byed pa 'dzin pa na khyab par bya ba 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na tshang bar du khyab par byed pa 'dzin pa na khyab par bya ba 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the pervader is apprehended completely, the pervaded is not necessarily apprehended.

original: ma bzung yang dngos po la khyab byed yin pa mi nyams pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma bzung yang dngos po la khyab byed yin pa mi nyams pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Even if it is not apprehended, the pervaded is not damaged in the thing.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If” means:🔽

original: gal te yang me'i spyi khyab pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te yang me'i spyi khyab pa yin na /
translated: if the universal of fire is the pervader,

original: de lta na me'i khyad par de'i rjes su dpag pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i khyab par bya ba ma bzung na ci ltar me'i spyi de'i rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yod pa'i khyab par byed pa yin par 'dzin pa de ltar mi 'dzin mod /
analyzed: de lta na me'i khyad par de'i rjes su dpag pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i khyab par bya ba ma bzung na ci ltar me'i spyi de'i rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yod pa'i khyab par byed pa yin par 'dzin pa de ltar mi 'dzin mod /
translated: then, in that case, if the pervaded is not apprehended at the time of inferring the particular of fire, how is the universal of fire apprehended as the pervader that exists at the time of inferring it? It is not apprehended in that way.

original: de lta na yang de las rtogs pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang de las rtogs pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Even if that is so, it is only understood from that.

original: brjod pa 'brel pa ma bzung ba las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa 'brel pa ma bzung ba las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said: “From not apprehending the relation.”

original: rang gi gsal ba dang 'brel pa ma bzung ba'i me nyid kyi spyi las /
analyzed: rang gi gsal ba dang 'brel pa ma bzung ba'i me nyid kyi spyi las /
translated: From the universal of fire itself, without apprehending the relation with its own manifestation,

original: ri la yod pa'i me'i gsal ba rtogs na ni'o //
analyzed: ri la yod pa'i me'i gsal ba rtogs na ni'o //
translated: If the manifestation of fire on the mountain is understood, then it is.

original: ha cang thal ba'i tshul brjod pa ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa spyi gzhan gyi gsal ba khra bo la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang me nyid kyi spyi las rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba'i tshul brjod pa ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa spyi gzhan gyi gsal ba khra bo la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang me nyid kyi spyi las rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The way in which the absurd consequence is stated is this: “Whatever is the manifestation of the other universal, cow-ness, and so on, that is also understood from the universal fire-ness.”

original: gal te ri la me nyid kyi spyi du ba las yod par rtogs pas me'i gsal ba rtogs par byed na /
analyzed: gal te ri la me nyid kyi spyi du ba las yod par rtogs pas me'i gsal ba rtogs par byed na /
translated: If the manifestation of fire is understood because the universal fire-ness is understood from smoke,

original: de'i tshe pa lang gi gsal ba yang rtogs par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe pa lang gi gsal ba yang rtogs par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time the manifestation of cow would also be understood,

original: 'brel pa ma bzung bar mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma bzung bar mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar in not being grasped in a relation.

original: 'on te gsal ba khra bo de dang me nyid ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhes spyir lan 'debs pa na /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba khra bo de dang me nyid ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhes spyir lan 'debs pa na /
translated: But if you reply in general that “the manifestation of fire is not related to the universal cow-ness,”

original: me nyid ni me'i gsal ba la 'du ba'i 'brel pas 'brel par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: me nyid ni me'i gsal ba la 'du ba'i 'brel pas 'brel par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: then fire-ness would be related to the manifestation of fire by the relation of inherence.

original: des na de dag ni yod pa tsam gyis go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na de dag ni yod pa tsam gyis go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that they are the object and subject of understanding by mere existence.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: “If that is so” is the conclusion.

original: gang gis me dang me nyid gnyis kyis 'brel pa ma bzung ba des kyang me nyid las me rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis me dang me nyid gnyis kyis 'brel pa ma bzung ba des kyang me nyid las me rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even by one who does not apprehend the relation of fire and fireness, fire is understood from fireness.

original: gzhan yang bya ba la sogs @138a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang bya ba la sogs @138a * //
translated: Moreover, that activity, etc.,

original: pa de ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: pa de ni 'di yin te /
translated: is this:

original: me nyid kyi spyi ni me'i gsal bar 'brel gyi khra bo la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes /
analyzed: me nyid kyi spyi ni me'i gsal bar 'brel gyi khra bo la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes /
translated: The universal of fireness is related to the particular of fire, not to the variegated, etc.

original: des na gang du 'brel ba de go bar byed pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: des na gang du 'brel ba de go bar byed pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that whatever is related is the indicator.

original: spyi gsal ba la 'brel to zhes bya ba nyid ci ltar shes par bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi gsal ba la 'brel to zhes bya ba nyid ci ltar shes par bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it to be known that the universal is related to the particular?

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par ro //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par ro //
translated: “Previously” is in the inference for oneself.

original: spyi la zhes bya ba ni rtags kyis rtogs par byas pa'i spyi las so //
analyzed: spyi la zhes bya ba ni rtags kyis rtogs par byas pa'i spyi las so //
translated: “To the universal” is from the universal that is understood through the reason.

original: de'i tshe sgras rtogs pa'i spyi las kyang gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur na 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe sgras rtogs pa'i spyi las kyang gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur na 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: At that time, the particular would be understood from the universal that is understood through the word, but that does not happen.

original: chu klung gi dogs na kha ra'i phung po yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag las ni gsal ba rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chu klung gi dogs na kha ra'i phung po yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag las ni gsal ba rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In such statements as There is a mass of reeds on the bank of the river, there is no apprehension of an individual.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa'o //
translated: The word that refers to the apprehension that arises from a word.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni rtags las byung ba yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni rtags las byung ba yang ngo //
translated: The word all refers to the apprehension that arises from an inference.

original: gal te zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The phrase if you say up to it is not so is the objection.

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa las yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa las yang ngo //
translated: The word all refers to the apprehension that arises from a word.

original: rtags kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa grub pa'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rtags kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa grub pa'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the conclusion begins with the words because the inference....

original: rtags kyis ni spyi nyid rtogs kyi gsal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtags kyis ni spyi nyid rtogs kyi gsal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: An inference does not apprehend an individual, but rather a universal.

original: de rtogs na ni spyi rtogs pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rtogs na ni spyi rtogs pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did apprehend an individual, then the apprehension of a universal would be pointless.

original: des na rtags ni spyi kho na rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na rtags ni spyi kho na rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, an inference is only a means of knowing a universal.

original: gal te de las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase if it were to apprehend an individual

original: rjes su dpag pa'i spyi rtogs pa yin yang gal te gsal ba rtogs na'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i spyi rtogs pa yin yang gal te gsal ba rtogs na'o //
translated: means that even though the universal is apprehended by inference, if it were to apprehend an individual.

original: de'i tshe spyi ste thams cad la ste sgra'i rtogs pa la yang gsal ba rtogs pa yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe spyi ste thams cad la ste sgra'i rtogs pa la yang gsal ba rtogs pa yod pa ma yin /
translated: At that time, there is no cognition of the individual, i.e., the manifestation, in the cognition of the universal, i.e., the sound.

original: dogs pa ni sgras ni spyi tsam zhes bya ba ste gsal ba ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni sgras ni spyi tsam zhes bya ba ste gsal ba ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: The doubt is that the sound is only the universal, not the individual.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni grub ba'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni grub ba'i mtha'o //
translated: “ But” is the conclusion.

original: gal te rtogs las kyang spyi kho na rtogs pa yin pa de'i tshe sgra las ni spyi tsam mo zhes tsam gyi sgra mi bya bar 'gyur na byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gal te rtogs las kyang spyi kho na rtogs pa yin pa de'i tshe sgra las ni spyi tsam mo zhes tsam gyi sgra mi bya bar 'gyur na byed pa yang yin te /
translated: If the universal alone is cognized from the cognition, then the word “only” in the statement “from the sound, only the universal” would be meaningless, but it is used.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa las ni gsal ba rtogs pa yin no zhes khas blang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa las ni gsal ba rtogs pa yin no zhes khas blang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it must be accepted that the individual is cognized from inference.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pas gsal ba rtogs la rag go snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pas gsal ba rtogs la rag go snyam na /
translated: “ But the individual is cognized from inference” is the thought.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Even so” is the response.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rtogs na /
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rtogs na /
translated: “ Previously” is when the individual is cognized.

original: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags de nyid las 'gyur mod /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags de nyid las 'gyur mod /
translated: It would be from that very sign, such as smoke.

original: phyis ci bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyis ci bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the use of the later?

original: spyi ni dngos por yod na ni //
analyzed: spyi ni dngos por yod na ni //
translated: If the universal exists as a thing,

original: 'jug dang ldog pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jug dang ldog pa med par 'gyur //
translated: and there would be no engagement or disengagement.🔽This is the refutation that is stated.

original: zhes sun 'byin pa brjod pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: zhes sun 'byin pa brjod pa gang yin pa de /
translated: The response to that is:

original: cir yang rung ba smra ba'i lugs kyis sbong ba ni //
analyzed: cir yang rung ba smra ba'i lugs kyis sbong ba ni //
translated: The system of the one who speaks of anything at all.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: spyi gcig tu tha dad par 'dod pa'i phyogs la ni /
analyzed: spyi gcig tu tha dad par 'dod pa'i phyogs la ni /
translated: In the position that asserts a single universal to be different,

original: gsal ba la @138b 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod par rigs kyi /
analyzed: gsal ba la @138b 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod par rigs kyi /
translated: it is reasonable to say that it does not engage with the particulars.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But it is not the case in the position of being different or not different.

original: spyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs 'di la yang /
analyzed: spyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs 'di la yang /
translated: In this position of a universal being different or not different,

original: gsal ba rtogs pa'i skyon thams cad nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa med par thal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon de med dam ci ste yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gsal ba rtogs pa'i skyon thams cad nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa med par thal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon de med dam ci ste yod pa kho na'o //
translated: since all errors of understanding the particulars are experienced, is the error of the consequence of nonengagement not present? It is definitely present.

original: 'on te tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i spyi rtogs na gsal ba rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i spyi rtogs na gsal ba rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: But if a universal that is different or not different is understood, the particulars are not understood.

original: des na de rtogs pa'i skyon ci ltar yod snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: des na de rtogs pa'i skyon ci ltar yod snyam du dogs na /
translated: Therefore, how could the error of understanding that be present?

original: spyi de las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi de las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “And from the universal” means from the universal.

original: spyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la brten nas gsal ba la ma reg par rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: spyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la brten nas gsal ba la ma reg par rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The cognition does not occur without touching the particulars, based on the universal whether it is different or non-different.

original: 'on kyang gsal ba la reg pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal ba la reg pa kho na yin no //
translated: But rather, it occurs only by touching the particulars.

original: yang na gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi spyi de la dmigs pa'i rtogs pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni gsal ba la reg par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi spyi de la dmigs pa'i rtogs pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni gsal ba la reg par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, the cognition that arises from the universal which has the nature of both does not touch the particulars.

original: 'on kyang gsal ba la reg pa kho nas yin te des na gsal ba rtogs pa'i skyon du ci ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal ba la reg pa kho nas yin te des na gsal ba rtogs pa'i skyon du ci ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: But rather, it occurs only by touching the particulars. Thus, how can it not be the fault that the particulars are cognized?

original: rtogs so zhe na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs so zhe na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'o //
translated: “If it cognizes” refers to the particulars.

original: thams cad ces bya ba sreg pa la sogs pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba sreg pa la sogs pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “All” refers to burning, etc. because they are experienced.

original: rtogs kyang zhes bya ba ste thun mong du'o //
analyzed: rtogs kyang zhes bya ba ste thun mong du'o //
translated: “Even though it cognizes” refers to the universal.

original: ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba nges pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba nges pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: “Not cognizing” refers to the particulars as having the nature of being ascertained.

original: lan ni de nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is “that itself”

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo'i spyi'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo'i spyi'o //
translated: the universal that has the nature of the particulars.

original: dogs pa ni de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dogs pa ni de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The doubt is: by that very thing.

original: rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By the very understanding and non-understanding.

original: rnam grangs kyis zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyis so //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyis so //
translated: By the enumeration is by the occasion.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni spyi'i gnas skabs gcig yin la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni spyi'i gnas skabs gcig yin la /
translated: The pervasion is the one general occasion.

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid ni gzhan yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid ni gzhan yin no //
translated: The non-commonality is another.

original: 'gal ba ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro bas so //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro bas so //
translated: The contradiction is by the pervasion.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: The other is the non-common.🔽The thing is the common and the non-common.

original: dngos po ni thun mong ba dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na lan ni gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni thun mong ba dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na lan ni gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: by what?

original: ci ltar 'jug ste ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ltar 'jug ste ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How does it engage? Because of non-understanding.

original: dogs pa ni de ni de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste rjes su 'gro bar rtogs pa'i spyi'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni de ni de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste rjes su 'gro bar rtogs pa'i spyi'o //
translated: The doubt is: that by that very thing. The general understanding is by the pervasion.

original: 'o na rtogs pa rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin la 'jug go snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rtogs pa rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin la 'jug go snyam na /
translated: Well, it engages in the nature of the understanding.

original: rtogs pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: even in the understanding.

original: 'jug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon de nyid do //
analyzed: 'jug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon de nyid do //
translated: The fault of the definition being non-pervasive is the same.

original: gang gi phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi spyi mi 'thad pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi spyi mi 'thad pa des na /
translated: Since the universal is not tenable as having the nature of being different, non-different, or both,

original: spyi ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid de don dam ba pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid de don dam ba pa ni ma yin no //
translated: the universal exists conventionally, but not ultimately.

original: de ltan 'o na zhes bya ba ni /🔽gal te sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir @139a * //
analyzed: de ltan 'o na zhes bya ba ni / gal te sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir @139a * //
translated: In response to that, Bhāviveka says, “If that is so . . .”

original: zhes bya ba 'dir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dir /
translated: If in the case of the statement, “Sound is impermanent because it is produced,”

original: rtog pas bkod pa'i chos dang chos can gyi dngos pos bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: rtog pas bkod pa'i chos dang chos can gyi dngos pos bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa yin na /
translated: the probandum and the proof are established by the nature of the object that is the property possessor and the property posited by thought,

original: de'i tshe sgra ni mi rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe sgra ni mi rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case, “Sound is impermanent because it is sound” would also be a correct proof

original: 'dir yang brtags pa'i chos dang chos can gyi dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang brtags pa'i chos dang chos can gyi dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the object that is the property possessor and the property posited by thought exists in this case as well.

original: 'o na de 'dir dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin na /
analyzed: 'o na de 'dir dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin na /
translated: If that is one part of the meaning of the thesis here,

original: de'i tshe byas pa nyid la yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe byas pa nyid la yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then in that case, “because it is produced” would also be a correct proof. This is the meaning.

original: gang gi spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa grub pa'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gang gi spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa grub pa'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the conclusion of the passage beginning with “What is the generality of?” is as follows.

original: pha rol po gang gi ltar na chos can sgra las tha dad pa'i sgra nyid kyi spyi yod pa de'i lugs la yang /
analyzed: pha rol po gang gi ltar na chos can sgra las tha dad pa'i sgra nyid kyi spyi yod pa de'i lugs la yang /
translated: Even in the system of the opponent, according to whom the generality of sound exists separately from the subject, sound,

original: dam par sa pa'i don gyis phyogs gcig ma yin par ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dam par sa pa'i don gyis phyogs gcig ma yin par ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: why would it not be a part of the meaning of the thesis?

original: de kho na nyid du bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi dngos por ci ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi dngos por ci ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: How could it not be a real entity that is the probandum and the proof?

original: sgra ni mi rtags te sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni pha rol po yang dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid du 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sgra ni mi rtags te sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni pha rol po yang dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid du 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: The statement “Sound is impermanent because it is a product” is asserted by the opponent to be a part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: des na gal te pha rol po sangs rgyas pa la sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i sgrub byed nyid yin gyi dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ni ma yin no zhes smra na de'i tshe sangs rgyas pas kyang khyed kyi ltar na
analyzed: des na gal te pha rol po sangs rgyas pa la sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i sgrub byed nyid yin gyi dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ni ma yin no zhes smra na de'i tshe sangs rgyas pas kyang khyed kyi ltar na
translated: Therefore, if the opponent says that “because it is sound” is a correct proof but not a part of the meaning of the thesis, then at that time, even the Buddhist would say that “because it is a product” is a correct proof but not a part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: yang 'di sgrub byed yang dag pa kho nar 'gyur te dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang 'di sgrub byed yang dag pa kho nar 'gyur te dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, this would be a correct proof, because it is not one part of the meaning of the thesis,

original: sgra dang sgra nyid dag ni tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang sgra nyid dag ni tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par nus pa yin no //
translated: because sound and soundness are different.

original: dogs pa ni ma yin te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni ma yin te zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not a doubt.

original: sgra nyid kyi sgra de dang sgra'i gsal ba 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis ldan pa de ni chos can ston pa'i sgra nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //🔽sgra nyid kyi sgras ni spyi de dang ldan par ston pa yin la ;
analyzed: sgra nyid kyi sgra de dang sgra'i gsal ba 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis ldan pa de ni chos can ston pa'i sgra nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig kho na'o // sgra nyid kyi sgras ni spyi de dang ldan par ston pa yin la ;
translated: Soundness of sound is indicated by the word “soundness” because it is the property of the subject, and therefore it is only one part of the meaning of the thesis.🔽The word “soundness” indicates that it is endowed with that universal.

original: de dang ldan pa yang sgra'i sgra nyid kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa yang sgra'i sgra nyid kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: And that endowment is indicated by the word “sound.”

original: des na sgra nyid kyi sgra'i don ni /
analyzed: des na sgra nyid kyi sgra'i don ni /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the word “soundness”

original: chos can gyi sgras brjod par bya ba'i don las tha mi dad pa des na dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chos can gyi sgras brjod par bya ba'i don las tha mi dad pa des na dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs yin no zhe na /
translated: is not different from the meaning expressed by the word “property of the subject.” Therefore, one part of the meaning of the thesis is the reason.

original: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “Well then, . . . ”

original: sangs rgyas pa'i lugs 'di la yang dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i lugs 'di la yang dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this Buddhist system, the meaning of the thesis is not one-sided.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de las gzhan las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The passage from “from something else” explains that.

original: de ltar na 'di ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin par yu bu cag gnyi ga'i bar yang 'thad pa yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin par yu bu cag gnyi ga'i bar yang 'thad pa yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the thesis is not one-sided, and it is tenable for both of us.

original: da ni gzhan lugs las rang gi @139b lugs khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa ni spyi dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni gzhan lugs las rang gi @139b lugs khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa ni spyi dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that our own system is superior to the other system, the root text says, “The universal . . . ”

original: spyi dang ldan pa de ni zhes gang brjod pa de la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: spyi dang ldan pa de ni zhes gang brjod pa de la brjod pa ni /
translated: The passage that begins “That which possesses the universal . . . ” explains that.

original: sgra'i sgra dang sgra nyid kyi sbras /
analyzed: sgra'i sgra dang sgra nyid kyi sbras /
translated: The sound of the word sound is a sound.

original: sgra nyid kyi spyi dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: sgra nyid kyi spyi dang ldan pa'am /
translated: It is a universal sound.

original: gzhan sgra ma yin pa las ldog pa rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sgra ma yin pa las ldog pa rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is understood as the opposite of something that is not a sound.

original: de la phyogs dang po sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: The first position is refuted in the following.

original: de ni rtogs pa med de nges pa med do //
analyzed: de ni rtogs pa med de nges pa med do //
translated: That is not understood, because there is no certainty.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sgra nyid kyi spyi dang ldan pa ni /🔽sgra'i gsal ba de rig pa med par rtogs par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: sgra nyid kyi spyi dang ldan pa ni / sgra'i gsal ba de rig pa med par rtogs par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Because the cognition of the universal of sound,🔽without the cognition of the individual sound, is not possible.

original: sgra las gsal ba rtogs pa yang med do //🔽zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sgra las gsal ba rtogs pa yang med do // zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: And the cognition of the individual sound is not possible without the cognition of the universal of sound.🔽This is what is being said:

original: de'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “that” refers to

original: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid kyi'o //
translated: the universal of sound.

original: sngar nyid du ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par gzhan sel ba'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: sngar nyid du ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par gzhan sel ba'i skabs su'o //
translated: “Previously” refers to the chapter on the exclusion of other in the inference for oneself.

original: gzhan las ni ldog pa'i zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa khas len pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan las ni ldog pa'i zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa khas len pa ni /
translated: The second position, “from the exclusion of other,” is accepted.

original: de phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Therefore” refers to

original: sgra las zhes bya ba ni sgra'i sgra dang / sgra nyid kyi sgra las so //
analyzed: sgra las zhes bya ba ni sgra'i sgra dang / sgra nyid kyi sgra las so //
translated: “from the word” — from the word “sound” and from the word “soundness.”

original: spyi dang ldan pa'am zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i cha rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: spyi dang ldan pa'am zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i cha rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The verse “If the cognition of the universal of sound . . .” is explained as follows.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “If” and so on.

original: khyad par sgra'i gsal ba'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: khyad par sgra'i gsal ba'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: “Particulars” are the individual sounds.

original: spyi dang ldan pa de'i rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: spyi dang ldan pa de'i rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on the line “The awareness that possesses the universal principle” is as follows.🔽

original: 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽de ni spyi dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // de ni spyi dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The commentary on the passage beginning with the words “The awareness of that which is endowed with the universal” is as follows.

original: gal te yang de dang ldan pa rtogs pa de lta na yang gsal ba ma rtogs pa la rag go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang de dang ldan pa rtogs pa de lta na yang gsal ba ma rtogs pa la rag go zhe na /
translated: “ But, ” one might say, “even if one understands that which is endowed with it, the individual is not understood. ”

original: gang la zhes bya ba'o //🔽gang la zan spyin par bya ba de nyid la /
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba'o // gang la zan spyin par bya ba de nyid la /
translated: “ In regard to which, ” etc.

original: sder la sogs pa yang dbyig pa dang khur ba'i tshul du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: sder la sogs pa yang dbyig pa dang khur ba'i tshul du grub pa yin no //
translated: In regard to which one gives food, the plate, etc. are also established in the manner of a stick and a burden.

original: sder med nam gron nyid mi 'grub po //
analyzed: sder med nam gron nyid mi 'grub po //
translated: Without a plate, the food itself is not established.

original: de bzhin du spyi dang ldan par rtogs na gsal ba yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi dang ldan par rtogs na gsal ba yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, when one understands that which is endowed with the universal, the individual is also understood,

original: ma rtogs na de dang ldan pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rtogs na de dang ldan pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it is not understood, that which is endowed with it is not understood.

original: de'i rang bzhin rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on the passage beginning with the words “The understanding of its nature” is as follows.

original: khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ The particular, ” etc.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: de ltar khyad par rnams sgra'i don nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: de ltar khyad par rnams sgra'i don nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir na'o //
translated: Thus, because these distinctions are not the meaning of the word,

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: “If” is the objection.

original: spyi gsal ma rtogs par mi sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: spyi gsal ma rtogs par mi sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is there no comprehension of the universal and the manifestation without the individual,

original: 'on kyang ldog pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ldog pa yang yin no //
translated: but also there is no exclusion.

original: gal te ldog pa med par log par rtogs pa yong na yang ldog pas ci bya ste /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa med par log par rtogs pa yong na yang ldog pas ci bya ste /
translated: If there were comprehension of the excluded thing without exclusion, what would be the use of exclusion?

original: ldog pa ni log pa'i dngos po rtogs pa'i don du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa ni log pa'i dngos po rtogs pa'i don du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Exclusion is understood for the purpose of comprehending the excluded thing.

original: gal te de lta ma yin par yang rtogs na ni /
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin par yang rtogs na ni /
translated: If it were not so,

original: ldog pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ldog pas ci zhig bya /
translated: what would be the use of exclusion?

original: @140a * // 'o na gzhan du zhes bya ba ni log pa'i dngos po rtogs pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas so //
analyzed: @140a * // 'o na gzhan du zhes bya ba ni log pa'i dngos po rtogs pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas so //
translated: “But in another way” means that the comprehension of the excluded thing is not tenable in another way.

original: ci ste spyi zhes bya ba ni log pa'i dngos po rtogs pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyid kyis spyi nyid rtogs par bya mod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste spyi zhes bya ba ni log pa'i dngos po rtogs pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyid kyis spyi nyid rtogs par bya mod ces bya ba'o //
translated: “If it is a universal” means that the universal itself should be understood because the comprehension of the excluded thing is not tenable in another way.

original: rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: “Comprehension” is a philosophical tenet.

original: ci zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: “What” is a question.

original: mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The term “different” refers to a philosophical tenet.

original: ci ltar mi 'dra ba rtogs pa na ldog pa rtogs she na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi 'dra ba rtogs pa na ldog pa rtogs she na /
translated: How does one understand a difference when one understands an exclusion?🔽If one does not understand it, one does not engage in a differentiation.

original: ma rtogs na rnam par phye nas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs na rnam par phye nas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement “it is like this” is a response to that.

original: gal te mi 'dra bar rtogs pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa nyid na /
analyzed: gal te mi 'dra bar rtogs pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa nyid na /
translated: If there is no understanding of a difference,

original: de ci ltar ldog pa rtogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar ldog pa rtogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: how can there be an understanding of an exclusion?

original: gdon mi tha bar zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: gdon mi tha bar zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The response is “necessarily.

original: 'di la bzlog pa la gnod byed ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: 'di la bzlog pa la gnod byed ci yod snyam na /
translated: ” What is the fault in the opposite of that?

original: tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pas lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pas lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The response in the Commentary on the Kārikās is

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ste mi 'dra ba nyid ma rtogs pa na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ste mi 'dra ba nyid ma rtogs pa na'o //
translated: “if that were not so,” that is, if there were no understanding of a difference.

original: gal te spyi med na mi 'dra ba nyid med pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te spyi med na mi 'dra ba nyid med pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: If there is no universal, is there not a complete absence of difference?

original: de ci ltar de ltar rtogs snyam du dogs pa ni /
analyzed: de ci ltar de ltar rtogs snyam du dogs pa ni /
translated: How can one understand it in that way?

original: de'i zhes bya ba ste mi 'dod pa dang bral ba'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ste mi 'dod pa dang bral ba'i'o //
translated: The response to that doubt is “that,” that is, the absence of what is not desired.

original: lan 'debs pa ni rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan 'debs pa ni rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “itself.”

original: rang nyid ces bya ba bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis de ltar zhes bya ba me rang gi mtshan nyid rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa ma yin par gyur na /
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis de ltar zhes bya ba me rang gi mtshan nyid rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa ma yin par gyur na /
translated: The so-called “self” is the nature of the self. If it were not the case that fire is the intrinsic identity of fire, which is the opposite of that which is not fire,

original: chos gzhan spyi dang ldan yang ngo //
analyzed: chos gzhan spyi dang ldan yang ngo //
translated: then even though it possesses a universal, it would not be cognized as that.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa dang bral ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa dang bral ba nyid du'o //
translated: “ That” refers to being devoid of that which is not fire.

original: 'on te mi 'dra ba ma yin pa yang spyi dang ldan pas mi 'dra ba nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhes dogs pa na de dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te mi 'dra ba ma yin pa yang spyi dang ldan pas mi 'dra ba nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhes dogs pa na de dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that even though it is not different, it is cognized as different because it possesses a universal, then “that” is the response.

original: 'di ni me rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni me rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the intrinsic identity of fire.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba mi 'dra bar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba mi 'dra bar ro //
translated: “ That” is not different.

original: lan ni de lta bur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de lta bur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response is “that way.”

original: rang gi rgyu las mi 'dra bar skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las mi 'dra bar skyes pa'o //
translated: It is produced from its own cause in a way that is not different.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo 'dres par skyes pa yin na de'i tshe 'di spyi dang ldan pas ma 'dres par rtogs na rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo 'dres par skyes pa yin na de'i tshe 'di spyi dang ldan pas ma 'dres par rtogs na rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it were produced in a mixed way, then when it possesses a universal and is cognized as unmixed, it would not be cognized by its own nature.

original: 'gyur na yang rtogs pa 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur na yang rtogs pa 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did, then the cognition would be mistaken.

original: rang gi ngo bos mi mthun pa nyid du rtogs na ni spyi dang ldan pa don med do zhes gsungs pa ni rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos mi mthun pa nyid du rtogs na ni spyi dang ldan pa don med do zhes gsungs pa ni rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is understood as essentially different, then the possession of the universal is meaningless.

original: gal te spyi las gsal ba rnams tha da dpar gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te spyi las gsal ba rnams tha da dpar gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If the particulars are not different from the universal,

original: 'on kyang rang gi rgyu las grub pa nyid spyis shes par byed pa yin no snyam na gal te zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi rgyu las grub pa nyid spyis shes par byed pa yin no snyam na gal te zhes smras so //
translated: but rather the universal is understood through the particulars that are produced from their own causes, then the response is “If that is so . . . ”

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni ba lang dang ma he'o //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni ba lang dang ma he'o //
translated: “Two” refers to a cow and a bull.

original: dang po ni ba lang gi gsal ba gcig @140b nyid mthong la /
analyzed: dang po ni ba lang gi gsal ba gcig @140b nyid mthong la /
translated: First, one sees a single particular cow.

original: de bzhin du ma he'i gsal ba yang gcig mthong ba de'i tshe ba lang nyid dang ma he nyid kyi spyi'i sgo nas tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma he'i gsal ba yang gcig mthong ba de'i tshe ba lang nyid dang ma he nyid kyi spyi'i sgo nas tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, when one sees a single particular bull, at that time one does not understand the difference between the universal of cow and the universal of bull.

original: ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi ni gsal ba gnyis pa la sogs pa mthong bas nges par bzung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi ni gsal ba gnyis pa la sogs pa mthong bas nges par bzung ba yin gyi /
translated: The universal of cow and so on is ascertained through seeing a second particular and so on.

original: gsal ba gcig mthong ba nyid las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba gcig mthong ba nyid las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not from the perception of a single manifestation.

original: ba lang nyid dang ma he nyid ni gsal pa gcig kho na'i mthar thug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ba lang nyid dang ma he nyid ni gsal pa gcig kho na'i mthar thug pa ma yin te /
translated: The universal of cow and the universal of buffalo are not limited to a single manifestation.

original: mtshungs pa rnams kyi ngo bo ni spyi yin no zhes gzhung yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa rnams kyi ngo bo ni spyi yin no zhes gzhung yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the text says, “The nature of the similar is the universal.”

original: gcig la zhes bya ba ni ba lang ngam ma he'i gsal ba gcig la'o //
analyzed: gcig la zhes bya ba ni ba lang ngam ma he'i gsal ba gcig la'o //
translated: “ In one” means in one manifestation, either a cow or a buffalo.

original: gang gi phyir dang po mthong bas gnyis kyi tha dad pa mthong ba de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dang po mthong bas gnyis kyi tha dad pa mthong ba de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the first perception sees the difference between the two.

original: de lta na yang ci ltar ldog pa spyi yin snyam na rigs mi mthun pa las zhes bya ba'o //🔽rigs med na rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa med par dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang ci ltar ldog pa spyi yin snyam na rigs mi mthun pa las zhes bya ba'o // rigs med na rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa med par dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even so, how is the universal a difference? “From dissimilar.”🔽If there were no universal, there would be no similar or dissimilar.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is anticipated: “If there were no universal, there would be no similar or dissimilar.”🔽This is stated: “Because there is no similarity or dissimilarity without a universal.”

original: ba lang dang ma he'i gsal ba phan tshun tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ba lang nyid dang ma he nyid kyi spyi phan tshun tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ba lang dang ma he'i gsal ba phan tshun tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ba lang nyid dang ma he nyid kyi spyi phan tshun tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The reason why the manifestations of cow and bull are mutually different is not because the universals cow and bull exist as mutually different.

original: des na ba lang dang ma he la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gsal ba rnams tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur gyi rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa nyid du ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ba lang dang ma he la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gsal ba rnams tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur gyi rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa nyid du ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the manifestations characterized by cow and bull, etc. would be only mutually different, but they would not be similar or dissimilar.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir rigs mthun pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba de ni spyi med par rtogs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs mthun pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba de ni spyi med par rtogs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the classification of similar, etc. is not understood without a universal.

original: gal te gsal ba la ltos pa'i tha dad pa nyid las rigs mthun pa'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba la ltos pa'i tha dad pa nyid las rigs mthun pa'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam na /
translated: If you think that the classification of similar, etc. is due to the difference that depends on the manifestation,

original: gsal ba la ltos nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba la ltos nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, “due to the difference that depends on the manifestation.”

original: de gnyis kyang zhes bya ba ni ngang pa dang khra bo la yang ngo //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang zhes bya ba ni ngang pa dang khra bo la yang ngo //
translated: “Those two” refers to the swan and the bull.

original: thams cad mthong ba yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi gsal ba thams cad mthong ba ma yin te mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mthong ba yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi gsal ba thams cad mthong ba ma yin te mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it the case that all of them are seen.

original: sangs rgyas pa la ltos te spyi dngos po yod pa mi 'thad pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la ltos te spyi dngos po yod pa mi 'thad pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it untenable that a universal exists in dependence on the particulars,

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyi rtogs pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyi rtogs pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but it is also unreasonable to understand the Sugata’s negation to be a negation that has the nature of a universal.

original: mi rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: mi rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: It is not unreasonable.

original: nyas pa 'di ni bzlog pa med ces bya ba ni nyes pa 'jug pa kho na'o //🔽gang zhig bzlog par mi nus pa'i nyes pa de yang yin zhe na zhes pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: nyas pa 'di ni bzlog pa med ces bya ba ni nyes pa 'jug pa kho na'o // gang zhig bzlog par mi nus pa'i nyes pa de yang yin zhe na zhes pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni /
translated: This fault cannot be averted.🔽What is the fault that cannot be averted?

original: spyi ni gsal bas zhes bya ba'o //🔽rang gi ngo @141a * //
analyzed: spyi ni gsal bas zhes bya ba'o // rang gi ngo @141a * //
translated: The fault is stated in the line “The universal is not seen without the particulars.”🔽It is not by its own nature.

original: bos min zhes bya ba ni gsal ba med par rang gi ngo bos ni gsal ba mi yin no //
analyzed: bos min zhes bya ba ni gsal ba med par rang gi ngo bos ni gsal ba mi yin no //
translated: Without the particulars, the universal does not exist by its own nature.

original: gsal ba med par yang ci ste mi gsal snyam na /
analyzed: gsal ba med par yang ci ste mi gsal snyam na /
translated: Why is it not clear without the particulars?

original: gsal bas stong pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal bas stong pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Because of the clarity, there is no perception of the manifestation of the universal.”

original: spyi de ni mngon par gsal ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi de ni mngon par gsal ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the manifestation of the universal is not perceived.

original: gang gi phyir gsal ba med par mi gsal ba des na gsal ba la ltos par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal ba med par mi gsal ba des na gsal ba la ltos par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: Since the manifestation of the universal is not perceived, it must be dependent on the manifestation.

original: 'o na ltos na rag mod snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ltos na rag mod snyam na /
translated: “But if it is dependent, so what?”

original: de'ang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'ang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: “That” refers to the universal.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba mtha' dag ma mthong bas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba mtha' dag ma mthong bas na'o //
translated: “Therefore” means because the manifestation of the universal is not perceived.

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni spyi la yang ste gzhan sel ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni spyi la yang ste gzhan sel ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
translated: “In that case” means in the case of the universal.

original: spyis nye bar mtshon pa'i gsal ba rnams la brda'i byed pas khyab ba grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyis nye bar mtshon pa'i gsal ba rnams la brda'i byed pas khyab ba grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The universal cannot be established as pervading the manifestations that are illustrated by the universal, because of the function of the convention.

original: rnam par 'grel pa ni spyi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'grel pa ni spyi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The commentary on this is “The universal, etc.”

original: tha snyad du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus phyis spyi tha snyad du bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus phyis spyi tha snyad du bya ba'o //
translated: “It is used conventionally” means that the universal is used conventionally after the time of the convention.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bos spyi rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bos spyi rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the universal is understood by its own nature,

original: gsal ba med par ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba med par ni bya ba'o //
translated: Without the manifestation of the individual objects, the universal cannot be apprehended.

original: 'o na gang gis ma 'dzings par brda'ang byed pa spyi nges par ci ltar rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gis ma 'dzings par brda'ang byed pa spyi nges par ci ltar rtogs snyam na /
translated: But if the universal is not apprehended, how can one understand the convention that is not bound to the individual?

original: gsal ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes smos so //
translated: The response to this is:🔽“The universal is manifested by the individual.”

original: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba mtha' dag mthong ba'i tshe yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba mtha' dag mthong ba'i tshe yang ngo //
translated: “At that time” means when all the individuals are seen.

original: ci ltar na gsal ba du ma mthong ba kho na la spyi nges pa rtogs par nges she na /
analyzed: ci ltar na gsal ba du ma mthong ba kho na la spyi nges pa rtogs par nges she na /
translated: How is it that the universal is ascertained only when many individuals are seen?

original: de med na spyi nges par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de med na spyi nges par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Because without them, the universal cannot be ascertained.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: 'di ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'i brda ni gal te khas blangs pa de'i tshe sgra bkod pa'i sngon rol du so sor nges pa'i spyi ci ltar rtogs /
analyzed: 'di ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'i brda ni gal te khas blangs pa de'i tshe sgra bkod pa'i sngon rol du so sor nges pa'i spyi ci ltar rtogs /
translated: If the convention “This is a cow” is accepted, then how can the universal that is ascertained prior to the utterance of the word be understood?

original: brda ni rtogs pa la yin na /
analyzed: brda ni rtogs pa la yin na /
translated: If the convention is understood,

original: 'di ba lang ngo zhes bkod pa'i sngon rol du ni so sor nges pa'i spyi rtogs pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di ba lang ngo zhes bkod pa'i sngon rol du ni so sor nges pa'i spyi rtogs pa yang med do //
translated: then prior to the utterance “This is a cow,” the universal that is ascertained is not understood.

original: ci ltar ma rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar ma rtogs snyam na /
translated: How is it not understood?

original: phyugs nyid la sogs ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: phyugs nyid la sogs ba zhes smos so //
translated: The word cattle and so on is used.

original: gsal ba la ni phyugs nyid dang dngos po nyid dang / ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gsal ba la ni phyugs nyid dang dngos po nyid dang / ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi yod pa yin la /
translated: The universal cattle-ness, thingness, cowness, and so on, exist in the individual.

original: de dag kyang rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyis rang bzhin dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ba lang nyid kyi spyi ni tha dad par nya bar mtshon pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyis rang bzhin dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ba lang nyid kyi spyi ni tha dad par nya bar mtshon pa ma yin no //
translated: But since these are the same nature as the mere following after, the universal cowness is not indicated as different.

original: des na pa lang nyid spyi gzhan las tha dad par ma shes pas na /
analyzed: des na pa lang nyid spyi gzhan las tha dad par ma shes pas na /
translated: Therefore, since cowness is not known as different from other universals,

original: ba lang zhes bya ba'i brda med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang zhes bya ba'i brda med par 'gyur ro //
translated: the convention cow would not exist.

original: thams cad la brda byas na ni ba lang gi sgra yod pa nyid dang / phyugs nyid la sogs pa'i yang rjod byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad la brda byas na ni ba lang gi sgra yod pa nyid dang / phyugs nyid la sogs pa'i yang rjod byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were made with respect to all, the word cow would express the existence of cattle-ness and so on.

original: brda byed pa'i spyod yul ba lang nyid tha dad par dogs pa ni /
analyzed: brda byed pa'i spyod yul ba lang nyid tha dad par dogs pa ni /
translated: The object of the convention, cowness, is suspected of being different,

original: ba lang @141b nyid tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba lang @141b nyid tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: so it is said mere cowness.

original: 'dir phyugs nyid la sogs pa'i spyi rnams las /
analyzed: 'dir phyugs nyid la sogs pa'i spyi rnams las /
translated: Here, from among the universals cattle-ness and so on,

original: ba lang nyid brda'i yul yin gyi /
analyzed: ba lang nyid brda'i yul yin gyi /
translated: the object of the convention is cowness.

original: phyugs nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyugs nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But not in the cow itself, etc.

original: lan ni ba lang nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ba lang nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: “cow-ness.”

original: mi shes so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi shes so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ One does not know”

original: phyugs nyid la sogs pa'i spyi las ba lang nyid tha dad par nges par mi rtogs ba'o //
analyzed: phyugs nyid la sogs pa'i spyi las ba lang nyid tha dad par nges par mi rtogs ba'o //
translated: means that one does not ascertain cow-ness as different from the universal of cow, etc.

original: shes pa yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cognition exists,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then the answer is: “In that case, . . .”

original: ci ltar rnam ba gang gis shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ltar rnam ba gang gis shes par bya ste /
translated: In what way? By what aspect?

original: mdo ga dang dbyings dang yi ge'i rnam pas stong bas na thams cad mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo ga dang dbyings dang yi ge'i rnam pas stong bas na thams cad mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the emptiness of the statement, the sound, and the letters, everything is the same.

original: shes pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa gang yin pa de'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: shes pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa gang yin pa de'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The objection to the aspect of the cause of cognition is:

original: gang zhig ces bya ba'o//
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba'o//
translated: “What is that . . . ?”

original: spyi gang zhig 'di lta bur gyur pa'i gsal bas gsal bar byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: spyi gang zhig 'di lta bur gyur pa'i gsal bas gsal bar byas pa yin gyi /
translated: What universal is clarified by an instance that is of this kind?

original: 'di dang mi 'dra ba'i gsal bas ni ma yin pa'o zhes rnam pa 'dis pa lang nyid phyugs nyid la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i shes pa yin no zhes na /
analyzed: 'di dang mi 'dra ba'i gsal bas ni ma yin pa'o zhes rnam pa 'dis pa lang nyid phyugs nyid la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i shes pa yin no zhes na /
translated: By this aspect, one knows that cow-ness is different from the universal of cow, etc.

original: lan ni des bya ba spyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan ni des bya ba spyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The answer is: because it is the universal that is the object.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: spyi de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That universal is the object.

original: phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa spong ba ni /🔽ba lang las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa spong ba ni / ba lang las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The error of mutual dependence is avoided in the following:🔽The universal is not different from the individual.

original: spyi rang nyid spyi gzhan las tha dad pa yin gyi gsal ba la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: spyi rang nyid spyi gzhan las tha dad pa yin gyi gsal ba la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the universal itself is different from other universals, but not from the particulars,

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the answer is: No.

original: spyi rnams pa lang la sogs pa'i gsal ba dag la 'jug pa ni rtogs pa ma yin no//
analyzed: spyi rnams pa lang la sogs pa'i gsal ba dag la 'jug pa ni rtogs pa ma yin no//
translated: The universal does not engage in the particulars, such as cows, etc.

original: des na ci ltar rang ngam gzhan las tha dad par 'gyur /🔽rtogs pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: des na ci ltar rang ngam gzhan las tha dad par 'gyur / rtogs pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: So how could it be different from itself or from others?🔽The objection is anticipated:

original: gang la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the object of the cognition of a universal?

original: lan ni gzhal bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gzhal bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: The object is the universal.

original: ci ltar de gzhal bya shes pa med pa yin zhe na /🔽kha dog dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar de gzhal bya shes pa med pa yin zhe na / kha dog dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is that object known without a cognition?🔽The answer is: The universal is not different from the color, etc.

original: kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pas stong pa'i gzhal bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pas stong pa'i gzhal bya'o //
translated: The object is empty of the aspects of color, etc.

original: de nyid ces bya ba las sogs pa ni grangs can nye bar 'god pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba las sogs pa ni grangs can nye bar 'god pa ste /
translated: The phrase “in reality” and so on is a statement of the Sāṃkhya position.

original: kha dog la sogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa nyid do //
translated: [The Sāṃkhyas say:] “It is color and so on.”

original: ci ltar rjes su 'gro ba med snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar rjes su 'gro ba med snyam na /
translated: If you ask, “Why is there no concomitance?”

original: kha dog ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: [The Sāṃkhyas say:] “Because color and so on are the same in all individual things.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “Why is that?”

original: gsal ba gcig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba gcig ces bya ba'o //
translated: [The Sāṃkhyas say:] “Because a single individual thing is the substratum of all individual things.”

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni kha dog rjes su song bar dogs na yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni kha dog rjes su song bar dogs na yang ngo //
translated: If you say, “In that case,” [the Sāṃkhyas say:] “Even if you suspect that color and so on are not concomitant,

original: rtogs pa ni spyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni spyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the cognition is of the universal.”

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gsal ba thams cad la gnas pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gsal ba thams cad la gnas pa nyid du'o //
translated: If you say, “In that case,” [the Sāṃkhyas say:] “The universal is the substratum of all individual things.”

original: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba ste gsal ba gcig gis gsal ba nyid du yang ngo //
analyzed: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba ste gsal ba gcig gis gsal ba nyid du yang ngo //
translated: The response [to the Sāṃkhya position] is as follows: “In that case, a single individual thing is also an individual thing.”

original: gsal ba ci tsam zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ci tsam zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: If you ask, “How much of an individual thing is seen?”

original: ci tsam yang yin la bsal ba yang yin pa de mthong ba la'o //🔽gsal ba @142a * //
analyzed: ci tsam yang yin la bsal ba yang yin pa de mthong ba la'o // gsal ba @142a * //
translated: [The Sāṃkhyas say:] “As much as is seen of the individual thing that is present.”

original: mtha' dag ma mthong yang nye bar gnas pa'i gsal ba gcig la sogs pa mthong bas kyang spyi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtha' dag ma mthong yang nye bar gnas pa'i gsal ba gcig la sogs pa mthong bas kyang spyi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point is that even though the entire individual thing is not seen, the universal is cognized by seeing a single individual thing that is present and so on.

original: de tsam pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nye bar gnas pa'i gsal ba tsam gyis gsal bar bya ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nye bar gnas pa'i gsal ba tsam gyis gsal bar bya ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no such thing as that alone.🔽If it were such a thing, if it existed as that alone,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,

original: de lta bu nyid yin na zhes bya ba de tsam pa nyid yod pa yin na'o //🔽de lta bur gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa bskyed pa nyid spyi yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes de ltar gzhan gyi phyir bzlog pa na'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid yin na zhes bya ba de tsam pa nyid yod pa yin na'o // de lta bur gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa bskyed pa nyid spyi yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes de ltar gzhan gyi phyir bzlog pa na'o //
translated: then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,

original: rigs mi mthun pa las log pa'i gsal ba nyid nyams su myong ba'i shes pas bar bcad nas rjes su 'gro pa'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa gang spyi yin no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las log pa'i gsal ba nyid nyams su myong ba'i shes pas bar bcad nas rjes su 'gro pa'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa gang spyi yin no //
translated: then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,🔽then, if it were such, if it were a universal,

original: 'di ga las snyam na /🔽de dang rigs mi mthun pa las zhes bya ba'o //🔽'o na ni rigs mi mthun pa nyid spyis byas pa yin no zhe na /🔽rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyang zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di ga las snyam na /🔽de dang rigs mi mthun pa las zhes bya ba'o //🔽'o na ni rigs mi mthun pa nyid spyis byas pa yin no zhe na /🔽rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyang zhes smos so //
translated: then, if it were such, if it were

original: de las gzhan las zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan du gyur pa las ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: de las gzhan las zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan du gyur pa las ldog pa nyid do //
translated: “From that which is other than that” means from that which is the opposite of that.

original: gal te spyi bzhin du rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa yang bstan par mi nus pa ma yin nam snyam na /
analyzed: gal te spyi bzhin du rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa yang bstan par mi nus pa ma yin nam snyam na /
translated: If you think that, like a universal, it is not possible to teach the exclusion from what is heterogeneous,

original: ci ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: then how?

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa las so //
translated: “From that” means from what is heterogeneous.

original: gcig ces bya ba ni khra ba'o //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba ni khra ba'o //
translated: “One” means multicolored.🔽“And others” means also from a tawny-colored one, and so on.

original: gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni ser skya la sogs pa la yang ngo zhes de ltar ldog pa ston gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni mang po rnams ldog pa nyid du bstan pa med par ni /🔽ldog pa bstan par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni ser skya la sogs pa la yang ngo zhes de ltar ldog pa ston gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni mang po rnams ldog pa nyid du bstan pa med par ni / ldog pa bstan par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: “Otherwise” means that without teaching the exclusion of the many, it is not possible to teach the exclusion.

original: gal te ldog pa bzhin du spyi yang bstan par nus so snyam na /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa bzhin du spyi yang bstan par nus so snyam na /
translated: If you think that, like the exclusion, it is possible to teach the universal,

original: spyi ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: spyi ni zhes smos so //
translated: then “the universal” is stated.

original: ston pa'i tshul brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ston pa'i tshul brjod pa ni /
translated: The way of teaching is stated:

original: de ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “This is it.”

original: gsal ba rnams las spyi gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsal ba rnams las spyi gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the universal is not different from the particulars,

original: tha dad pa de ni 'di'o zhes ston pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang lan du gdab ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa de ni 'di'o zhes ston pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang lan du gdab ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that it is not the reply that “this is the difference.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spyi de med na gsal ba de med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi de med na gsal ba de med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if that universal does not exist, it follows that the particulars do not exist.

original: gsal ba rnams spyi'i nang du thim na de dag med ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams spyi'i nang du thim na de dag med ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the particulars dissolve into the universal, they would not exist at all.

original: gsal ba med par ma zad mod snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: gsal ba med par ma zad mod snyam du dogs na /
translated: If you think that it is not only the particulars that do not exist,

original: gsal ba bsal nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba bsal nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then there would be the reply, “after the particulars are eliminated.”

original: 'on te gsal ba med pa ni 'dod pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba med pa ni 'dod pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: But if you think that it is only the particulars that do not exist,

original: tha snyad ces gsungs te /
analyzed: tha snyad ces gsungs te /
translated: then the reply is “conventionally.”

original: gsal ba rnams med pa yin na /
analyzed: gsal ba rnams med pa yin na /
translated: If the particulars do not exist,

original: des bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal ba la sogs pa gang yin pa 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal ba la sogs pa gang yin pa 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: then what is established by them, such as contradiction, would not exist here.

original: de ni gsal @142b bas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gsal @142b bas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is established by the particulars.

original: gal te ci ltar gsal ba med na des bsgrub par bya ba'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur pa'i phyir de khas len pa ltar spyi med na yang shes brjod tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad med par 'gyur pa des na de yang de dang 'dra🔽bar khas blang par bya ba yin no snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: gal te ci ltar gsal ba med na des bsgrub par bya ba'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur pa'i phyir de khas len pa ltar spyi med na yang shes brjod tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad med par 'gyur pa des na de yang de dang 'dra bar khas blang par bya ba yin no snyam du dogs na /
translated: If you think that if there is no manifestation, then the convention that it establishes would not exist, and that if there is no universal, then the convention that has the characteristic of being undifferentiated from cognition and expression would not exist, then that is also similar to this.

original: spyi bsal na gsal ba nang du thim pa'i phyir spyis bsgrub par bya ba'i tha snyad med par 'gyur ro zhes ni brjod par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: spyi bsal na gsal ba nang du thim pa'i phyir spyis bsgrub par bya ba'i tha snyad med par 'gyur ro zhes ni brjod par mi 'thad do //
translated: If you think that if the universal is eliminated, then because the manifestation dissolves into it, the convention that is established by the universal would not exist, then it is not tenable to say that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: log pa'i don nyams su myong bas bar du bcad pa'i ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi tha snyad shes pa dang brjod pa tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i don nyams su myong bas bar du bcad pa'i ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi tha snyad shes pa dang brjod pa tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is a convention that has the characteristic of being undifferentiated from cognition and expression, which is a reason for the elimination that is interrupted by the experience of a mistaken object.

original: gsal ba med par ni 'gal ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mi 'thad kyi /
analyzed: gsal ba med par ni 'gal ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mi 'thad kyi /
translated: Without a manifestation, a result such as contradiction is untenable.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa ni spyi med kyang 'thad de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa ni spyi med kyang 'thad de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the cognition that follows is tenable even without a universal.

original: gzhan gyis kyang mthar ldog pa nyid tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyur khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang mthar ldog pa nyid tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyur khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement “The difference in the exclusion of other should be accepted as the cause of the convention of difference” is as follows.

original: spyi rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “of universals” is used.

original: ba lang nyid dang rta la sogs pa spyi rnams kyi phan tshun ldog pa nyid tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin gyi spyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ba lang nyid dang rta la sogs pa spyi rnams kyi phan tshun ldog pa nyid tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin gyi spyi ni ma yin te /
translated: The difference in the exclusion of other of universals such as cowness and horseness is the cause of the convention of difference, but not a universal,

original: spyi ni spyi med pa yin no zhes bya ba gzhung yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi ni spyi med pa yin no zhes bya ba gzhung yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the text says, “A universal is without a universal.”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid ni khra bo la sogs pa'i gsal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir rta nyid las tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid ni khra bo la sogs pa'i gsal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir rta nyid las tha dad pa yin no //
translated: If you say, “Cowness is different from horseness because it is associated with the manifestation of a variegated animal, and so on.

original: de bzhin du rta nyid kyang dang pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ba lang nyid las tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rta nyid kyang dang pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ba lang nyid las tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, horseness is different from cowness because it is associated with the manifestation of a striped animal, and so on.”

original: ngo bos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngo bos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By nature,

original: spyi spyi gzhan las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi spyi gzhan las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The universal does not exist as separate from the particulars.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni gsal ba gzhan dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni gsal ba gzhan dang ldan pa ste /
translated: “Other” means the other particulars.

original: tha dad par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha dad par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not become separate.

original: 'on te rang gi ngo bo kho nas spyi rnams tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi ngo bo kho nas spyi rnams tha dad pa yin la /
translated: But if the universals are separate from each other by their own intrinsic reality,

original: de dang ldan pa ni de yod pas tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni de yod pas tha dad pa yin no //
translated: and they are separate by the existence of that,

original: dper na dkar po'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: dper na dkar po'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: for example, the nature of white

original: rang nyid kyis tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis tha dad pa yin la /
translated: is separate by itself,

original: snam bu ni de dang ldan pas tha dad pa bzhin no snyam na /🔽dkar po ldan phyir snam bu ni //
analyzed: snam bu ni de dang ldan pas tha dad pa bzhin no snyam na / dkar po ldan phyir snam bu ni //
translated: and the cloth is separate by possessing that.🔽The cloth is called “white”
