original: dkar zhes tha dad rab tu 'jig / ces smos te /
analyzed: dkar zhes tha dad rab tu 'jig / ces smos te /
translated: because it possesses white,🔽but the separateness of the cloth is destroyed.

original: de ltar ba'i snam bu'i tha dad pa ni rab tu 'jig ste /
analyzed: de ltar ba'i snam bu'i tha dad pa ni rab tu 'jig ste /
translated: The separateness of the cloth is destroyed;

original: nyams shing mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyams shing mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that it is lost and not established.

original: dkar po la sogs pa ni rdzas las tha dad par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa ni rdzas las tha dad par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because white and so on are not understood to be separate from substance.

original: dpe nyams pa na don yang nyams pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dpe nyams pa na don yang nyams pa kho na'o //
translated: When the example is lost, the meaning is also lost.

original: tha mi dad pa gsal @143a * //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa gsal @143a * //
translated: They are not different.🔽

original: ba tha dad pa dang ldan pas tha dad pa ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: ba tha dad pa dang ldan pas tha dad pa ma yin snyam na /
translated: If you think that the difference of the individual things is not real because they are not different from the universal,

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the reply is: “The other, etc.”

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi'o //
translated: The other is the particular characteristic.

original: gzhan pa ni spyi dang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan pa ni spyi dang ngo //
translated: The other is the universal.

original: dogs pa bsu ba na spyi dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba na spyi dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Anticipating an objection, he says: “The universal, etc.”

original: lan ni spyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni spyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is: “The universal, etc.”

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba na gnyi ga las gnas pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba na gnyi ga las gnas pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since it is present in both,

original: ci ltar gsal ba tha dad ba rnams spyi dang 'brel pa de bzhin du spyi'i tha mi dad pa yang gsal ba dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ltar gsal ba tha dad ba rnams spyi dang 'brel pa de bzhin du spyi'i tha mi dad pa yang gsal ba dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: just as the individual things, which are different, are related to the universal, so the universal, which is not different from them, is related to the individual things.

original: tha mi dad na ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: tha mi dad na ci skyon snyam na /
translated: If you think that there is no fault in their non-difference,

original: des na zhes bya ba ste gsal ba tha mi dad pas na /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ste gsal ba tha mi dad pas na /
translated: then the reply is: “Therefore, etc.” Since the individual things are not different,

original: ba lang yang rta la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang yang rta la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: the cow would be the horse, etc.

original: ci ltar gsal ba tha mi dad snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar gsal ba tha mi dad snyam na /
translated: If you think that the individual things are not different,

original: ba lang nyid dang rta nyid la sogs pa gcig tu gyur pa'i spyi thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang nyid dang rta nyid la sogs pa gcig tu gyur pa'i spyi thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all universals, such as cowness and horseness, would be present in a single thing.

original: spyi rnams kyi phan tshun tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yang ldog pa nyid yin no zhes kho bo cag gis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi rnams kyi phan tshun tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yang ldog pa nyid yin no zhes kho bo cag gis brjod pa yin no //
translated: And we have already stated that the reason for the difference among universals is their exclusion.

original: khyed ni 'di sun 'byin par byed pas spyi rnams 'dres pa nyid du 'dod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: khyed ni 'di sun 'byin par byed pas spyi rnams 'dres pa nyid du 'dod par bya ba yin te /
translated: But you, by refuting that, would have to accept that universals are mixed together,

original: ma 'chol bar bsgrubs pa'i thabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'chol bar bsgrubs pa'i thabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no way to establish them without confusion.

original: des na spyi rnams de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba na /
analyzed: des na spyi rnams de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba na /
translated: Therefore, if universals were to become the nature of that,

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi spyi ni gcig kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi spyi ni gcig kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: the universal of the three worlds would be only one,

original: de yang gsal ba mtha' dag la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang gsal ba mtha' dag la gnas pa yin no //
translated: and it would be present in all the particulars.

original: des na ba lang yang rtar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ba lang yang rtar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, a cow would be a horse.

original: khyod kyi lugs kyis ni gang las spyi rnams tha dad par 'gyur ba gsal ba rnams kyang tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: khyod kyi lugs kyis ni gang las spyi rnams tha dad par 'gyur ba gsal ba rnams kyang tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: But in your system, the particulars are not different, from which the universals would be different.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Moreover,” is another point.

original: ba lang nyid kyi spyi ni khra bo la sogs pa'i ba lang nyid yin gyi dang pa la sogs pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: ba lang nyid kyi spyi ni khra bo la sogs pa'i ba lang nyid yin gyi dang pa la sogs pa ni ma yin la /
translated: The universal of cow is the cowness of a cow that is variegated and so on, but not of a horse and so on.

original: ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gsal ba rnams kyang phan tshun tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gsal ba rnams kyang phan tshun tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And the particulars, such as cow and horse, are not mutually different by way of their own characteristics.

original: khyad par ci lta bu dang ldan pa zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci lta bu dang ldan pa zhe na /
translated: What kind of difference do they have?

original: rang gi ngo bos rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa'o //
translated: They are of the same type or different types by way of their own natures.

original: gsal bdag ni spyi dag gi tha dad par byed pa yin par khyod 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: gsal bdag ni spyi dag gi tha dad par byed pa yin par khyod 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If you assert that the particulars are what make the universals different,

original: de dag kyang phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin na ci ltar tha dad par byed pa yin /
analyzed: de dag kyang phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin na ci ltar tha dad par byed pa yin /
translated: then since they are not mutually different, how can they make the universals different?

original: gsal ba rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis tha dad na ni thug pa med do //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis tha dad na ni thug pa med do //
translated: If the particulars are different by way of their own natures, there is an infinite regress.

original: rang gi ngo bos tha dad na spyi dag kyang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos tha dad na spyi dag kyang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are different by way of their own natures, the universals would be the same.

original: des na gsal ba tha dad pa dang ldan pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: des na gsal ba tha dad pa dang ldan pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Therefore what is the use of the particulars having difference?

original: 'on te gsal ba rnams ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ngo bos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba rnams ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ngo bos ma yin pa'o //
translated: But if the manifestations are by their own nature, then it is not by the nature of another.

original: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “Well then.”

original: spyi khas blangs @143b kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: spyi khas blangs @143b kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The argument is “Even though you accept the universal,” and so on.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'o //
translated: “ That itself” means the different individual natures.

original: ha cang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ha cang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “ Too much” is the response.

original: gal te gsal ba rnams rang gi ngo bos tha dad na spyis ci bya /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba rnams rang gi ngo bos tha dad na spyis ci bya /
translated: If the manifestations are different by their own nature, what is the use of the universal?

original: spyi tha dad pa ni gsal ba tha dad ba'i rgyur 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: spyi tha dad pa ni gsal ba tha dad ba'i rgyur 'dod pa yin na /
translated: The difference of the universal is asserted to be the cause of the difference of the manifestations.

original: de tha dad pa yang rnam pa gzhan du grub pa des na spyi ni brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de tha dad pa yang rnam pa gzhan du grub pa des na spyi ni brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: But that difference is established in another way. Therefore the universal should not be imagined.

original: de ltar ngo bos tha dad yod min na //
analyzed: de ltar ngo bos tha dad yod min na //
translated: Thus, since there is no difference by nature,

original: zhes bya ba bshad nas phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i don du grub pa nye bar 'jog pa'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad nas phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i don du grub pa nye bar 'jog pa'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Having explained that, in order to explain the second half, he anticipates the response that posits the establishment:

original: 'on te spyi ni rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba de gsal ba tha dad pa las ni ma yin ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te spyi ni rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba de gsal ba tha dad pa las ni ma yin ba'o //
translated: But if you say that the universal is not different from the particulars, then it is not different from the particulars.

original: gal te spyi rnams kyi tha dad pa gsal ba tha dad pas yin na de'i tshe grub pa nye bar 'jog par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te spyi rnams kyi tha dad pa gsal ba tha dad pas yin na de'i tshe grub pa nye bar 'jog par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the difference of the universals is due to the difference of the particulars, then you would be positing an established fact.

original: gang gi tshe spyi tha dad pa ni gsal ba rnams kyi tha dad par byad pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe spyi tha dad pa ni gsal ba rnams kyi tha dad par byad pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: But when the difference of the universals is due to the difference of the particulars,

original: ci ltar grub pa nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin /
analyzed: ci ltar grub pa nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin /
translated: how can you posit an established fact?

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe nyid su na 'byin pa'o //🔽gal te dkar po la sogs pa snam bu la sogs pa las tha dad bar rtogs na de'i tshe dkar po'i yon tan gzhan dang ldan pas snam bu dkar po zhes rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta na ni ma yin te snam bu dang dkar po
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe nyid su na 'byin pa'o // gal te dkar po la sogs pa snam bu la sogs pa las tha dad bar rtogs na de'i tshe dkar po'i yon tan gzhan dang ldan pas snam bu dkar po zhes rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta na ni ma yin te snam bu dang dkar po
translated: The example is refuted by the words “That is not so, etc.”

original: dag de'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag de'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you understand the white, etc. to be different from the cloth, etc., then you would understand the white cloth to be the cloth qualified by the quality of whiteness. But that is not so, because the cloth and the white are understood to be identical.

original: dpe sun phyung nas /
analyzed: dpe sun phyung nas /
translated: Having refuted the example,

original: don yang su na phyung ba nyid de rigs pa mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: don yang su na phyung ba nyid de rigs pa mtshungs pas so //
translated: The meaning is the same, because the reasoning is the same.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni snam bu la sogs pa las tha dad par ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni snam bu la sogs pa las tha dad par ro //
translated: “Only” means separate from cloth, etc.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog go //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog go //
translated: “That” means the color white, etc.

original: rang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni snam bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dpen par ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni snam bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dpen par ro //
translated: “By itself” means separate by the nature of cloth, etc.

original: dkar po la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: “White, etc.” is the commentary.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rdzas las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rdzas las so //
translated: “From that” means from the substance.

original: rtogs pa'i tshul brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i tshul brjod pa ni /
translated: The mode of understanding is stated:

original: rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: “By itself” is the subject.

original: dkar por ldan phyir snam bu ni dkar po yin zhes bya ba de la bzlog pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dkar por ldan phyir snam bu ni dkar po yin zhes bya ba de la bzlog pa brjod pa ni /
translated: “Because it possesses white, the cloth is white.” The reversal of that is stated:

original: de'i zhes bya ba ste kha dog de'i dkar po nyid ni rdzas la ltos nas yin no zhes bzlog par yang ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ste kha dog de'i dkar po nyid ni rdzas la ltos nas yin no zhes bzlog par yang ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: “From that” means from the color. Why wouldn’t the reversal be “The whiteness of that color is in dependence on the substance”?

original: de'i ni kha dog gi'o //
analyzed: de'i ni kha dog gi'o //
translated: “That” refers to the color.

original: gang yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni kha dog la rang bzhin 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni kha dog la rang bzhin 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is that? It means that color would have no intrinsic nature at all.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: But if you say that it is the substance itself that is white, then we reply:

original: gang gi tshe dkar po dang ldan pas rdzas dkar por brjod pa de'i tshe yang rdzas kyi rang gi ngo bo gang yin zhes brjod par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dkar po dang ldan pas rdzas dkar por brjod pa de'i tshe yang rdzas kyi rang gi ngo bo gang yin zhes brjod par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: When it is endowed with whiteness, the substance is called white. But at that time, what is the intrinsic nature of the substance?

original: dogs pa ni rdzas so zhes de ltar @144a * //
analyzed: dogs pa ni rdzas so zhes de ltar @144a * //
translated: The doubt is: Is it the substance itself?

original: rtogs pa ni rdzas kyi rang gi rang bzhin no zhen /
analyzed: rtogs pa ni rdzas kyi rang gi rang bzhin no zhen /
translated: The understanding is: The intrinsic nature of the substance is the substance itself.

original: rdzas zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: rdzas zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The reply is: The substance itself is also called white.

original: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs de dag las gzhan du'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs de dag las gzhan du'o //
translated: Apart from that is apart from those colors and shapes.

original: gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba'o //🔽dbyi bas khas blangs nas de las gzhan pa'i rdzas med par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba'o // dbyi bas khas blangs nas de las gzhan pa'i rdzas med par brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said is the conclusion.

original: da ni dbyibs kyang sun 'byin pa ni dbyibs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni dbyibs kyang sun 'byin pa ni dbyibs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now the refutation of shape: Shape also is not a substance.

original: rdzas kyang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: Substance is the substratum of form, etc.

original: ci ltar snang bar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar snang bar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How does it appear?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: 'o na de gzugs la sogs pa yon tan gyi yul can gyi ngo shes bas ni rdzas yul du byed pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na de gzugs la sogs pa yon tan gyi yul can gyi ngo shes bas ni rdzas yul du byed pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But it is not the case that the cognition of form, etc. as objects makes substance the object.

original: yon tan tsam ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yon tan tsam ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The phrase “merely the qualities” is stated.🔽If that were not so,

original: de lta ma yin na ni zhes bya ba ni yon tan tsam yul yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni zhes bya ba ni yon tan tsam yul yin na'o //
translated: if the object were merely the qualities,🔽then it would be so.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod snyam na reg pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod snyam na reg pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “the contact” is stated.

original: gang gi phyir yon tan tsam la ngo shes pa ma yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yon tan tsam la ngo shes pa ma yin pa des na'o //
translated: Because it is not the cognition of merely the qualities, that is why.

original: don la ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: don la ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pa la'o //
translated: The phrase “in reality” refers to the substratum of form, etc.

original: ci ltar ngo shes pa med snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: ci ltar ngo shes pa med snyam du dogs na /
translated: How is it that there is no cognition?

original: rgyu med pas zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu med pas zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The phrase “because of the absence of a cause” is stated.

original: dran pa med par zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dran pa med par zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase “without memory” is stated.

original: sngar gyi mthong ba'i spyod yul ma dran pa'i skyes bu la ni ngo shes pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi mthong ba'i spyod yul ma dran pa'i skyes bu la ni ngo shes pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: For a person who does not recall the object of former perception, there is no recognition.

original: des na yan lag can la yang ngo shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi dran pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ci ltar ngo shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na yan lag can la yang ngo shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi dran pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ci ltar ngo shes par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, since the whole also has no cause for the characteristic of memory, which is preceded by recognition, how can there be recognition?

original: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa la tha dad pa'i nyams su myong ba'i yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa la tha dad pa'i nyams su myong ba'i yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if the existence of the form, etc., is the experience of the difference,🔽how can there be no recognition because of the absence of that former memory?🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”

original: des ci ltar sngar gyi dran pa de med pa'i phyir ngo shes par med par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: des ci ltar sngar gyi dran pa de med pa'i phyir ngo shes par med par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: The response is “No, because . . . ”

original: re zhig ces bya ba'o //🔽reg pa'i rnam par shes pa la yang bum pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i nyams su snang ba ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba'o // reg pa'i rnam par shes pa la yang bum pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i nyams su snang ba ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The response is “No, because . . . ”

original: ci'i phyir mi snang snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi snang snyam na /
translated: The response is “No, because . . . ”

original: dang po ni zhes bya ba'o //🔽yan lag tsam ni gyo mo la sogs pa'i yan lag gang yang rung ba tsam mo //
analyzed: dang po ni zhes bya ba'o //🔽yan lag tsam ni gyo mo la sogs pa'i yan lag gang yang rung ba tsam mo //
translated: The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”🔽The response is “No, because . . . ”

original: yan lag tsam snang ba na yang lag can yang snang ngo snyam na /
analyzed: yan lag tsam snang ba na yang lag can yang snang ngo snyam na /
translated: If you think that when the mere parts are seen, the whole is also seen,

original: de ni zhes bya ba ste yan lag tsam mo //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ste yan lag tsam mo //
translated: then it is said, “that” is the mere parts.

original: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi rang bzhin nyid do //🔽yan lag tsam de nyid bum pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi rang bzhin nyid do // yan lag tsam de nyid bum pa yin no zhe na /
translated: “Just like that” means the nature of the parts.🔽If you think that the mere parts are the pot,

original: de ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: de ni zhes smos so //
translated: then it is said, “that” is the mere parts.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyogs kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, “because of the directions.”

original: gal te yan lag yan lag can yin na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag yan lag can yin na /
translated: If the parts are the whole,

original: 'o na bum pa gzugs yin par 'gyur ro zhen /
analyzed: 'o na bum pa gzugs yin par 'gyur ro zhen /
translated: then the pot would be form.

original: gzugs tsam yang zhes bya @144b ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs tsam yang zhes bya @144b ba'o //
translated: It is said, “mere form.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, “because of form.”

original: 'o na de'i dus na yod pa'i ngo shes pa la snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i dus na yod pa'i ngo shes pa la snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that at that time, the object of recognition appears,

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then it is said, “at that time.”

original: dang po gzugs tsam snang ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: dang po gzugs tsam snang ba'i dus na'o //
translated: At the time when mere form is seen.

original: shes pa ni nyams su myong ba gnyis las byung bas na dang po nyams su myong ba'i dus nyid du ni 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa ni nyams su myong ba gnyis las byung bas na dang po nyams su myong ba'i dus nyid du ni 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Since consciousness arises from the experience of two things, it does not arise at the time of the experience of the first.

original: gal te dang po yan lag dang yon tan dag mthong ba yan lag can mi snang na /
analyzed: gal te dang po yan lag dang yon tan dag mthong ba yan lag can mi snang na /
translated: If the possessor is not seen when the parts and qualities are seen first,

original: 'o na yan lag gzhan la sogs pa mthong bas na snang ba yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'o na yan lag gzhan la sogs pa mthong bas na snang ba yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: then it is thought that it is seen when the other parts, etc. are seen.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is “Or else. . .

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni yan lag dang po mthong ba'i phyis kyi tshe'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni yan lag dang po mthong ba'i phyis kyi tshe'o //
translated: ” “At that time” means after the first part is seen.

original: phyogs gcig nyid gzhan zhes bya ba ni yan lag gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig nyid gzhan zhes bya ba ni yan lag gzhan nyid do //
translated: “Just one part is different” means the other parts.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i yan lag can dang dbyibs ni 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i yan lag can dang dbyibs ni 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The possessor and shape, which are not different from form, etc., are not apprehended.

original: yon tan las ma gtogs pa'i yan lag can yang snang ba med do zhes brjod pa ni de bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan las ma gtogs pa'i yan lag can yang snang ba med do zhes brjod pa ni de bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement “The possessor, which is not different from the qualities, is not seen” is “It is the same. . .

original: yon tan gzhan la yang 'dzin pa srid pa na yan lag can dang dbyibs dag la ni 'dzin pa srid pa ma yin no zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: yon tan gzhan la yang 'dzin pa srid pa na yan lag can dang dbyibs dag la ni 'dzin pa srid pa ma yin no zhes sbyar te /
translated: ” Since the apprehension of the other qualities is possible, the possessor and shape are not apprehended.

original: gzugs 'dzin pa'i rjes thogs su yan lag can 'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin pa'i rjes thogs su yan lag can 'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that after the apprehension of the whole, there is no apprehension of the parts.

original: 'on te yan lag dang yon tan gzhan rnams dran pa dang lhan cig pa'i ngo shes pa las yan lag ngo shes pa yin no zhe na zhig na'ang zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'on te yan lag dang yon tan gzhan rnams dran pa dang lhan cig pa'i ngo shes pa las yan lag ngo shes pa yin no zhe na zhig na'ang zhes smos so //
translated: But if the recognition of the parts is from the recognition that is simultaneous with the memory of the other parts and qualities, then the author says, “Even then . . .

original: yan lag dang yon tan gzhan bkar ba na yan lag can zhig pa mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag dang yon tan gzhan bkar ba na yan lag can zhig pa mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: ” When the parts and other qualities are recalled, the destruction of the whole is not seen.

original: des na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma mthong ba la /
analyzed: des na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma mthong ba la /
translated: Therefore, when the characteristic of the object is not seen,

original: yan lag sogs pa de rnams la yang yan lag can no snyam pa'i dran par 'gyur ba yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: yan lag sogs pa de rnams la yang yan lag can no snyam pa'i dran par 'gyur ba yang gang zhig yin /
translated: what is the memory of the whole, etc., in regard to those parts, etc.?

original: 'dis ni yul tha dad pa can gyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba nyid du ma grub po zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni yul tha dad pa can gyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba nyid du ma grub po zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that it is not established that the whole, etc., are the objects apprehended by consciousnesses that have different objects.

original: rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis ni bzlog pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis ni bzlog pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: Another inference proves that the whole, etc., do not exist.

original: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: because it is preceded by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag las ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag las ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “From inference” means

original: de'i phyir rgyu med pa'i phyir ram rnam pa gzhan du yang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med pa'i phyir ram rnam pa gzhan du yang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, because there is no cause, or for some other reason,

original: yan lag can la ni ngo shes pa yod pa ma yin te /🔽des na de gzung bar bya ba yul tha dad pa can gyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba nyid na ma grub po zhes bya ba dang / de'i zhar la yan lag can ni snang ba mi dmigs pas gnod @145a * //
analyzed: yan lag can la ni ngo shes pa yod pa ma yin te / des na de gzung bar bya ba yul tha dad pa can gyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba nyid na ma grub po zhes bya ba dang / de'i zhar la yan lag can ni snang ba mi dmigs pas gnod @145a * //
translated: there is no recognition of the whole.🔽Thus, it is not established that the whole is perceived by a consciousness that perceives different objects.

original: pa yin no zhes kyang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no zhes kyang bstan pa yin no //
translated: And in addition, it is shown that the whole is undermined by the non-apprehension of its appearance.

original: de bzhin yon tan gzhan la yang //🔽zhes 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin yon tan gzhan la yang // zhes 'chad pa ni /
translated: “The same applies to other qualities.”🔽This is explained as follows:

original: gang gi tshe bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “When a pot, etc.”

original: yan lag gzhan dang yon tan gzhan //
analyzed: yan lag gzhan dang yon tan gzhan //
translated: “Other parts, other qualities”

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mdun na gnas pa'i tshul gyis yan lag dang yon tan gzhan gzugs mthong ba de'i tshe yon tan dang yan lag gzhan zhes bya ba reg pa la sogs pa dang / pha rol dang dbus kyi yan lag rnams ma dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mdun na gnas pa'i tshul gyis yan lag dang yon tan gzhan gzugs mthong ba de'i tshe yon tan dang yan lag gzhan zhes bya ba reg pa la sogs pa dang / pha rol dang dbus kyi yan lag rnams ma dmigs pa dang /
translated: When you see the form of another part or quality of the vase in front of you, then you do not observe the other parts or qualities, such as tactility, and the parts of the vase in the distance and in the middle.

original: ci ltar yan lag can dmigs pa yin /
analyzed: ci ltar yan lag can dmigs pa yin /
translated: How can you observe the possessor of the parts?

original: yan lag can ni yon tan dang yan lag mtha' dag gis khyab par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: yan lag can ni yon tan dang yan lag mtha' dag gis khyab par byed pa yin la /
translated: The possessor of the parts is that which pervades all the parts and qualities.

original: de yang yon tan dang yan lag cung zad dmigs pa na dmigs par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang yon tan dang yan lag cung zad dmigs pa na dmigs par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: And how can you observe it when you observe only some of its qualities and parts?

original: de tsam nyid ni zhes bya ba ni yongs su mthong ba bzhin pa'i yon tan dang yan lag khyad par byed pa ni bum pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam nyid ni zhes bya ba ni yongs su mthong ba bzhin pa'i yon tan dang yan lag khyad par byed pa ni bum pa ma yin no //
translated: The mere collection of those is not the vase, because the vase is that which is distinguished by its qualities and parts as they are observed.

original: zhig na'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i don du brjod pa na /
analyzed: zhig na'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i don du brjod pa na /
translated: The meaning of the statement “Even if it were destroyed” and so on is expressed in the following.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Or” means “if.”

original: pha rol gyi yan lag dang gzugs mun khung du dran pa de dang lhan cig pa'i ngo shes pas so //
analyzed: pha rol gyi yan lag dang gzugs mun khung du dran pa de dang lhan cig pa'i ngo shes pas so //
translated: The memory of the limbs and form of the other person is recognized simultaneously with the recognition.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol gyi yan lag dang yon tan gzhan dran pa dang / da ltar ba'i 'dzin pa yod pa na ngo shes pa yin na /🔽'dis ni yan lag can ni yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol gyi yan lag dang yon tan gzhan dran pa dang / da ltar ba'i 'dzin pa yod pa na ngo shes pa yin na / 'dis ni yan lag can ni yod de /
translated: If at that time, when the memory of the other person’s limbs and qualities exists, there is an apprehension of the present, there is recognition.

original: yan lag rnams mi dbye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sgrub byed ma grub par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: yan lag rnams mi dbye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sgrub byed ma grub par brjod pa yin la /
translated: This shows that the proof, “The possessor of the parts exists because the parts are not apprehended separately,” is not established.

original: phan tshun zhes bya bas ni ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya bas ni ma nges pa'o //
translated: “Mutually” shows that it is indefinite.

original: ci ltar mi 'bral bar 'dzin pa'i tshad ma med snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi 'bral bar 'dzin pa'i tshad ma med snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that there is no valid cognition that apprehends without separation,

original: dbyer med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbyer med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “without being separated” is said.

original: tshu rol gyi yan lag rtogs pa'i dus na pha rol dang dbus kyi yan lag ma bzung ba dran pa'i rtogs pa dang pha rol dang dbus kyi yan lag gang yin pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i ngo shes pa'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshu rol gyi yan lag rtogs pa'i dus na pha rol dang dbus kyi yan lag ma bzung ba dran pa'i rtogs pa dang pha rol dang dbus kyi yan lag gang yin pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i ngo shes pa'i rtogs pa'o //
translated: When the parts of the near side are cognized, the parts of the far side and the middle are not apprehended. The cognition of memory is “The parts of the far side and the middle are just like these.” The cognition of recognition is “The parts of the far side and the middle are just these.”

original: 'jag rten ni gcig tu bum pa'i yan lag mthong nas de'i rjes thogs las logs gzhan du yang mthong ba na /🔽bum pa de nyid ma thong ngo zhes yan lag rnams la gcig nyid du nges par byed do //
analyzed: 'jag rten ni gcig tu bum pa'i yan lag mthong nas de'i rjes thogs las logs gzhan du yang mthong ba na / bum pa de nyid ma thong ngo zhes yan lag rnams la gcig nyid du nges par byed do //
translated: The world sees the parts of a pot separately, and then later sees them together.🔽Then, when it sees the parts separately again, it ascertains that the pot is one.

original: de dag so sor sgrub par byed par ma yin yang /
analyzed: de dag so sor sgrub par byed par ma yin yang /
translated: But it does not ascertain the pot in dependence on the collection of its parts.

original: tshogs pa sgrub byed ci ltar ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshogs pa sgrub byed ci ltar ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the collection is not the producer?

original: dran pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: “Memory, etc.”

original: mi 'bral bar grub pa so sor tshad ma ma yin yang tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na tshad ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /🔽gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'bral bar grub pa so sor tshad ma ma yin yang tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na tshad ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni / gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though the individual parts are not valid cognitions, the collection of them is a valid cognition.

original: lan ni nus pa tha dad par @145b gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: lan ni nus pa tha dad par @145b gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The response is: “There is no difference in their power.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽der zhes bya ba ni gdung ma 'degs pa de la so sor nus pa med pa de rnams tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / der zhes bya ba ni gdung ma 'degs pa de la so sor nus pa med pa de rnams tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: Why is there no difference in their power?🔽The response is: “Because they do not have the power to raise the beam.”

original: nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The parts do not have the power to raise the beam individually, but when they are assembled, they have the power to raise the beam.

original: 'dir yang da bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang da bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Here, too, the same thing will happen.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, too, means in the case of the cognition of the whole.

original: dogs pa bsu pa ni /
analyzed: dogs pa bsu pa ni /
translated: The anticipation of an objection:

original: yan lag ces bya ba ste /🔽ngo shes pa dang yan lag dag gis so //
analyzed: yan lag ces bya ba ste / ngo shes pa dang yan lag dag gis so //
translated: The limbs, etc.

original: yan lag can rtogs pa skyed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag can rtogs pa skyed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cognition of the whole is produced by recognition and the limbs.

original: de las zhes bya ba ngo shes pa dang dran pa las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa gsum pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ngo shes pa dang dran pa las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa gsum pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From that, etc. means that there is no third cognition other than recognition and memory.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: But, etc. anticipates an objection.

original: nges pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni yan lag can yod do zhes bya ba de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni yan lag can yod do zhes bya ba de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The nature of certainty means the certainty that has the nature of the cognition of the existence of the whole.

original: tshad ma yin pa las zhes bya ba ni rigs la gcig gi tshig ste /
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa las zhes bya ba ni rigs la gcig gi tshig ste /
translated: From valid cognition means that the word “valid cognition” is used for a class.

original: dran pa dang ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa dag las yan lag can gyi des pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni ma nges pa ma yin pa kho na'o//
analyzed: dran pa dang ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa dag las yan lag can gyi des pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni ma nges pa ma yin pa kho na'o//
translated: The certainty of the whole that arises from memory and recognition, which are not valid cognitions, is not uncertain.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na tshad ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na tshad ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why? Because of valid cognition.

original: ci'i phyir 'di las nges ba ma yin snyam na tshad ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di las nges ba ma yin snyam na tshad ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is it not ascertained from this? It is called a valid cognition.

original: gal te tshad ma kho na las nges kyi tshad ma ma yin pa las ni ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma kho na las nges kyi tshad ma ma yin pa las ni ma yin na /
translated: If it is ascertained only from a valid cognition, not from a non-valid cognition,

original: de lta na tshad ma don dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na tshad ma don dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: then a valid cognition would have a purpose.

original: rjes dpag las ni rtogs pa gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes dpag las ni rtogs pa gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes pa'o //
translated: In order to explain the meaning of that which is understood from inference, he anticipates an objection with But if...

original: bum ba chu skyor bar mthong nas /
analyzed: bum ba chu skyor bar mthong nas /
translated: Having seen a pot carrying water,

original: 'og gi yan lag rjes su dpog par byed la /
analyzed: 'og gi yan lag rjes su dpog par byed la /
translated: one infers the lower part.

original: de rjes su dpag pa na yang /
analyzed: de rjes su dpag pa na yang /
translated: And when inferring that,

original: mthong bzhin pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de ma mthong ba 'di gcig nyid du ni de ni 'di yin no snyam pa'i ngo shes pa las yin te /
analyzed: mthong bzhin pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de ma mthong ba 'di gcig nyid du ni de ni 'di yin no snyam pa'i ngo shes pa las yin te /
translated: it is from the recognition That which is seen as a part is not seen here, thinking That is this.

original: de lta ma yin na mus la 'pho bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mus la 'pho bar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, it would be transferred to the end,

original: yan lag rnams ni g-yo ba dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag rnams ni g-yo ba dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the parts have movement.

original: gcig nyid du ngo shes pa ni yan lag rnams nyid yin par yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gcig nyid du ngo shes pa ni yan lag rnams nyid yin par yang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that the very parts are recognized as one.

original: des na shugs kyis yan lag can nyid rnam par gnas pas de ltar yan lag can 'grub bo //
analyzed: des na shugs kyis yan lag can nyid rnam par gnas pas de ltar yan lag can 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since the possessor of parts is established by implication, the possessor of parts is thus established.

original: gal te gcig tu ngo shes par byas pa ni yan lag rnams kho na yin gyi yan lag can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gcig tu ngo shes par byas pa ni yan lag rnams kho na yin gyi yan lag can ni ma yin no //
translated: If the parts alone are recognized as one, but the possessor of parts is not,

original: des na ci ltar de 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: des na ci ltar de 'grub snyam na /
translated: then how is the possessor of parts established?

original: yan lag dag ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: yan lag dag ni zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “The parts themselves.”

original: grub ba'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te /🔽yan lag gzhan nges par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyis 'brel ba grub pa'i rtags @146a * //
analyzed: grub ba'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te / yan lag gzhan nges par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyis 'brel ba grub pa'i rtags @146a * //
translated: The meaning of the conclusion is this:

original: las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Inference that ascertains other parts is produced from a reason that is established by direct perception.

original: mngon sum yang yan lag nyid 'dzin par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: mngon sum yang yan lag nyid 'dzin par byed pa yin pas /
translated: Direct perception also apprehends the parts themselves.

original: de ci ltar yan lag can 'grub ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ci ltar yan lag can 'grub ces bya ba'o //
translated: How is the possessor of parts established?

original: ngo shes pa las gcig tu rtogs pa'i phyir yan lag can rtogs pa yin te zhes gang brjod pa de yang sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: ngo shes pa las gcig tu rtogs pa'i phyir yan lag can rtogs pa yin te zhes gang brjod pa de yang sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: He says, “Because of the recognition of one.”

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore.

original: gzhan du ste tha dad par mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i dngos po la gcig tu ngo shes pa las gyur pa gang yin pa de rtogs pa'i lam du mod la ci ltar byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du ste tha dad par mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i dngos po la gcig tu ngo shes pa las gyur pa gang yin pa de rtogs pa'i lam du mod la ci ltar byed par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be that what is seen by direct perception as different is made into one by recognition?

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tha dad par ro gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad par ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tha dad par ro gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad par ro //
translated: In another way means as different. In another way means as non-different.

original: gal te mngon sum gzhan gyis gzhan du mi byed na de'i tshe ngo shes pa yang mngon sum nyid yin pas /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gzhan gyis gzhan du mi byed na de'i tshe ngo shes pa yang mngon sum nyid yin pas /
translated: If one direct perception does not make another direct perception into something else, then recognition is also direct perception.

original: ci ltar gzhan gyis gzhan du byed snyam du dogs pa ni /
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan gyis gzhan du byed snyam du dogs pa ni /
translated: How could one make another into something else?

original: ngo shes pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo shes pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Recognition is also.

original: mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: It is not direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rjes su zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'jug pa yang pha rol po nyid 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'jug pa yang pha rol po nyid 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The object of inference is also accepted by the opponent.

original: 'on te de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'on te de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: If one says, “At that time,” and so on.

original: gzhan dag ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul la zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i yul la zhes so //🔽gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'jug kyang ngo shes pas gcig nyid sgrub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul la zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i yul la zhes so // gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'jug kyang ngo shes pas gcig nyid sgrub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The other is the object of inference, that is, the object of memory.🔽If it is the object of inference, it is established as one by recognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That inference, too, is not a single entity.

original: du ma'i ni yan lag du ma'i'o //
analyzed: du ma'i ni yan lag du ma'i'o //
translated: It has many parts, because it has many parts.

original: gal te yan lag du ma'i yul can nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag du ma'i yul can nyid yin na /
translated: If it has many parts,

original: ci ltar ngo shes pa gcig nyid nye bar ston pas tha snyad kyi rgyu yin snyam du dogs pa ni /
analyzed: ci ltar ngo shes pa gcig nyid nye bar ston pas tha snyad kyi rgyu yin snyam du dogs pa ni /
translated: how can it be the cause of conventional usage, since it is taught as a single recognition?

original: ngo shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is:

original: lan ni tshad ma nyid kyis tha snyad kyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs yin no //
analyzed: lan ni tshad ma nyid kyis tha snyad kyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs yin no //
translated: The cause of conventional usage is valid cognition.

original: tshad ma nyid ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it valid cognition?

original: tshad ma nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is valid cognition, because it is inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pas so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pas so //
translated: It is inference, because it is the inference of that nature.

original: gal te gcig nyid kyi tha snyad grub pa la rjes su dpag pa tshol na de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo shes pas yan lag can 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gcig nyid kyi tha snyad grub pa la rjes su dpag pa tshol na de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo shes pas yan lag can 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you seek to establish the convention of oneness by means of inference, then the whole would be established by the recognition of the nature of the inference.

original: snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “Well then” anticipates an objection.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan gyi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan gyi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the reply beginning with “No” is as follows.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa ni /
translated: The inference of its nature

original: don dam pa'i gcig nyid kyi phul can ma yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam pa'i gcig nyid kyi phul can ma yin gyi /
translated: is not the best for ultimate oneness.

original: 'on kyang brtags pa'i gcig gi yul can yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang brtags pa'i gcig gi yul can yin la /
translated: However, it has as its object the one that is imagined.

original: khyed kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i yan lag can ni don dam pa'i gcig @146b yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i yan lag can ni don dam pa'i gcig @146b yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But the whole that you seek to prove is ultimately one.

original: brtags pa'i gcig nyid ston pa ni don de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i gcig nyid ston pa ni don de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of imagined oneness is “that object.”

original: btso ba dang sreg par byed pa nyid kyis mthong ba dang / rig pa dag la gcig nyid du nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: btso ba dang sreg par byed pa nyid kyis mthong ba dang / rig pa dag la gcig nyid du nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: It is designated as one in terms of seeing and awareness by the act of cooking and burning.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pas nye bar bstan pa'i gzugs dang reg pa'i shes pas nye bar bstan pa'i reg pa nyid gcig tu bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pas nye bar bstan pa'i gzugs dang reg pa'i shes pas nye bar bstan pa'i reg pa nyid gcig tu bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The form that is indicated by the cognition that accomplishes it and the contact that is indicated by the cognition of contact are to be established as one.

original: sngar mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid mi slu ba'i rang bzhin don bya ba'i shes pas reg par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid mi slu ba'i rang bzhin don bya ba'i shes pas reg par bya ba yin te /
translated: That which was seen before is the very thing that is contacted by the cognition of the nature of non-deception, which accomplishes the object,

original: sreg pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa'i phyir sngon mthong ba'i me bzhin no zhes nye bar btags pa'i gcig nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sreg pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa'i phyir sngon mthong ba'i me bzhin no zhes nye bar btags pa'i gcig nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: just as the fire that was seen before is the very thing that performs the function of burning, etc. Thus, the establishment of identity is by way of designation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thog ma med pa'i bag chags zhes lan 'debs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thog ma med pa'i bag chags zhes lan 'debs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the answer is: “beginningless imprints.”

original: don bya ba gcig pa nyid kyang lhag par zhen par gcig pa las yin no //
analyzed: don bya ba gcig pa nyid kyang lhag par zhen par gcig pa las yin no //
translated: The identity of the object to be accomplished is due to the identity of the adherence.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni tha snyad bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul me la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni tha snyad bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul me la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “In that” refers to fire, etc., the object of the inference that establishes convention.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Not ultimately” means not by way of identity.

original: gal te sngar mthong ba dang mthong bzhin pa don dam par gcig ma yin na ci ltar don bya ba 'grub /
analyzed: gal te sngar mthong ba dang mthong bzhin pa don dam par gcig ma yin na ci ltar don bya ba 'grub /
translated: If what was seen previously and what is seen now are not ultimately one, how can an object be accomplished?

original: des na don dam pa'i gcig nyid rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul yin no snyam na /
analyzed: des na don dam pa'i gcig nyid rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul yin no snyam na /
translated: Therefore, the ultimate oneness is the domain of inference.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste sngar mthong ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste sngar mthong ba nyid kyis so //
translated: “By that itself” means by what was seen previously.

original: dogs pa ni dngos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni dngos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Fearing” is “doubting.”

original: sangs rgyas pa la don dam pa pa'i gcig med pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la don dam pa pa'i gcig med pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If the ultimate oneness does not exist for the Buddhist, the designation is not tenable.

original: dngos med kyang nye bar 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod ngo zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dngos med kyang nye bar 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod ngo zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The response is that even the nonexistence of an entity is a reason for designation.

original: thog ma med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Since beginningless time” is the reason.

original: gal te yang dngos kyi gcig nyid nye bar 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa de lta na yang rnam pa gcig tu snang ba'i shes pa bag chags nyid rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: gal te yang dngos kyi gcig nyid nye bar 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa de lta na yang rnam pa gcig tu snang ba'i shes pa bag chags nyid rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: Even if the ultimate oneness is not the reason for the designation of an entity, still the consciousness appearing as one aspect is the reason for the designation of the entity.

original: de yang gcig tu snang ba'i shes pa snga ma las yin no //
analyzed: de yang gcig tu snang ba'i shes pa snga ma las yin no //
translated: And that is due to a previous consciousness appearing as one.

original: des na 'di yan chad kyis ni dngos kyi gcig med kyang nye bar btags pa rgyu mtshan dang bcas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di yan chad kyis ni dngos kyi gcig med kyang nye bar btags pa rgyu mtshan dang bcas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, up to this point, the non-existence of an entity has been taught, along with the designation based on a reason.

original: da ni dngos po sngon du 'gro ba can gyi nye bar btags pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: da ni dngos po sngon du 'gro ba can gyi nye bar btags pa ston pa ni /
translated: Now, the designation based on a prior entity is taught:

original: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: or.🔽🔽

original: dang po me mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid la 'jig rten gyis reg par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po me mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid la 'jig rten gyis reg par brjod pa yin no //
translated: the world speaks of contact in relation to that very first seeing of fire.

original: gal te yang de la gcig nyid yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: gal te yang de la gcig nyid yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang /
translated: Even though there is no oneness in that,

original: gcig nyid dang gcig nyid kyi sgra grags pas dngos yin par brjod la /🔽dus gzhan du ni sngar @147a * //
analyzed: gcig nyid dang gcig nyid kyi sgra grags pas dngos yin par brjod la / dus gzhan du ni sngar @147a * //
translated: one speaks of an entity based on the expression “oneness” and the word “one.”

original: mthong ba'i gcig pa nyid dang lhag par sgro btags pa las te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i gcig pa nyid dang lhag par sgro btags pa las te /
translated: At another time, one speaks of oneness based on the superimposition of oneness seen previously.

original: lhag par zhen pas gcig nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: lhag par zhen pas gcig nyid du brjod do //
translated: One speaks of oneness based on the superimposition of oneness.

original: gang zhig la zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig la zhe na /
translated: In relation to what?

original: don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po la'o //
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po la'o //
translated: In relation to an entity that performs a function.

original: ci ltar yod pa ma yin pa lhag par sgro 'dogs snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar yod pa ma yin pa lhag par sgro 'dogs snyam na /
translated: How is there a superimposition of non-existence?

original: nyer btags las te /
analyzed: nyer btags las te /
translated: From a designation.

original: btags nas so //
analyzed: btags nas so //
translated: Having designated, it is so.🔽This teaches the reasoning that goes:

original: 'dis ni / don med na yang gang la ni //
analyzed: 'dis ni / don med na yang gang la ni //
translated: Even if the object does not exist, in regard to what

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: does the designation exist?

original: gang gi phyir de ltar chos dang chos can gyi dngos po don dam pa par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir ro //🔽chos dang chos can dag ces bya ba ni byas pa dang sgra dag gam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar chos dang chos can gyi dngos po don dam pa par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir ro // chos dang chos can dag ces bya ba ni byas pa dang sgra dag gam /
translated: Because the state of affairs of the property and the possessor of the property is not tenable in an ultimate sense.

original: gzugs dang bum pa dag de nyid dang gzhan nyid du zhes tha mi dad pa dang tha dad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang bum pa dag de nyid dang gzhan nyid du zhes tha mi dad pa dang tha dad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The so-called property and the possessor of the property are either the produced and sound, or form and pot. They are not different, but are different.

original: gal te 'di dag tha mi dad pa nyid du mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag tha mi dad pa nyid du mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: If they are not seen to be non-different,

original: de ji ltar tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yin zhe na /
translated: how are they different and non-different?

original: ldog pa zhes bya ba tha dad pa kun brtags pa las de nyid dang gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa zhes bya ba tha dad pa kun brtags pa las de nyid dang gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: Difference is the imagined difference called “exclusion.” They are different in being the same and different.

original: de lta ma yin na de nyid kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de nyid kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, they would be the same.

original: sgra las byas pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams sam gzugs dang ro la sogs pa las bum pa la sogs pa'i chos can rnams tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra las byas pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams sam gzugs dang ro la sogs pa las bum pa la sogs pa'i chos can rnams tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the properties such as being produced, etc. are not different from sound, and the properties such as pot, etc. are not different from form, taste, etc.🔽Why do you think that it does not exist in entities?

original: ci'i phyir dngos po la med snyam na de kho nar ni zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos po la med snyam na de kho nar ni zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In reality” means “in truth.”

original: 'o na ci ltar tha dad snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar tha dad snyam na /
translated: How then is it different?

original: tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Difference” means “differentiation.”

original: dbye ba ci ltar don dam ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbye ba ci ltar don dam ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is that differentiation not ultimate?

original: dbye ba de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbye ba de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “That differentiation” means “the differentiation of the ultimate.”

original: de zhes bya ba mngon sum sngon du song ba can dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa las so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba mngon sum sngon du song ba can dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa las so //
translated: “From that” means “from inference preceded by perception and engaged in the power of fact.”

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ngag gis ni chos dang chos can dag tha dad par grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ngag gis ni chos dang chos can dag tha dad par grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that perception and inference engaged in the power of fact do not establish the difference of the property and the subject.

original: 'o na brtags pa'i dbye ba yang ci ltar 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na brtags pa'i dbye ba yang ci ltar 'grub snyam na /
translated: How then is the differentiation of the imagined established?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “However” means “nevertheless.”

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid reg pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid reg pa yin te /
translated: And it has already been demonstrated that inference is just the perception of that which is to be inferred.

original: bya ba gcig byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bya ba gcig byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin pa kho na'o //
translated: Because it performs a single action.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni brtags pa'o //
translated: The so-called identity and difference are just imputations.

original: de lta bur gyur ma grub phyir te ma dmigs pa'i phyir na de nyid gzhan nyid 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ma grub phyir te ma dmigs pa'i phyir na de nyid gzhan nyid 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are not established as such, since they are not perceived, identity and difference are refuted.

original: yul gang la zhe na /🔽don dam par ni rnam dpyad na kun rdzob pa la ste /
analyzed: yul gang la zhe na / don dam par ni rnam dpyad na kun rdzob pa la ste /
translated: With regard to what object?🔽In the ultimate, when there is an analysis, with regard to the conventional.

original: kun rdzob pa don dam par rnam par dpyad pa gang yin pa de dag la ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa don dam par rnam par dpyad pa gang yin pa de dag la ste /
translated: Those who analyze the conventional in the ultimate

original: don 'di dag ni kun rdzob pa kho na yin gyi don dam pa'i rang bzhin @147b ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: don 'di dag ni kun rdzob pa kho na yin gyi don dam pa'i rang bzhin @147b ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: These objects are just conventional, they are not the nature of the ultimate.

original: gal te de nyid dang gzhan nyid du khas len na khyed nam mkha'i gos can gyi lugs kyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de nyid dang gzhan nyid du khas len na khyed nam mkha'i gos can gyi lugs kyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na / don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you accept identity and difference, you would be following the system of the sky clad ones.🔽In the ultimate,

original: don dam pa par ni tha mi dad la /
analyzed: don dam pa par ni tha mi dad la /
translated: in the ultimate, there is no difference.

original: brtags pa pa ni tha dad yin no zhes bya bar ni nam mkha'i gos can 'dod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sangs rgyas pa kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa pa ni tha dad yin no zhes bya bar ni nam mkha'i gos can 'dod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sangs rgyas pa kho na'i yin no //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas do not say that the sky-clad are different, but rather that they are Buddhists.

original: 'o na nam mkha'i gos can gyi 'dod pa ci 'dra pa zhig yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na nam mkha'i gos can gyi 'dod pa ci 'dra pa zhig yin snyam na /
translated: What is the belief of the sky-clad then?

original: 'on kyang gnyi ga zhes bya ba ste tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnyi ga zhes bya ba ste tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: But both, i.e., different and not different.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar don dam par tha dad pa med pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar don dam par tha dad pa med pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because in reality they are not different.

original: dpag bya mi rtag pa nyid dang dpag par byed pa rtag pa dang don chos can te /
analyzed: dpag bya mi rtag pa nyid dang dpag par byed pa rtag pa dang don chos can te /
translated: The object to be inferred is impermanence, and the inferring is permanence.

original: 'di dag gi bsgrub bya nyid la sogs pa'i tha snyad gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di dag gi bsgrub bya nyid la sogs pa'i tha snyad gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: The designation of these as probandum, etc.,

original: ldog pa la brten pas rnam par rtog pas grub pa la brten nas brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa la brten pas rnam par rtog pas grub pa la brten nas brtags pa yin no //
translated: is based on exclusion, and is posited in dependence on conceptual construction.

original: shes pa ma grub tha dad la //
analyzed: shes pa ma grub tha dad la //
translated: In the case of cognition, which is not established as different,

original: brten nas zhes bya ba ma rtogs pa'i /
analyzed: brten nas zhes bya ba ma rtogs pa'i /
translated: the designation of “based on” is not understood.

original: rnam 'grel 'di nyid 'di snyam du gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas kha bskangs te rtsod pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'di snyam du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel 'di nyid 'di snyam du gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas kha bskangs te rtsod pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'di snyam du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This very commentary is a dispute, beginning with “If it is thought,” etc., and it is said that it is “thought” in this way.

original: gal te don dam pa pa'i tha dad pa med na de'i tshe ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te don dam pa pa'i tha dad pa med na de'i tshe ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: If there is no ultimate difference, then how, etc., is applied.

original: shes pa la grub tha dad pa //
analyzed: shes pa la grub tha dad pa //
translated: The difference is established in consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The commentary on just that is stated.

original: ldog pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By the exclusion, etc.

original: 'on te sangs rgyas pas 'di 'dra ba'i tha dad pa la brten pas bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o snyam na /🔽kun rdzob pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas pas 'di 'dra ba'i tha dad pa la brten pas bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o snyam na / kun rdzob pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if the Buddhist thinks that such a difference is not to be relied upon at all,🔽it is said, “in the conventional.”

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated: “in the conventional.”

original: don dam par ni tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la mi brten pa yang ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: don dam par ni tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la mi brten pa yang ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: But it is not that ultimate non-difference is not to be relied upon.

original: gal te kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag la gang rung zhig la brten par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag la gang rung zhig la brten par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the ultimate is based on the conventional,

original: kun rdzob kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is the conventional.

original: kun rdzob tu tha dad khas ma blangs na mi slu ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu tha dad khas ma blangs na mi slu ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not accept that the conventional is different, then it is not nondeceptive.

original: gal te bya ba la sogs pa'i chos 'ba' zhig 'dod kyi /
analyzed: gal te bya ba la sogs pa'i chos 'ba' zhig 'dod kyi /
translated: If you accept only the phenomena of action, etc.,

original: de dang de las log pa'i chos can sgra la sogs pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de dang de las log pa'i chos can sgra la sogs pa ni ma yin la /
translated: and not the subjects such as sound, etc., which are the negations of this and that,

original: de bzhin du yan lag kho na 'dod kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yan lag don dam pa pa ni ma yin na de'i tshe mi slu bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag kho na 'dod kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yan lag don dam pa pa ni ma yin na de'i tshe mi slu bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and if you accept only the parts, and not the ultimate parts such as form, etc., then it is not nondeceptive.

original: byas pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / yan lag yan lag can ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / yan lag yan lag can ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the phenomena such as the produced, etc., and the parts and wholes do not exist.

original: de bzhin du gal te sgra la sogs pa'i chos can 'ba' zhig 'dod la /🔽de bzhin du yan lag dang reg pa la @148a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te sgra la sogs pa'i chos can 'ba' zhig 'dod la / de bzhin du yan lag dang reg pa la @148a * //
translated: Similarly, if you accept only the subjects such as sound, etc.,🔽and not the qualities such as the parts, contact, etc.,

original: sogs pa'i yon tan nyid 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: sogs pa'i yon tan nyid 'dod pa yin na /
translated: which are the negations of this and that,🔽then it is not nondeceptive.

original: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad dang / bdag gis mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid la reg go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad dang / bdag gis mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid la reg go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad med par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, there would be no conventions of inference and that which is to be inferred, and no conventions such as “I see that very thing that I touch.”

original: des na gnyi ga la nye bar len to //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga la nye bar len to //
translated: Therefore, both are appropriated.

original: gang gi phyir don dam par med pa de'i phyir gang gi tshe tha dad par sdang bar gyur pa de'i tshe de ni tha snyad kyi rten yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam par med pa de'i phyir gang gi tshe tha dad par sdang bar gyur pa de'i tshe de ni tha snyad kyi rten yin no //
translated: Because they do not exist ultimately, therefore, when they are different, they are the basis of conventions.

original: ci ltar snang ba gzhan gyi chos dang chos can la brten nas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin gyi de kho nar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar snang ba gzhan gyi chos dang chos can la brten nas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin gyi de kho nar ni ma yin no //
translated: As they appear, the probandum and the proof are established in dependence on the properties of other things and the property possessor, but not in reality.

original: don la mi slu ba ni 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: don la mi slu ba ni 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that nondeception with regard to the object is due to the connection.

original: de ltar gang la snang snyam na shes la ste rnam par rtog pa la'o //
analyzed: de ltar gang la snang snyam na shes la ste rnam par rtog pa la'o //
translated: If it is wondered what appears, it is in consciousness, that is, in conceptualization.

original: ci lta bu zhig la zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhig la zhe na /
translated: What kind of consciousness?

original: don gang gi bdag nyid gang zhig de lta bum yin pa las tha dad pa de'i mthar thug pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la'o //
analyzed: don gang gi bdag nyid gang zhig de lta bum yin pa las tha dad pa de'i mthar thug pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la'o //
translated: That which is the nature of a certain object is that which is different from that, and the cognition of the finality of that.🔽If it were not so,

original: de lta ma yin na ni zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i tha dad pa med na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i tha dad pa med na'o //
translated: that is, if there were no difference in the conceptualization,

original: de skad du yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bshad do //
translated: the master Dignaga would not have explained it that way.

original: skabs su bab pa la ni ldog pa tha dad pa yang med pa'i phyir ma grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa la ni ldog pa tha dad pa yang med pa'i phyir ma grub pa kho na'o //
translated: But in the present context, it is not established, because there is no difference in the negation.

original: gang gi phyir tha snyad du bzhag pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha snyad du bzhag pa'am /
translated: Because it is posited as a convention,

original: yang na tha snyad kyis bzhag pa sgra ni rtag ste zhes bya ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can de nyid sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes sgrub byed du byas pa yin no /
analyzed: yang na tha snyad kyis bzhag pa sgra ni rtag ste zhes bya ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can de nyid sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes sgrub byed du byas pa yin no /
translated: or because it is posited by convention, the sound is permanent, because the probandum, the subject, is sound itself.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig sgrub byed du byas she na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig sgrub byed du byas she na /
translated: What kind of probandum is it?

original: gang zhig tha dad pa'i blo dang ma 'brel pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhig tha dad pa'i blo dang ma 'brel pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which is not associated with a different cognition is called that.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nyid du byas pa'i rnam pa las rang bzhin gzhan gyis blo gzhan la gnas med pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nyid du byas pa'i rnam pa las rang bzhin gzhan gyis blo gzhan la gnas med pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the statement “The exclusion of what is other is not a different entity from the thing itself” is that the nature of the thing itself is not present in any other cognition.

original: tha dad pa'i blo dang ma 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i blo dang ma 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement “It is not associated with a different cognition” is that it is not associated with a different cognition.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par gcad par bya ba logs shig pa med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par gcad par bya ba logs shig pa med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since there is no separate object of exclusion,

original: rtogs par grub pa'i tha dad pa tsam yang med pa des na sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pas na /
analyzed: rtogs par grub pa'i tha dad pa tsam yang med pa des na sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pas na /
translated: the mere difference that is established by the cognition does not exist. Therefore, since the reason “because it is sound” is one part of the meaning of the thesis,

original: ma grub par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma grub par bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is unestablished.

original: gang gis 'di ma grub par 'gyur ba ci ltar na 'dir bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid sgrub par byed pa nyid du byas she na /
analyzed: gang gis 'di ma grub par 'gyur ba ci ltar na 'dir bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid sgrub par byed pa nyid du byas she na /
translated: How is it that the very thing to be established here is made into the proof?

original: log pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: log pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response is “because of the opposite.”

original: mi rtag pa dang byas pa'i sgra tha dad pas ni byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ldog pa tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang byas pa'i sgra tha dad pas ni byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ldog pa tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: The sound of impermanent and the sound of produced are not different in terms of the different characteristics of produced and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?
